story:
"THE NOISE UNDER" is NeoNoir/Cyberpunk.
That means ultra-capitalistic dystopia with credible high tech.
It's about moral dirt.
It's about networks, biotech and cybernetics.
It's about escape.
It's about raw and rusted aesthetic, not as an objective but as a consequence.
It's about surviving.
It's about do-it-yourself and recovery technology.
It's about necessity which knows no law.
It's about loneliness and death at every corner.
Unlike so much colourful-chromed-luminous cyberpunk RPGs,
"THE NOISE UNDER" is not cool.
It's bleak. It's rough.
It's do-or-die.
YBERIS cityscape (Concept art)

"THE NOISE UNDER": A NARRATIVE MMO RPG

Currently, a good adventure videogame means one single-player through one main story-line. If you want another story in the same setting, you have no choice but wait for the sequel, pay the full price and so on. No interactivity with others players. No re-use of your character attributes in the sequel. On the other hand, computer RPGs, mainly Third or First Person Shooter, are too focused on developing skills and accumulating items to the detriment of the richness and the complexity of stories. What are called "quests" are widely nothing but pretextes to hack and slash or to shoot-shoot-shoot. To top it all off, the social part is too constrained by Guilds.
Aas a matter of a fact, from our point of view, the most important has been lost: social interactivity while story-telling. In others words, today a video game player can not make his character grow in a story-telling oriented and persistent world.
Exactly the opposite of pen and paper RPGs.
YBERIS cityscape downtown (Concept art)

NARRATIVE: The heart of "THE NOISE UNDER", what will focus most of our efforts and be a big part of the budget, is what we call the adventures.
An adventure is an interactive fiction, as it exists in legacy pen and paper RPGs, with a strong storyline, great NPCs (some of them being recurring characters), goals and missions.
We structured three different lengths of adventure corresponding each to the time needed to achieve it: short, intermediate and long.
An adventure can be one-shot or it can be part of a series spanning several seasons (like tv programs).
The adventures will be created by our narrative team and published on the in-game adventure shop.
QAZ - "Babylon street" (Concept art)

RPG: "THE NOISE UNDER" is tactical, not based on physical reflexes. It's turn-based during interactions and fights.
No class system: you'll be what you do and the way you do it.
Your skills as well as your reputation will change according to your succeeded or failed past actions and will influence those to come, for better or for worse.
Your objective is to survive.

  • You'll need to eat, to rest in a safe place and to get healed.
  • You'll have to equip yourself.
  • You'll have to get people to teach you how to do things (crafting, hacking systems...).
  • ...

Most of the time, you'll be paying (in-game currency) for all of that. So you'll need to rent out your skills, to traffic and smuggle because the only way to make money is to dive into the underground economy.
QAZ - a back street (Concept art)

MMO: Your narrative experiences will take place in the backstreets and the cut throat bars of QAZ, in the ultraprotected arcologies of YBERIS, or in the devasted land of REB and its buried research labs.

  • Open world: The adventures you'll live will make you explore about 100km2 (size of the fully designed world, excluding the interiors). Private interiors will be accessible according to your skills, the adventures you lived or you're living.
  • Persistent world: The world will continue to evolve and to change even if you're not connected.
  • No PVP or PVE modes: Only one unique world in which things happen through adventures or not.
  • No guild system: If you want to build a team, you'll just have to hire team mates (NPCs or real players) or simply play with friends. You'll be able to share the same narrative experience through the cooperative adventures which have been designed for that purpose.
  • Continuity of game session: For example, you're will be able to start playing on your PC or MAC and continue your game session on your tablet. The only rupture will result from logout-login process. To benefit from this feature, you'll just have to install the relevant game client on both systems.
REB cityscape (Concept art)

Game views:

  • The game experience tends to get closer to real life tabletop RPGs sessions, so the views (except the Hacking view) will be tactical tabletop inspired.
  • The visual tests we've made absolutely convinced us that the aesthetics and the NeoNoir/Cyberpunk ambiance of "THE NOISE UNDER" (interiors, exteriors, characters) will be best rendered while using hand-drawn technics.
  • The game experience supposes a big urban territory which narrates the city and offers a wide range of locations, of characters, of situations to build exciting stories. Doing this using 3D is much more expensive (5 to 6 times), but provides nothing more to the most important: the adventures.

So, for those different reasons, the game views will be fully 2D.

Technology: Even if the game views are heavily 2D, "THE NOISE UNDER" application (composed by user-side and server-side softwares) will mainly rely on UNITY4, the fantastic game development framework.

Languages: From the first release, "THE NOISE UNDER" and all the adventures will be available in both English and French.

Hardware and O.S.: Windows, MacOsX, Linux, Android tablets, Ipad, thanks to UNITY4.
REB - a dangerous forsaken lab (Concept art)

WHY DO WE NEED YOUR SUPPORT?

"THE NOISE UNDER" concept is really new with a revolutionary narrative system (with the adventure shop and different types of adventures) and a gameplay which includes hacking, crafting and reputation features, all of that in a persistent world. The completed territory will be huge (about 100Km2), so will be the in-game Net. There will be a plenty of NPCs, locations, items. That means hours and hours of narrative experiences.
To keep the game as close as possible to the original concept, it is fundamental for us to have the last word, the "final cut" on the development, the graphical and gameplay decisions while keeping the deadlines in mind. We want to market the game at "the right price" and don't want to answer to anyone but you, the player-customer. So we decided to ask for support. With a crowdfunding campaign, we can ask directly to people, to players, to customers. You and us will be closer, the relationship will be more transparent by frequent reporting and showing on how the dev goes, more interesting by showing you the way we build the project.

"The Noise Under" will be membership-based. A membership will grant the member an access to 3 adventures to choose a month, whatever the length. The first release of "The Noise Under" will come with a little more than 100 adventures. Then this initial stock will be enriched on a continuous flow .

HOW MUCH DO WE NEED?

The budget for a complete world and full features is between $2,5 to $3 millions (depending on the degree of outsourcing). We ask for $500,000 as an initial goal to build the fundations and the basic gameplay. But we need to raise $1,650,000 to have 100% of the gameplay features and 50% of the open world. That will enable us to hire the relevant people and contractors to do this right, essentially writers and 2D artists/illustrators.
The world to build (Concept art)

STRETCH GOALS
  • QAZ districts and locations: around 20% completed.
  • Initial sets of adventures, recurrent characters and item types.
  • First set of Bars (Bars are special locations where connected players can discuss together and meet Non-Player Characters).
  • YBERIS districts and locations: Around 15% completed.
  • First set of Bars.
  • Crafting gameplay is the ability for a character (player or non player) to assemble prefabricated parts into an item or to disassemble an item into prefabricated parts
  • Reputation gameplay is the way the actions a player has done influence his character "life" in the world.
  • New set of adventures
  • More recurring characters.
  • New set of item types.
  • REB districts and locations: Around 15% completed.
  • New set of adventures
  • More recurring characters.
  • New set of item types.
  • Hacking gameplay is the ability for a player to hack information systems through the in-game Net to do several types of actions.
  • QAZ, YBERIS and REB districts and locations: Around 50% completed (25% more for QAZ, 35% more for REB, 35% more for YBERIS).
  • Another set of adventures.
  • More recurring characters.
  • Another set of item types.

REWARDS

ALL the rewards include a digital copy of the game.

ALL the rewards from CONCRETE to CORPO include an ALPHA Access.

 

CARBON : $20
  • 2 months of membership.
  • Access to the private space of the community forum.
  • Follow-up newsletters.
  • Digital art and wallpapers.

CARBON : $20 - EARLY BIRDS!

Same content as the normal CARBON + the following BONUS:

  • + 1 month more of membership (3 months in total).
  • + Access to the BETA version.

CONCRETE : $40
  • 5 months of membership.
  • Access to the BETA version.
  • "The Noise Under" novella (English or French).
  • Access to the private space of the community forum.
  • Follow-up newsletters.
  • Digital art and wallpapers.

CONCRETE: $40 - EARLY BIRDS!

Same content as the normal CONCRETE + the following BONUS:

  • + 1 month more of membership (6 months in total).
  • + Access to the ALPHA version.

ASPHALT : $60 - EARLY BIRDS!

25% off! Quantity limited. Same content as the $80 reward for $60 only!
  • 11 months of membership.
  • A recurring Non Player Character with your name.
  • Access to the BETA version.
  • "The Noise Under" novella (English or French).
  • In game: some money to start.
  • Access to the private space of the community forum.
  • Follow-up newsletters.
  • Digital art and wallpapers.

ASPHALT : $80
  • 11 months of membership.
  • A recurring Non Player Character with your name.
  • Access to the BETA version.
  • "The Noise Under" novella (English or French).
  • In game: some money to start.
  • Access to the private space of the community forum.
  • Follow-up newsletters.
  • Digital art and wallpapers.

DATA : $120 - EARLY BIRDS!

35 off! Quantity limited. Same content as the $160 reward for $120 only!
  • 23 months of membership.
  • A recurring Non Player Character with your name.
  • Access to the BETA version.
  • "The Noise Under" novella (English or French).
  • In game: some money to start.
  • In game: a vehicle.
  • Access to the private space of the community forum.
  • Follow-up newsletters.
  • Digital art and wallpapers.

DATA : $160
  • 23 months of membership.
  • A recurring Non Player Character with your name.
  • Access to the BETA version.
  • "The Noise Under" novella (English or French).
  • In game: some money to start.
  • In game: a vehicle.
  • Access to the private space of the community forum.
  • Follow-up newsletters.
  • Digital art and wallpapers.

CORPO : $450 - EARLY BIRDS!

35% off! Quantity limited. Same content as the $700 reward for 450$ only!
  • Lifetime membership.
  • A recurring Non Player Character with your name and based on your picture.
  • In game: some money to start.
  • In game: a vehicle.
  • In game: a safe room.
  • Access to the BETA version.
  • "The Noise Under" novella (English or French).
  • Access to the private space of the community forum.
  • Follow-up newsletters.
  • Digital art and wallpapers.

CORPO : $700
  • Lifetime membership.
  • A recurring Non Player Character with your name and based on your picture.
  • In game: some money to start.
  • In game: a vehicle.
  • In game: a safe room.
  • Access to the BETA version.
  • "The Noise Under" novella (English or French).
  • Access to the private space of the community forum.
  • Follow-up newsletters.
  • Digital art and wallpapers.

How it will work?: Supporting the project will grant you automatically a player membership corresponding to the reward you've choosen. Neither payment information request nor membership renewal will be asked to you until the end of the period of the reward. And if you want more (period or adventures), it will be possible with the adventure shop. For example, W. Gibsoon, a famous writer, supports the project by choosing the "DATA" reward. He gets an access for 23 months that will give him access to 69 adventures (23 months * 3 adventures per month). At the end of the period of 23 months, W. Gibsoon will be asked to confirm his membership by entering his payment informations or to cancel it

THE SCHEDULE

This forecast macro-planning is based on the assumption that the initial goal of the crowd-funding is reached.

DEVELOPMENT START: July 2013.

ALPHA RELEASE: December 2013.

OPEN BETA RELEASE: December 2014.

"THE NOISE UNDER": A NARRATIVE MMO RPG






Currently, a good adventure videogame means one single-player through one main story-line. If you want another story in the same setting, you have no choice but wait for the sequel, pay the full price and so on. No interactivity with others players. No re-use of your character attributes in the sequel. On the other hand, computer RPGs, mainly Third or First Person Shooter, are too focused on developing skills and accumulating items to the detriment of the richness and the complexity of stories. What are called "quests" are widely nothing but pretextes to hack and slash or to shoot-shoot-shoot. To top it all off, the social part is too constrained by Guilds. Aas a matter of a fact, from our point of view, the most important has been lost: social interactivity while story-telling. In others words, today a video game player can not make his character grow in a story-telling oriented and persistent world. Exactly the opposite of pen and paper RPGs.






YBERIS cityscape downtown (Concept art)





NARRATIVE: The heart of "THE NOISE UNDER", what will focus most of our efforts and be a big part of the budget, is what we call the adventures. An adventure is an interactive fiction, as it exists in legacy pen and paper RPGs, with a strong storyline, great NPCs (some of them being recurring characters), goals and missions. We structured three different lengths of adventure corresponding each to the time needed to achieve it: short, intermediate and long. An adventure can be one-shot or it can be part of a series spanning several seasons (like tv programs). The adventures will be created by our narrative team and published on the in-game adventure shop.





QAZ - "Babylon street" (Concept art)





RPG: "THE NOISE UNDER" is tactical, not based on physical reflexes. It's turn-based during interactions and fights.No class system: you'll be what you do and the way you do it. Your skills as well as your reputation will change according to your succeeded or failed past actions and will influence those to come, for better or for worse. Your objective is to survive.

You'll need to eat, to rest in a safe place and to get healed.
You'll have to equip yourself.
You'll have to get people to teach you how to do things (crafting, hacking systems...).
...

Most of the time, you'll be paying (in-game currency) for all of that. So you'll need to rent out your skills, to traffic and smuggle because the only way to make money is to dive into the underground economy.





QAZ - a back street (Concept art)





MMO: Your narrative experiences will take place in the backstreets and the cut throat bars of QAZ, in the ultraprotected arcologies of YBERIS, or in the devasted land of REB and its buried research labs.


Open world: The adventures you'll live will make you explore about 100km2 (size of the fully designed world, excluding the interiors). Private interiors will be accessible according to your skills, the adventures you lived or you're living.

Persistent world:  The world will continue to evolve and to change even if you're not connected.

No PVP or PVE modes:  Only one unique world in which things happen through adventures or not.

No guild system:  If you want to build a team, you'll just have to hire team mates (NPCs or real players) or simply play with friends. You'll be able to share the same narrative experience through the cooperative adventures which have been designed for that purpose.

Continuity of game session:  For example, you're will be able to start playing on your PC or MAC and continue your game session on your tablet. The only rupture will result from logout-login process. To benefit from this feature, you'll just have to install the relevant game client on both systems.






REB cityscape (Concept art)





Game views:

The game experience tends to get closer to real life tabletop RPGs sessions, so the views (except the Hacking view) will be tactical tabletop inspired.
The visual tests we've made absolutely convinced us that the aesthetics and the NeoNoir/Cyberpunk ambiance of "THE NOISE UNDER" (interiors, exteriors, characters) will be best rendered while using hand-drawn technics.
The game experience supposes a big urban territory which narrates the city and offers a wide range of locations, of characters, of situations to build exciting stories. Doing this using 3D is much more expensive (5 to 6 times), but provides nothing more to the most important: the adventures.

So, for those different reasons, the game views will be fully 2D.






Technology: Even if the game views are heavily 2D, "THE NOISE UNDER" application (composed by user-side and server-side softwares) will mainly rely on UNITY4, the fantastic game development framework.
Languages: From the first release, "THE NOISE UNDER" and all the adventures will be available in both English and French.
Hardware and O.S.: Windows, MacOsX, Linux, Android tablets, Ipad, thanks to UNITY4.





REB - a dangerous forsaken lab (Concept art)




WHY DO WE NEED YOUR SUPPORT?





"THE NOISE UNDER" concept is really new with a revolutionary narrative system (with the adventure shop and different types of adventures) and a gameplay which includes hacking, crafting and reputation features, all of that in a persistent world. The completed territory will be huge (about 100Km2), so will be the in-game Net. There will be a plenty of NPCs, locations, items. That means hours and hours of narrative experiences. To keep the game as close as possible to the original concept, it is fundamental for us to have the last word, the "final cut" on the development, the graphical and gameplay decisions while keeping the deadlines in mind. We want to market the game at "the right price" and don't want to answer to anyone but you, the player-customer. So we decided to ask for support. With a crowdfunding campaign, we can ask directly to people, to players, to customers. You and us will be closer, the relationship will be more transparent by frequent reporting and showing on how the dev goes, more interesting by showing you the way we build the project.
"The Noise Under" will be membership-based. A membership will grant the member an access to 3 adventures to choose a month, whatever the length. The first release of "The Noise Under" will come with a little more than 100 adventures. Then this initial stock will be enriched on a continuous flow .




HOW MUCH DO WE NEED?





The budget for a complete world and full features is between $2,5 to $3 millions (depending on the degree of outsourcing). We ask for $500,000 as an initial goal to build the fundations and the basic gameplay. But we need to raise $1,650,000 to have 100% of the gameplay features and 50% of the open world. That will enable us to hire the relevant people and contractors to do this right, essentially writers and 2D artists/illustrators.





The world to build (Concept art)




STRETCH GOALS












QAZ districts and locations: around 20% completed.

Initial sets of adventures, recurrent characters and item types.

First set of Bars (Bars are special locations where connected players can discuss together and meet Non-Player Characters).













YBERIS districts and locations: Around 15% completed.

First set of Bars.













Crafting gameplay is the ability for a character (player or non player) to assemble prefabricated parts into an item or to disassemble an item into prefabricated parts

Reputation gameplay is the way the actions a player has done influence his character "life" in the world.












New set of adventures
More recurring characters.
New set of item types.













REB districts and locations: Around 15% completed.












New set of adventures
More recurring characters.
New set of item types.













Hacking gameplay is the ability for a player to hack information systems through the in-game Net to do several types of actions.













QAZ, YBERIS and REB districts and locations: Around 50% completed (25% more for QAZ, 35% more for REB, 35% more for YBERIS).
Another set of adventures.
More recurring characters.
Another set of item types.





REWARDS
ALL the rewards include a digital copy of the game.
ALL the rewards from CONCRETE to CORPO include an ALPHA Access.
 




CARBON : $20







2 months of membership.
Access to the private space of the community forum.
Follow-up newsletters.
Digital art and wallpapers.






CARBON : $20 - EARLY BIRDS!





Same content as the normal CARBON + the following BONUS:








 + 1 month more of membership (3 months in total).
+ Access to the BETA version.







CONCRETE : $40







5 months of membership.
Access to the BETA version.
"The Noise Under" novella (English or French).
Access to the private space of the community forum.
Follow-up newsletters.
Digital art and wallpapers.






CONCRETE: $40 - EARLY BIRDS!





Same content as the normal CONCRETE + the following BONUS:








 + 1 month more of membership (6 months in total).
+ Access to the ALPHA version.







ASPHALT : $60 - EARLY BIRDS!





25% off! Quantity limited. Same content as the $80 reward for $60 only!







11 months of membership.

A recurring Non Player Character with your name.
Access to the BETA version.

"The Noise Under" novella (English or French).

In game: some money to start.

DATA : $120 - EARLY BIRDS!

How it will work?: Supporting the project will grant you automatically a player membership corresponding to the reward you've choosen. Neither payment information request nor membership renewal will be asked to you until the end of the period of the reward. And if you want more (period or adventures), it will be possible with the adventure shop. For example, W. Gibsoon, a famous writer, supports the project by choosing the "DATA" reward. He gets an access for 23 months that will give him access to 69 adventures (23 months * 3 adventures per month). At the end of the period of 23 months, W. Gibsoon will be asked to confirm his membership by entering his payment informations or to cancel it






THE SCHEDULE






This forecast macro-planning is based on the assumption that the initial goal of the crowd-funding is reached.

ALPHA RELEASE: December 2013.
OPEN BETA RELEASE: December 2014.

story:
This project is now fully funded and the Maze is under construction! For the latest updates on the Maze, check out our website for the latest updates: www.the-crystal-maze.com

Any queries please email us at info@the-crystal-maze.com. 


In the 90's, The Crystal Maze, was one of the UK's favourite television shows. Now we're planning for it to return as a live immersive experience right in the heart of London!

You'll get to play the maze just as contestants did on the original show - placing you at the centre of the action. What we really want, is for people to live the magic of the hit television programme for themselves.

We will be lovingly recreating the famous set just as it was on the original show. All four famous zones will be present; Aztec, Medieval, Industrial and Futuristic, not forgetting of course, The Crystal Dome!

We are delighted to be announcing the return of none other than the legendary Maze Master himself, Richard O'Brien! Richard won't be running around the maze himself, but he will be welcoming guests in time honoured fashion... to find out how, you'll just have to come along and see!

Matthew Tucker / Courtesy of BuzzFeed

Audience members will compete in teams, guided by their own personal Maze Master. Each contestant will play games that test their intelligence, skill, physical ability and mystery...ness. At the experience's finale, each team will be rewarded for the amount of games they have won by converting crystals into precious time in the Dome.

You will be invited to form teams of 8. Don’t worry if you are a group of 1 or 2, we'll find you some excellent team mates to tackle the maze with. You can also hook up with your friends even if you pledge individually.

4 teams will then enter the maze at once, moving through each zone before regrouping at the end to take on the Dome.

Depending on how many crystals you collect, (remember 5 seconds per crystal!), you will have your allotted time in the Dome to collect as many golden tickets as possible. Every winning team will get a place on our leader board and win a fantastic prize. 

Modern audiences want to do, not watch. In recent years, there has been a cultural shift towards entertainment that audiences can engage with in a more active way. More and more we are finding new audiences who want to experience, interact, and play as opposed to watch.
The Crystal Maze represents the perfect opportunity to do something for this new audience on a grand scale. That same audience who want more active entertainment are the ones who watched The Crystal Maze growing up- making this not just an innovative idea, but a dream come true for many people, including us!

YOU!!! If you're reading this then you were probably alive in the 90’s and therefore obviously watched The Crystal Maze religiously. At first the venue will be 18+ and for adults only but in time we will open it up for families and young’uns so we can pass down that all important Crystal Maze wisdom.

Crowdfunding was a very deliberate decision because we wanted you guys to be involved from the very start. By pledging your support, you will become part of the team that brought back The Crystal Maze. You can also get yourself a ticket, so you can be one of the first to play the Maze. We have been approached by venture capitalists and angel investors but our preferred business partner is the British public. We want the fans to be the ones to bring back The Crystal Maze. Together we can bring back the greatest game show of all time for everyone!

The main cost is without doubt the set - building a land of wonder and amazement for everyone to enjoy. No expense will be spared as we rebuild the Maze in all it's former glory. With such a large project, there are inevitably lots of other costs as you can see in our lovely 'Crystal' pie chart below. But really it's all about building the most beautiful set possible for you guys.

The venue is at a secret location in central London, but rest assured it will be easily accesible to all!

Challenges are definitely the name of the game. We've been working on this for a year already and it has been quite the roller-coaster so far. We are sure there will be more challenges to come, not least building the maze, but with our team and skills we are confident that no crystal will be left behind.

From the reaction we've had so far, we can tell how much this means to people and we are just as passionate as all of you guys about this project. There will certainly be difficulties ahead but we owe it to all of us to bring back The Crystal Maze. So whatever happens the show will go on!

If you can't contribute but you still love The Crystal Maze don't worry - you can still help!

Please share this page and get involved on social media. The more people we get involved the bigger and better The Crystal Maze will be!


               A big thank you from the guys at Little Lion for checking out our page.



FAQs

Where will this be?

At a secret location in London. We can promise it'll be easily accessible.

When will it open?

Thanks to the incredible response  we have had to find a bigger, better venue for the Maze. This has slightly changed our timeline and the Maze will now open in early 2016. 

How long will the experience last?

Approximately 1 hour 45 minutes, but audience members will be welcome to enjoy our bar and viewing platform to watch other contestants go through the Maze!

How much will tickets be when you open?

£50 plus a booking fee.

How long are you going to be open for?

As long as possible! Depends entirely on how this campaign and our ticket sales go. Initially we will be putting tickets on sale for the first three months.

How do I decide when my ticket is for?

As soon as you make a ticket pledge you will receive a confirmation of your ticket from IndieGoGo, guaranteeing you entry to the Maze. In the months leading up to opening night we will contact all backers who are being rewarded with a ticket and allow them to choose a date which suits them.

Why no Ocean Zone?

We're old school! Plus all that water in a venue… health and safety would not be happy.

What is the story with health and safety?

The safety of our audience members is a primary concern for us. We will be working with health and safety experts and the local council to ensure that the event complies with all regulations.

What happens if you don't reach your target?

We have been approached by a number of private investors, and can raise the funds that way, if we don't reach our target. But of course, we would prefer that the fans be the ones to bring back The Crystal Maze.

Who's going to be the host?

We will be hiring some of the finest interactive theatre actors in the UK to act as maze masters to guide audiences through. Though, we are not averse to the occasional celebrity guest appearance!

Will you bring it back as a TV show too?

Our aim is to create a live immersive experience, not a TV show. 

Awwwww come on!

We'll have to see :)

Can I film footage, use a GoPro or get a recording of my time in the maze?

Sadly not, as this is also a rights issue, but watch this space.

story:
Our Story

I have been playing chess since I was four years old. I am an international master from New York City trying to achieve my grandmaster title. This coming year, I’m looking for sponsorship to go overseas, to earn my grandmaster (GM) norms. I have to play in certain types of tournaments to qualify for this, and I will have many more opportunities in Europe than in the United States.  Over the past two months, I played in tournaments in Oslo; Paris; Biel, Switzerland; and, Coppenhagen and, although I didn't earn any GM norms, I played quite well (1st in Oslo, 5th in Paris out of 350; tied for 4th in Copenhagen out of 320) and boosted my international rating above 2500, which is required to achieve the GM title. In the following ten months, I will be playing in Hungary, Iceland, Gilbraltar, and Mexico, as well as sites in the US, just to name a few places. I have also been invited to a prestigious tournament in St. Louis (http://main.uschess.org/content/view/11346/639/).  To accomplish these goals, I plan to study for 3 hours a day, not including time I work with my coach, Yury Shulman.

The Impact

People will have the satisfaction of 1) supporting a kid's specific goal, 2) improving the image of chess in the US and worldwide, and 3) having procured inexpensive lessons from a nice, friendly and committed international master (I usually charge $100/hour).  I already have an $1800 contribution from my former high school and have given in-person lessons to a hedge fund investor.

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

I need money for chess lessons, tournament entry fees (although some tournaments have free entry for International Masters), and travel (flights, meals, hotels).  I’m looking to raise a minimum of $5,000 to a maximum of $30,000, and would greatly appreciate your support. In return, I will create a blog, and regail you with my chess exploits, and upload pictures, so that you can follow my tournament success.  In addition, for every $50 you contribute, I will give you or a loved one online (or $75, in person, if you're local to NYC) chess lessons.


 

Other Ways You Can Help

It would be great if you would link to my chess blog (which I've just created, marctarnoldchess.blogspot.com) via facebook, twitter and other social media.

story:
The Game

Scylla Games is proud to present Nine Lives, a retro styled platform game for Windows, Linux, Mac and iOS (and perhaps an Android version, if there is enough interest).

The game features a tiny kitten, Felina, and her journey across the four corners of the globe to find her kidnapped mother.

Battle across twenty-five vast levels, spread over five worlds, populated by dozens of creepy critters, from land-dwelling cephalopods, snakes, bats, ogres, spiders and zombies, to the most heinous and insidious of them all, the evil water droplet.

In each world, you will face your fears, as you oversome all the obstacles, navigating dark tunnels, jumping over thoughtlessly placed spikes, switching on rattling mechanical platforms and discovering secret portals. In each level, you must find the sacred key, which is your only chance to escape the wild areas.

 

 

And as you progress through each world, you will gain mew, er I mean new, abilities, such as shooting fireballs, hovering and clinging to walls. Learn to use these new skills to face the fresh challenges that await.

At the end of each world, you will face the deadliest enemy each world has to offer. Cunning, pernicious guardians that lie in wait to put an end to your quest.

Do you have what it takes? Can you help Felina stay alive long enough to find and rescue her mother. Or will you fall victim to the harsh, wild world, and end up as just another meal for a vicious animal. Remember, cats only have nine lives.

Note: You can find more information and a playable demo of the game here: http://www.indiedb.com/games/nine-lives/downloads

 

About me

Scylla Games is a one man show. My name is Dale and I have been an indie developer for just over a year now. I have a background in the games industry and in academia, in the fields of robotics and computer graphics. Ever since I got my first computer at the age of 10 (a feeble zx spectrum with a whopping 48k of RAM) I have always been both a gamer and programmer. I have over a dozen games on the apple app store, but this is my first game where I am branching out to other platforms.

 

 

Why retro?

I remember my first gameboy, you know the big chunky white thing with monochrome graphics, a yellow screen, and a battery life of a picosecond. It was a christmas present when I was 14. I had 3 games, Gremlins 2, Tetris and Gargoyle's quest. Ah great days!

Since that time I have worked on many games, large and small, but I always look back on my early days of gaming with very fond memories, and retro games hold a very special place in my heart.

I wanted to bring that feeling of nostalgia to this game, and with crisp, monochrome graphics, a quirky chiptunes soundtrack and simple-to-learn-but-hard-to-master gameplay, I feel that I have succeeded. But I'll let you be the judge of that.

 

How you can help

The work for the game is mostly done, it is at alpha stage. But the last stretch of a game is always the hardest. With your help, I will be able to see it through and shell out for things like promotional materials, more music, website and other associated fees.

Becoming a backer of this game will earn my undying gratitiude. You will help me continue my dream of creating the kinds of games I want to make and play.

You can help by donating, even a small amount goes a long way to helping make this game a reality. Donate now and get the game before anyone else, and if you want to be part of beta-testing, you can get very early access to the game.

 

 

And if you have the desire and means to offer more, then there are further perks to suit you too. All contributions will be recieved with much gratitude and love.

If you like the look of this game but are unable to contribute financially, then why not help by simply mentioning it in passing to friends, on forums or on your favourite social network.

Or you can subscribe to my Youtube, twitter or facebook channels. Spreading the word in any way will do wonders for the success of this project, and for that, I will be forever grateful.
story_txt:
The Game

Scylla Games is proud to present Nine Lives, a retro styled platform game for Windows, Linux, Mac and iOS (and perhaps an Android version, if there is enough interest).
The game features a tiny kitten, Felina, and her journey across the four corners of the globe to find her kidnapped mother.
Battle across twenty-five vast levels, spread over five worlds, populated by dozens of creepy critters, from land-dwelling cephalopods, snakes, bats, ogres, spiders and zombies, to the most heinous and insidious of them all, the evil water droplet.
In each world, you will face your fears, as you oversome all the obstacles, navigating dark tunnels, jumping over thoughtlessly placed spikes, switching on rattling mechanical platforms and discovering secret portals. In each level, you must find the sacred key, which is your only chance to escape the wild areas.
 

 
And as you progress through each world, you will gain mew, er I mean new, abilities, such as shooting fireballs, hovering and clinging to walls. Learn to use these new skills to face the fresh challenges that await.
At the end of each world, you will face the deadliest enemy each world has to offer. Cunning, pernicious guardians that lie in wait to put an end to your quest.
Do you have what it takes? Can you help Felina stay alive long enough to find and rescue her mother. Or will you fall victim to the harsh, wild world, and end up as just another meal for a vicious animal. Remember, cats only have nine lives.

You can help by donating, even a small amount goes a long way to helping make this game a reality. Donate now and get the game before anyone else, and if you want to be part of beta-testing, you can get very early access to the game.
 

 
And if you have the desire and means to offer more, then there are further perks to suit you too. All contributions will be recieved with much gratitude and love.
If you like the look of this game but are unable to contribute financially, then why not help by simply mentioning it in passing to friends, on forums or on your favourite social network.
Or you can subscribe to my Youtube, twitter or facebook channels. Spreading the word in any way will do wonders for the success of this project, and for that, I will be forever grateful.

story:
Introduction

Hello, my name is Mike and this is the first game among my projects that i`m trying to give life to.

For the last 10+ years i was excessively modding various games (Sword of The Stars, UFO Aftershock, Starsector, Silent Storm etc.) and some of you might even know me under my nickname Okim or are familiar with my ACM and Ironclad mods.

I also participated in development of Endless Space PC game as a VIP member of community (a beta tester and an active member of game elements discussions), so i have some Space gaming experience in my pockets.

This campaign is about a board game that i`m currently actively developing. Its a Space 4x table top game with hexagonal map, detailed ship tokens, random events and encounters, traditional resources (food, minerals, research) and customisable ships. Its about choices that a leader of a newborn spacefaring empire has to make in order to achieve prosperity and wealth to his people and secure it from aggressors.

full sized picture can be found here: http://www.okim.nickersonm.com/MY/pic01.jpg 

 

The Goals of This Campaign

This particular campaign is started to raise funds for an artist. All graphics in the game are currently done by me - all planets, stars, ships, tokens and other stuff was either crafted in Photoshop or in Illustrator. But i`m not an artist and i can`t create proper race portraits that my publisher requests me to have.
 
I`m working on this game solo and i don`t have enough money to pay for a set of 7 race portraits and a several large scale drawings, so that`s where your contributions will mostly go. Excess funds will be used to further improve the game, here are the certain improvements that LS will get for reaching the listed sums:
 
$1000 - all 7 races will receive high quality portraits and full descriptions in rulebook. The game will also get a set of unique resources on specific colonies. Resources will provide an empire-wide bonus to the player who controls a colony on a planet with that resource.
 
$2500 - rulebook and the box will be decorated with high quality images of various space events, battles and just beatiful scenes. A set of three leaders per race (21 in total) will be added to the game. Leaders provide a specific local bonus to a fleet or a colony where it is assigned to.
 
$5000 - an additional silicon based race and set of all required tokens, hexes and cards to support 6 players.
 
$10000 - senate and voting will be added to the game.
 
Other goals may be added to this campaign. I`ll make an undate once i`m ready to propose a new goal...
 
Now when i`m getting your contributions - i`ve started ordering the arts. Below is the list of all race portraits currently done with some description for them. I`ll add new races as soon as i get them done.

 

The Races - Avis

Avis are large, noble looking eagle-like creatures. They evolved on an arid planet called Nar-Avis that has significantly lower gravity than we have on Earth.

Avis are capable of flight on their own. That helped them to move the arts of piloting air-borne and spacecrafts to a very high level unreachable by other races. All Avis from the very youth are trained to be a pilot. Flight is the most important part of Avis culture and only the best pilots are allowed to take high positions in Avis society.

Avis are peaceful and curious. They had very few wars in their history and usually try to resolve conflicts via diplomacy.

In game terms Avis get the fastest ships that can travel further from their colonies (without the need to research techs that allow to do that for other races). They also get one of the most powerful fighters and some of their ships are allowed to carry fighter wings.

 

The Races - Vargars

Vargars are brutal warriors with keen senses, exceptional strength, agility and toughness. Their society is ruled by clans, but this ruling can`t be called centralised - most of the time clans are busy fighting for power and supremacy making.

Vargars` technological progress was very slow until they managed to shot down an Avis scout orbiting over their homeworld Vargad. Due to this event the galaxy has learned the horrors of Vargars and their bloody conquests.

Vargars never retreat as their Warrior`s Code prohibits this. Vargars almost never establish any diplomatic  contacts with other races except for demanding surrender and tributes.

In game terms Vargars have the bets troops and experienced ship crew (leading to accuracy bonus). Their cruisers and battleships can carry troops for free.

 

The races - Hivenids.

This insectoid race is ruled by a hivemind. While Queen controls global affairs and rules the Homeworld - all the other colonies are deligated to her loyal daughters.

Hivenids are the best farmers and workers in the known sector of this Galaxy. Their sheer numbers and direct psionical connection of each worker to his Queen or Princess ensures that each task is accomplished precisely as it was ordered.

Queen and Princess emit a powerful psionic field that connects the whole colony and its surroundings in a vast network of minds where tasks, orders and reports are transmitted instantly.

The only drawback of the Hivenids and their hivemind is that there is little place for scientific discoveries in it as sheer numbers of the Hivenid workers rarely encounters tasks that they can`t fulfil with their mass.

In game terms Hivenids get bonus to food and mineral production, but have a limit on how much reserach they can ever generate. All Hivenids colonies have extra defenders should another players launch an invasion on any of their worlds.

 

The races - Wurmis.

Wurmis are quite unusual species closely resembling oversized terran ringed worms. Wurmis have no arms, legs or other manipulator, so its really a mystery how these creatures managed to evolve into a spacefaring civilisation.

Wurmis live in huge underground cities and rarely come out to the surface. Even spaceports on all Wurmis colonies are underground-based.

Wurmis biology is very remarkable. Their metabolism and cell regeneration are extremely fast making growth period from a larvae into a fully developed creature just a matter of several month.

Wurmis can easily survive wounds that could instantly kill members of other species. This includes heavy burns, loss of 75% of the body and loss of most of its blood.

The only thing that Wurmis are afraid of - is ultraviolet raditation. That`s why they always wear protective suits when moving to the planet`s surface.

In game terms Wurmis get the cheapiest colonists and their troops can ressurect after they were killed.

 

Exploration and Random Events

The map in Lords of The Stars consists of several hexes. Each hex represents a star system or a deep space object like nebula or black hole. Hexes have two sides - a Star type (or a Deep Space sign) on one side and its contents on the other side. All hexes are placed on the map with their Star/Sign side up. Players set up the map by putting hexes in turns around the core world - this allows them to either secure some good worlds close to their starting position or spoil other player`s sector by putting poor worlds in his vicinity.
 
 
 
 
Each star type contains different types of planets. For example - Orange stars always contain at least one terran type planet and Blue stars contain at least one mineral rich planet. The worst and poorest stars are Red - there is a chance to get absolutely no planets/asteroids in those.
 
To see what a hex contains - a player needs to send his ships there. Once they reach the hex - it is considered to be explored. Player flips the hex with its contents up and takes a Random Encounter card. There are two types of card - standard (that contain something valuable) and dangers (that always contain a dangerous foe).
 
 
 
 
Each game turn a first player takes a random event card and follows its description. Randoms add a feeling of uncertainty to the game as a simple ship explosion event can devastate the whole your expansion efforts by randomly killing your transport with colonists. But don`t you worry - the majority of events are good or neutral and some of them are very valuable (such as a population boom that makes your colonists cheapier to build for the following several turns). 
 
 

 

Exploitation

The game has 4 resources. They are - food, minerals (industry), research and fleet command points.
 
FOOD. The majority of planets in Lords of The Stars can`t support themselves and rely on agricultural colonies to sup ply them with food. Each such colony deducts 1 food from empire food production pool. Only agricultural colonies can produce food.
 
MINERALS. These are used to build ships, buy and install modules, construct stations, train troops and colonists. Only industrial colonies and mines (stations) can produce minerals. Most of the planets that contain rich mineral deposits require food for their colonies.
 
RESEARCH. You need this 'resource' to develop new technologies. Techtree has 8 levels with each containing 2 pairs of techs. If you research one of the techs - you`ll lose access to its pair. This is the main part of the game where players are forced to make hard choices (for example - there is a pair of techs that can increase mineral production of your colonies or increase reserach output - a tough choice, isn`t it?). Only research colonies can generate science points.
 
FLEET COMMAND POINTS. Each ship in this game consumes some amount of fleet command points, so you can`t have a large armada without a proper support for it. Each colony produces a fixed amount of FCP regardless of its type, so the larger your empire is - the greater you armada. There is a strict cap for FCP, so even the grandest empires can`t field endless amounts of ships. This is also a second major part where players are forced to make choices according to their needs, techs and race abilities - sometimes its better to have a fleet of 6 fast destroyers than a couple of cruisers or a single battleship (each type consumes its own amount of FCP!).
 
 
 
 
 

Expansion

Each player can create 4 types of colonies on any planets that they can reach. There is a limit on how far from your colonies and stations your ships can fly. This values is 1 hex by default, but can be increased by tech advances and ship modules.
 
Colony types are: agricultural for food production, inductrial for mineral harvest, research for generating science points, construction for building ships. The numbers of each type are limited by 3, so once again there is a choice of what colony to set up.
 
Certain worlds (called extreme) require a specific tech to allow colonisation. These are the richest worlds in the game.
 
Players can build 3 types of stations on any asteroids that their transports can reach. These stations can be either mines (that produce minerals), missile bases that provide a system-wide defence for the player or listening post that acts as a flees command pointsgenerator and system-wide accuracy booster.
 
 
 

Extermination

This is the most interesting part of the game. Each player can have ships, fighters and troops with which he can defend his empire or wage war with the other players.
 
Each ship type (there are destroyers, cruisers, battleships, transports and fighters) has its own unique role. Battleships are space-superiority ships capable of crushing enemy fleets alone, cruisers excel in support roles (they can damage enemy before the actuall fighting begins), fighters are great against battleships, and destroyers are good for hunting down fighters. Transports are universal carriers and can transport troops, fighters and colonists.
 
Players can improve their ships by installing modules on them. These modules effect all the ships on the type they are installed on. There are plenty of various modules providing bonuses to all various ship stats. Players can even customise a ship to become a fully functioning troop carrier or a fleet accuracy booster).
 
Invasions are the main way to remove colonies from other players. You need troops to take over the planets and cruisers/battleships to soften the defenders. But colonies are not so easy to take over - each of them has a powerful defence battery that can fend off small and medium sized invasion fleets (or simply take off troop carriers and thus prevent invasions).
 
  
 
 

Victory Conditions

The goal of the game is to be the first to accumulate certaing number of victory points. VPs are gained by many various things such as colonisation, random events (ratings) and monster hunting. But the most prosperous ways to get VPs is to launch an invasion on other player. There is another way for those who prefer peaceful gaming - a set of mission cards with various easy and difficult objectives. These are the last part of the game that forces players to make choices. Most of the missions are based on very different economic achievements that can`t be reached simultaneously or are really difficult to do so. 

 
 

Other Ways You Can Help

The campaign is over now, but if you missed it and wish to contribute - please use this PayPal account http://okim.nickersonm.com/okim-studios/donate.html
 
Inform me in the comment for the payment what particular perk you wish to take.
 
 
 
 

Additional Info

Websites of Peter "Hirgonn" Dora - the creator of race art: 

Portfolio Website - http://www.peterdora.com/
Art Blog - http://peterdora.blogspot.com/
Deviant Art - http://peterman2070.deviantart.com/

Here are some links to my other projects that i mentioned above for you to check:
 
Sword of the Stars mod - http://kerberos-productions.com/forum/viewtopic...
Sword of the Stars total convertion mod - http://kerberos-productions.com/forum/viewtopic...
UFO Afterschok mod - http://www.strategycore.co.uk/forums/topic/7314...
Ironclads mod for Starsector - http://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?top...
A Post Nuclear Mod for Silent Storm - http://www.strategycore.co.uk/forums/topic/1016...
 
And here is my webpage that contains detailed info on my projects, including this board game: http://www.okim.nickersonm.com/okim-studios

Portfolio Website - http://www.peterdora.com/Art Blog - http://peterdora.blogspot.com/Deviant Art - http://peterman2070.deviantart.com/
Here are some links to my other projects that i mentioned above for you to check:

And here is my webpage that contains detailed info on my projects, including this board game: http://www.okim.nickersonm.com/okim-studios

story:
UPDATE

Check out this and other new pictures in our Gallery!

 

Final Days: A Crystal & Steam Adventure harkens back to a simpler time, where story and characters were placed above fancy graphics, advanced lighting effects, and PhysX engines. With this project, I plan to present a solid game with engaging characters, a story full of intrigue and adventure, and an experience that can be savoured and enjoyed.

You will play from the perspective of an apprentice Steamsmith, Samuel, who is striving to learn his craft. Unfortunately, like most adventures, things begin to get strange very quickly and nothing is what it seems on the surface.

You will travel through crowded, steam-cloaked streets, visit temples of crystal and stone, explore the dark, nearly-forgotten sewers beneath the city, and even stranger locales! 

Beyond the story and characters, the game will feature:

  • an exhaustive crafting system, combining different ingredients to create tools, contraptions, and even clothing, that will be needed to solve many of the puzzles and progress the story
  • meaningful choices that can alter the flow of the story and have far reaching consequences
  • optional paths of adventure that further expand upon and explore the lore of the city and the people in it

 

 The Crystals were there long before us. Beneath the waves is where we found them. From there, we brought them to the city and studied them with our greatest minds. In them, there was discovered a power that could rival even the great influence of the Steamworks.

The Keepers, as the scholars who studied them came to be called, received their chance to prove this as word reached the city that our enemies came in a grand fleet from across the sea. In desperation, the Council came to them as the Steamsmiths could find no way to stave off the impending annihilation. From the Crystals they sought salvation... and so it was given.

Through their manipulation of the crystals, the Keepers took a drastic course that would change the very nature of our city forever. They raised the city from the surface of the waters and as our enemies closed in for the kill, we disappeared into the clouds themselves.

As the city rose, so did the influence of the Keepers. For their aid, they were given honored status and license to expand their studies into further uses of these powerful gems. Their presence grows even now, outward from the source within the Crystal Temple and they vie for dominance of the city against the Steamsmiths.

 

Let me begin by saying that this game will be produced; it's only a question of scale.

Currently, this game is being produced solely through my own funds. The design work is done by myself, along with some of the more minor art, sound, and programming. For what I cannot do myself, I utilize independent artists, musicians, and programmers. 

These hardworking people do amazing work and I'm thankful for each and every hour that they dedicate to this project. However, there is so much that could be improved upon with the availability of additional funding:

  • an overhaul of our existing sprites to add more animation frames to their movements and actions, including brand new actions and poses. Currently, each sprite(game character) is made up of 3 frames of animation for each direction of movement. We will expand this with both functional(jumping, using tools, crawling, etc) and aesthetic(emotional reactions, speaking animations, swappable clothing and equipment)
  • additional tiles and sprites to bring out the depth and variety of our existing game areas. Things like a greater variety of houses and street surfaces, some with cracks, puddles, or stains
  • entirely new graphical tilesets to expand the scope and playtime of the game. There are several other areas of the game that I'd like to explore, such as the surrounding islands, but at the moment I need to pick and choose due to costs

Each of these items can and will be addressed with the initial funding goal of $3000 in the order that I've listed them. If your support pushes beyond this goal, there are definitely additional features I would like to develop as well:

  • voice acting for all dialogue to bring the character interactions to life. This would be done by professional voice actors.
  • an additional playable character with their own storyline, quests, and way of solving puzzles. It's always been my idea to provide multiple points of view to any story and this character would be a perfect counterpoint to Samuel

My aim is quality over quantity, but a large quantity of quality is also completely ok too! So if you want to make a larger contribution, feel free to contact me and we can discuss it.

 

My name is Mike Jennings and I'm an independent game developer. At least, in my off hours. In order to fund this mad obsession, I work for the Canadian Department of National Defence as a Simulations Administrator, involved primarily in the design, administration, and support of Serious Games.

I've never released a game commercially before, but have been playing them for over 20 years. This is my passion and I hope that you'll all come with me on this journey and we can make a great game that we can all enjoy!

story:
Today is the day!!!! Redshift is now available on Android devices from the Google Play store! Link here!
https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.Big4Production.Redshift&hl=en

Redshift is currently in review by Apple and we will be sharing that link as soon as it becomes available!

~Big4Production


Hey everyone thank you so much for the great campaign and all of the support. We are hard at work to get Redshift done and out within the next few months. We will post big updates in here and our website www.big4production.com, otherwise to keep up with everything we are doing check out our Facebook and other social medias.

Thanks again for the great campaign and we will get Redshift out as soon as we can. 

~Big4Production


Here is our newest Pre-Alpha Testing of Redshift. We hope you enjoy. 
This contains game play from the first Planet of Redshift.


Big4Production has been working in the mobile games industry for a year and a half, and we really believe that Redshift is going to be the game that will launch us into creating games full time. In order to make Redshift the game that will make that dream possible, we are going to need your help. 

By contributing to this project you will not only be helping us make this great game but also contributing to the future of Big4 as a company and the quality of our future products. 

  • 20+ Levels
  • Multiple weapon types
  • Accelerometer based Mini games
  • Painted art style
  • Full length original soundtrack 
  • Dynamic Boss battles 
  • Interactive and immersive level selection

There are many different enemies in Redshift, each with their own custom look and animations. Besides the grunt enemies there are also epic bosses. Each of these bosses has their own custom fights. But be careful when facing these bosses they don’t die very easy.


Below are two enemies from Redshift. The crustaceous life forms of planet Triton, and the giant indigenous people of Talos 4. 

There are four different planets that you can travel to in Redshift.

Triton is a water-based planet. This is the first planet you travel in your pursuit of Viper. There are many different obstacles in this oceanic planet, such as crustaceous life forms and mechs that Viper has left behind after his influence.

Talos 4 is a barren ice wasteland. Not only are the native creatures deadly, there are giant indigenous people. Take this barren ice wasteland very carefully.

Izo is a lush jungle planet. Don’t take this planet lightly, not only are the indigenous people deadly, the plants are as well. This lush jungle will put you to the test you better be well prepared.

Minoroth is a planet that is now covered with cites. This is where Viper has his base of operations. There are mechs and traps everywhere; you have to be extremely cautious. 





Redshift is being developed with the use of Unity3D. With this great game engine we are going to be able to release to both the major mobile platforms Android and IOS.

 


Previously, we have been working on other mobile games. While Redshift was waiting in the wings, getting worked on a little bit at a time. In this time we have taken breaks on Redshift and focused on other games and vice versa. Some of the mobile games that we have finished in this time have been. 

                            Illusion of the Wind                Bad Christmas

   

                                 Sweet Escape                     Temple of Romu

     


Each of these games have been a stepping stone for Redshift. For example we couldn't do our 2D movement and our more advance GUI without Illusion, Temple and Bad Christmas. All of these mobile games that we have done have been  great stepping stones, but now we are ready to work on Redshift full time. This is where you come in. 


Here is an update showing you the design of some of our 3d miniatures. These are miniatures of some of the enemies encountered in Red Shift and are available to you as a perk for donating. 


The following is a breakdown of everything we need to make Redshift everything that it can be. 

Below is a graph of where our funding goes, this will include the funds that we raise from our campaign. 


As you can see from our chart, any and all funds collected will be used to improve the quality of Redshift. This also includes cross platform license fees, sound recording gear, office expenses, and testing devices.


    We wouldn't be crowd-funding without any perks! All of our contributors will get something back from us in the form of a physical or digital perk. 


    Donation amounts!

    • $1 = A Personal Thank You Email.
    • $5 = Your name in the Credits
    • $10 = 2 Digital Wallpapers
    • $25 = Sound Track
    • $50 = Digital Artbook
    • $75 = 3D Miniatures  
    • $100 = Early Game Access + Comic


    Please check out the perks section on the right hand side of the page to see a detailed explanation of what each perk is about. 

    We also have a plan to make Redshift even better if we reach a monetary amount higher than our original goal. 



    We are Big4Production, a small game company based out of Fargo, ND. We are made up of seven highly trained individuals from all walks of life that have come together to create something that we are all passionate about: great games; which is apparent in the titles we have created already.
    Who is Big4Production:


    Nick Wigtil
    Founder - President/CEO
    and Art Director 

    Nick founded Big4 two years ago and has been interested in programming and design since he was a wee lad. Nick primarily creates with Unreal4, Unity3D, 3Ds Max, ZBrush, After Effects, Blender, C#, and Photoshop. He is also in transition to become a instructor in the design department at Rasmussen College. 


    David Hermanson
    Creative Director and Lead Designer

    David has been working with Photoshop, Blender, 3Ds Max, and ZBrush for the past four years. David has been working with Big4 hoping to design great games. 


    Ben Earles
    3D Artist and Designer

    Ben has been designing for Big4 since the beginning of the company. He works primarily with 3Ds Max, Photoshop, Blender and Illustrator.


    Alison Shearer
    Concept Artist and Designer

    Alison is currently a student in Animation and Motion Graphics at Rasmussen College. She spends most of her time in Photoshop and Illustrator.


    Nicholas Ganoe
    Music Composer
    Head of Audio Production

    Nicholas is a Concordia College music program graduate and has been composing music for Big4 since last year primarily using Mixcraft software. He also manages the companies Twitter and Facebook fan pages. 


    Mason Donley
    Audio Engineer

    Mason has been working with audio for quite some time, and brings a very dynamic style to his work. He does his audio work using Fruity Loops software as well as Adobe Audition. 


    Michael Krueger                                                                                                                 Level Designer/Environmental Art

    The newest member of the Big4 team. Michael graduated from the game design program at Brown College in 2009. He specializes in level and environment creation. His primary tools have been 3ds max, adobe photoshop, and the unreal engine.


    We understand that not everyone can contribute to our campaign financially, but there are other ways that you can support us just as much!

    Please share this page or any of the Big4 affiliated pages in any way you can and help us get the word out about what we are trying to accomplish.

story:
Pixel Game Studio

We are a small, passionate start up studio with one goal in mind... Making amazing games. With experience in programming, visual art, and audio background.

As with most start up, we need funds to reach our goals. It is important for us to get the right tools so that the quality of our product meets our audience expectation. 

Knights of the Sumi is not just a game, but a universe. In our first game we want to introduce players to this new universe, characters and lore. At first glance you may just see a 2D side scrolling platformer, but stick with us and we promise more depth. The first game will be layered with adventure, puzzles and light comedy.


*******

Please note that game assets and graphics shown below are place holders only. Our team of artist are still finalising this content (which we will update when ready). Concept art is designed for this game and the above does not apply for the concept art.

*******


What We Need & What You Get

Help fund this project, and with your help we can better equip our studio with the tools we need. Below are some of the tools required:

  1. Full version of Unity 3D ~ $1500
  2. Unity Addons for IOS/Android and Team ~$3500
  3. New hardware with the power and oomph to ensure our systems meet the requirements of our game (Computers, Screens, Etc) ~$8000
  4. AutoCAD 3DS Max ~ $2070 per/year
  5. Photoshop ~$600
  6. Business expenses including Trademarking, Professional finance advice, Domain registration, Business Registrations, Insurances and all of those boring but important things as required.


Progress, Details, Feedback

Knights of the Sumi is currently in development. Below we have provided concept art using the in-game engine. This is to give our backers a look at what we are developing.

throughout the development process we will update this campaign with addition screen shots and videos to show our progress.

At this early stage with 0% of our campaign we will be publishing Knights of the Sumi on both Windows 8.1. As we reach the goals listed below we will announce more platforms. It all depends on our backers:

Goal 1 - $5000

Knights of the Sumi will publish on the following platforms (iPhone, Android, Windows Phone, PC)

Goal 2 - $25000

We will push to have game published on Steam, Xbox One, Playstation 4

*We cannot guarantee acceptance on to any of the above stores as it is up to the publisher/platform.

Game Specifics

Knights of the Sumi will support touch and keyboard control schemes. This is to allow us to publish to as many platforms as possible.

The game will be layed out in worlds. For example World 1-1, 1-2, 1-3. Based on the below goals we will achieve the following:

Goal 1 - $5000

  • Initial release: 5 Worlds
  • DLC 1: 2 Worlds
  • DLC 2: 2 Worlds
  • DLC 3: 2 Worlds

Goal 2 - $10000

  • Initial release: 7 Worlds
  • DLC 1: 2 Worlds
  • DLC 2: 2 Worlds
  • DLC 3: 2 Worlds

Goal 3 - $15000

  • Initial release: 8 Worlds
  • DLC 1: 3 Worlds
  • DLC 2: 3 Worlds
  • DLC 3: 3 Worlds

Goal 3 - $25000

  • Initial release: 10 Worlds
  • DLC 1: 3 Worlds
  • DLC 2: 3 Worlds
  • DLC 3: 3 Worlds


During our Alpha access (available to all backers - date to be announced soon) content will be made available via URL, with a feedback form so your voice can be heard. 

EARLY PRE-ALPHA CONTENT (Graphics are placeholders only for now) new screen shots coming soon!






All backers will receive early alpha access of the game for feedback! that's right we at Pixel Guys Studio want to hear your feedback and make the best game we can for you!

If we do not receive all funds required for this campaign we will use what we do raise to make the best game possible. We are in it for the long haul.


    Other Ways You Can Help

    Coming Soon.

During our Alpha access (available to all backers - date to be announced soon) content will be made available via URL, with a feedback form so your voice can be heard. EARLY PRE-ALPHA CONTENT (Graphics are placeholders only for now) new screen shots coming soon!All backers will receive early alpha access of the game for feedback! that's right we at Pixel Guys Studio want to hear your feedback and make the best game we can for you!If we do not receive all funds required for this campaign we will use what we do raise to make the best game possible. We are in it for the long haul.    Other Ways You Can Help Coming Soon.

story:
What is Spectre?

Spectre is a 2D action game inspired by Hotline Miami and the Hitman series. Players accept contracts as a professional assassin and must find ways to take out their targets - Whether it involves sneaking into a guarded compound in the dead of night or making them disappear from a public place in broad daylight.

Levels will be diverse in both style and tactics required to complete them. I plan to include missions set in public places with civilians to blend in with and also missions behind enemy lines where enemies will shoot on sight.


Right now, Spectre has been in development for just over a month. The gameplay basics are there with only a few more pieces to add and there are several stages of a level completed.  Your backing will help me finish the gameplay development and work fully on levels and content for the game.

Project Goals

£2000 - This is the minimum amount of money that I need to develop Spectre. With this money I will be able to buy a professional license for Unity and pay for some assets such as sounds.

£2500 - With an extra few hundred pounds I will be able to pay for high quality sound effects for Spectre and also an original soundtrack for the game.

£5000 - Extra money will pay for a new PC for me which will speed up development time by running Unity smoother and increasing rendering times for trailers etc. This will also pay for any nescessary assets such as Photoshop for the creation of posters and in game art.


    How you can help

    Contributing to the development of Spectre with a cash donation will obviously be a huge help but you can also help by spreading the word about Spectre over the social media and with your friends. The more people who know about the game, the more likely it is to get funded.

story:
Short Summary

Hi all, my name is Joe. I used to be a software developer, but then followed my passion into the stock market. Whilst doing that, i worked on my other passion, a mobile device game idea i came up with a few years ago. I was about to commission someone to build it (as i don't do this sort of programming), when the GFC hit. Unfortunately, i had too much (not that i ever had a great deal to begin with) invested in the stock market and was left pretty much penniless. Oh well, c'est la vie. At least i still have food on the table.

The game itself is simple, meant for just passing the time, if your at a bus stop or waiting for a friend or just sitting around, bored. Easy to get started and easy to finish up. There is no violence or sexual themes, just good wholesome fun, not meant to be too complex, fun for all ages. However in saying that, the first few levels will be easier, so at least the more novice or younger players still get to enjoy it, but as you get through the first few levels, it will pose a challenge for the more adventurous at heart.

The game is a bubble game, with lots of player interaction, similar play to Fruit Ninja, but the game is completely different.

Your contributions will directly help fund the games production, marketing and legal costs.

Everyone needs a dream, something to believe in, to work toward, a passion, otherwise what's the point.

What We Need & What You Get

The amount i'm asking for is enormous ($16,500) and i honestly feel terrible asking other people to give up money for something to me, however there just is no other way at this point in time. If you do find it in your heart to donate to my cause, i promise i will fulfill my end of the deal and i simply wont be able to thank you all enough..

The money will go towards these things:

Legal work - protecting the game from copycats and also the developer.. don't want him stealing it.

Building the game - (the second largest cost) a professional developer will be commissioned, as i can't do it

Marketing - (bulk of the cost) a never ending pit, creating pre-release buzz, getting the game out to reviewers and bloggers.

No monies will be used for living or other expenses, the games development and release will take all of it, plus what i've already put in.

A $5 donation will get you an electronic version of the rules and a screen dump of a random game level, pre-release, so you get to see the game before the world does and of course, a huge thank you and my absolute gratitude.

A $25 donation will get you the same as $5 donation plus a mention in the credits.

A $150 donation will get you the same as $25 donation plus your initials will be displayed on screen as a character is removed.

If i don't reach the total donation amount, any monies received will first go to legal costs, that way i can spread the word without too much concern. Then anything left over will go to the games development.

The Impact

Although i have never had to do it for myself, i've manged a few software development projects, from conception to delivery. I have every confidence that i will be able to oversee this project from design to development to release.

The game will be professionally built, this is where a lot of the cost comes into it. It will be built in Unity 3D, that makes the game multi platformed, meaning it will run on Apple, Microsoft and Google enabled devices, this will increase my potential sales market.

The game will take approximately 2 months to build, then there will be time for testing, then there is pre-release marketing and buzz building, reviews by game bloggers etc.. then the official upload into Itunes and the Android store.

Still not sure whether to give to this project, well it's ok, there are lots of worthy campaigns on this site. However feel free to contact me, i will be happy to answer your questions.

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't donate monies, i know the feeling, no need to worry, you can be of enormous help in another way.

If your an expert in this field and feel you can value ad, please contact me, i would love to hear from you, especially the marketing side of it, do you know or are you a game reviewer/blogger. Once i release the details of the game, you may be able to help me get the word out. Work in legal, can you suggest ways to protect my IP.

Send me your email address and some details about how you think you can help, i will add you to a contact list and send you the details of the game. Word of mouth is everything.

Tell all your friends, use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word.

Thanks to everyone for taking the time to read this far.. peace to the world..

story:
PayPal contributions are enabled again!

Contributors who choose a perk will get their contribution back in Gameolith Credit!

What is Gameolith?

 

Gameolith (www.gameolith.com) is a game download store for Linux. We provide installation packages for Ubuntu, Debian GNU/Linux and Fedora, and tarballs for everyone else. We've set out to prove that Linux is truly a viable platform for gaming.

But for us, that isn't enough. We want to let gamers take their games anywhere. That's why we want to create an Android version of our store.

 

The Impact

We intend to supply Android games in a quite unconventional way. Everyone who buys or has bought a game off our store with an Android version will get it for free! We will be using part of the money to assist developers in creating Android versions of their games and in bringing more games to Linux!

If we don't get the full $10,000 by the deadline, we'll try to keep going on what we have. All claimed perks will still be sent out.

What's the money going to be spent on?

We need the money to help us fund the development of Gameolith for Android. We will need an assortment of Android devices of different specifications that we can develop and test on. It's not just phones we need (although we can and will be repurposing our own Android phones for testing), we need tablets as well. The costs of creating this will cost at least $5000, probably more.

Once the development of Gameolith for Android is complete, we'll be using this equipment and our experience in app development to assist game developers in creating Android games for sale on Gameolith.

We also need to expand on what we already have with Gameolith by bringing on a couple more programmers on a part-time basis, so Jonathan isn't trying to do everything at once. Right now, he's the only one working on the website, and although he can do the work, there's only so much one man can do. 

In addition, we need to start a US-based subsidary of our company, so we can access more payment solutions - such as Amazon Payments, Google Checkout (US dollar payments) and Stripe for direct card payments. This will cost us around $1400 just to do the right paperwork and set up bank accounts, without taking into account unexpected problems requiring trips to the US. This will also mean it's a bit easier to hire people within the US to work for us.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't want to contribute to this campaign, you can always help by buying games off the website! It'd also be great if you were to tell developers about us, and follow us on Facebook and Twitter.
