story:
Ludum Dare 26 Jam Entry

This April, we set out along with many thousands of other excited game developers from across the world, amateur and professional alike, to create a game over the course of a single weekend.  The event, Ludum Dare, is a global game jam, and ostensibly a competition, but everyone gets the same prize: the opportunity to create a game and share it with the world.  Our prize was a game called Aduno, and we're quite excited about it!

First thing's first, though - if you haven't heard of Ludum Dare before today, please stop what you're doing and check out the games!  We're biased to our game, of course, but there are so many other spectacular entries (Over 2,000!), it would be a shame if ours was the only one you played!

Okay, now that that's said: you can play the competition version of Aduno for free today.  Play it here: Aduno: Ludum Dare 26 Entry, or click the Gallery tab above for downloads.

Where We Stand Today

With very positive reception so far, and a number of requests from fellow competitors to create a mobile version of the game, we're looking to fully polish and complete Aduno, and optimize the presentation of the game with mobile phones and tablets in mind.  We have all the ability and motivation we need to do so, but we're looking for a bit of help with the basic costs of getting there.

What We Need

We don't need much to get started - we're not looking to take time off from our day jobs or for extra cash in our pockets at the end of the day.  The costs for us to bring Aduno to Android and iOS are as follows:

  • $399 for a Xamarin.iOS/MonoTouch license, which will allow us to release Aduno on iOS.  The framework we are using (LibGDX) allows for a speedy and relatively painless release on iOS, but we need to purchase a MonoTouch license first.
  • $99 for an iOS developer license, a requirement to publish on the App Store, and $25 for an Android developer registration.
  • ~$400-500 for a nice web domain - this will give us somewhere to host the desktop version of Aduno, news about the game, and also to provide support and have a web presence for Aduno, as well as any future creations of ours.

We are able to front some of this cost ourselves, but not all - that's why we're hoping we can receive just a tiny push from the community to help us get where we're going.  Even just a dollar would be much appreciated, and very helpful.

Thanks for checking out Aduno, and thanks for supporting events like Ludum Dare!  Now go play a few more Ludum Dare entries!

story:
Visit the website at http://crazy-mansion.heim.at

 

These facts are based on our currently game concept that can change a bit during development.

--->  Classic oldshool adventure game for the PC-System (Windows PC System, at least 1 Ghz, 128 MB graphic-card DirectX 9, Screenresolution 1280x720 / 1024x768, 512 MB System Ram, Soundcard or onboard soundchip, at least 2 GB Diskspace)

--->  DRM Free

--->  Language: English and German (maybe more)

--->  All ingame dialogs dubbed, also a dubbed storyteller during  the game

--->  Painted 2D graphics

--->  A game interface like "S.C.U.M.M. (TM)"

--->  45 screens right now...

--->  ...and it's not only playing in the mansion

--->  Around 300 objects

--->  20 characters

--->  One playable main character, but at some points in the game the possibility to play other side characters

--->  For now one intro and 3 different endings of the game

--->  2 hours of composed music

 

--->  Dozens of puzzles and...

--->  ... do you remember some stuff like "microwaving the hamster", just to see what will happen? There are many of those things to do in the game. Also there are plenty of what we call "Subquests" (do something, solve puzzles) to see the outcome of your doings. This is beside the main storyline.

--->  The game will be full of dialogs witg black humor, satire, sarcasm, mocking, paradox, blasphemy....

--->  There should be around 20 hours of playing time invested to solve the game

 

 

 

 

Anybody knows the story about the mysterious incident that should have happened at the old Mansion in the forest some years ago...


A Meteorite hit near the old Mansion. The genius professor who lived there with his family went instantly insane. He was driven by this extraterrestrial, who used him for his evil plan to destroy the world.
The professor even hijacked a young girl, called Sandy.
This was his big mistake. A group of some courageous children who only wanted to save their friends life then saved our world.

 

 

This is the story that is still told to all children who aren't well-behaved.
But... "Thats all fucking shit!!", thought the ten years old little kid Timmy.
Today was the first working day in his young life. He really wanted to earn some money to get this new cool Playstation 3 "Modern Warfuck" Edition. It was hard for him to persuade his mother, that he can deliver the newspapers.

After some hard working hours and ten miles on foot there was only one New York Dimes left to deliver. But this last Magazine was addressed for the Old Mansion! Timmy still remembered the words of his mother: 'Take you job seriously, boy! If you throw only one newspaper away you'll get fired! I will ask everywhere if they got a newspaper!'.

Fearfully he went down the road to the old mansion. Just before the entrance of the building he stopped. What the hell! He was totally shocked. The door opened very slowly. He didn't know what he was seeing.

There was an evil looking green monster, looking like the tentacle that he saw in a friends computer game out of the stoneage some weeks ago. This thing began to talk! 'Hey kid, do you got something to eat for me??' 'WAHHH!' Timmy cried and ran away.

He lost his last newspaper on the way, lost his job then.
His mother was frustrated cause she thought the child was using drugs, like all other boys in the neighborhood.

Only Timmy's Uncle, the self claimed "Ghost Hunter" Detlef Digger, believed the words of the boy. Sure he did! Detlef is a former police officer, and worked in the drug department.
Unfortunately he got fired because he consumed all confiscated drugs over years.

In his life he always believed anything from aliens to the illuminati. Maybe the drugs were far too much.
He was ten years without a job. Then the mid-30 though it could be a good idea
to make himself independent. So nowerdays he walks from one retirement home to another to find more mad old people who believe that they need a ghost hunter. Fore sure after a lot of persuading and maybe with the help of a friend who like fasching costumes.

One night Detlef sat in his cellar office. He though how he could expand his "customer range". Then an old woman called Detlef and cried for help.

 

 

 

 

This Old woman told him something about kidnapping, strange acting persons, a slimy creature who has bulimia, a telefonbook where she got his number in the section and she mentioned the old Mansion.

 

Of course she also talked about ... Adolf Hitler... the rubble women after the end of world war two... her own war imprisonment and how russian soldiers died while raping her ... her twenty cat's in the last 60 years ... and more bullshit.

To be gentle Detlef listened to her monolog until he heared a load scream and someone hang up the phone.

Detlef realized that there must be a connection in what Timmy told him and this... There must be something going on in the Old Mansion.!

So Detlef decided to visit the old Mansion. In the same Night he started his journey into the biggest Adventure of his Live.

 

 

There were two different opinions in our team.

One part of us think that this crowd-funding idea is great and offers the possibility for people like us to launch a huge project. Thats just the opinion of some of us.

The other opinion was, that it seems to some of us, that only some already known people (who got huge success in the entertainment business already) have a chance to realise a well funded project here.

One of us said : "It's entirely utopistic to even think of it. All the funded projects and people behind use all possibilities, like existing contacts in the business, an already huge set-up community or a lot of money to promote a project. The people that should profit from the crowdfunding project can't profit from it."

But we don't share the same opinion in this matter, and thats okay.
We discussed this topic for a long time. In the end we decided to give it a try.

We don't want to entertain the masses with an old school adventure game.
How could we ? This kind of game-genre is not suitable for the mass today.
So we can't rely on external sources, like publishers that want to
make money like hell and have creative control everywhere.
They urge every developer to produce another ultra-realistic 3D Shooter
that the mass of people want to play...

In this times, it would be financial suicide for us to borrow any (more) money from banks. Most of us also got a family to feed, a "normal" everday job and we were and are not able to do something of this scale alone.

So if at least one of us can quit the normal job and make this project like it should be (a year of fulltime work on it...) we need an alternative.

And there it came one day that one of us told the rest that there is this new crowdfunding website, where new projects get funded. Indiegogo with it's independent development community could be what we needed... maybe.

 

We are huge fans of creative independent games, and this is a chance to prove that there are still other people around that demand for an unique story and puzzle driven, crazy, old shool adventure game.

Our all time favourite is the game that started it all: Maniac Mansion (C) by
Lucas Arts.

  • We want to do something "new" and create our very own Adventure Game
  • We got our ready game concept with all our special ideas, dialogs and scripts in place. It's ready since we wrote on it together mid-2004. This 300 pages concept is huge and contains much of allusions to the adventure games of the past.
  • We want to take the best from this classic (like the interface idea... ) and bring it up into our time, to worship the cult-game we love so much. Also we would use some things from this classic game that started an era. (those parts can easily be used without copyright violations)
  • We want to relaunch our crazy-mansion project (from 2005) on a big scale with the help of this crowdfunding idea.... maybe ?!

To finance a real big old school adventure project, that should reach up to our surely high expectations, we need you !
Are there enough crazy people out there who want this
"Crazy Mansion" old school adventure ?

 

 

 

 

 

The team under Simon's supervision want to develop a classic point-and-click adventure game.

The development would take place in a period of one year.
Our success isn't making lot's of money, but to "sprout" during the process of creating the game we always wanted to make. At least one of us also have really would like to quit the present job to work on the project fulltime.

Thanks to the possibilities of the internet today (with high speed data transfer), we don't have to work in one place all the time. So a rented office is not urgently required. But we need at least the money to meet up with all members at least once in a week.

Also we need to hire more full time or part time graphic artist.
We want to get them paid for the work, so we could expect the results
that we want to get. They are needed to get the huge amount of artwork done.
Also one of us is looking forward to train a bit with them :)
He can and already had scetched lot's of stuff that we got in mind. He is a bit
capable of colorization. But he did his work in the past when the highest resolution was 320x240 pixel. So he can "pixelate", but we want a game in a modern high resulution.

Our main goal is to attract the gamer with highly professional voice acting.
That's something that will be expensive. We really want to hire some of the known talent to do the synchronization of the ingame speech....
So there are costs to hire this talent and the soundstudio.
Also we need english voice actors.

The game should be released in german and english language.
So some assistance with translating all texts into the english language is required... If you read our text until now you know why ;)
We also want to pay a fee for this work, because at some point we need to get the german source script translated with all dialogs and that's huge.

Furthermore we need money for a new domain and the webtraffic for a release, an appealing new website, of course the franchise articles for our supporters, licensed sounds, maybe some advertising, the license of a special game engine that we prefer to use and many other little things.

 

 

Every amount of money for this project is great!

With more funding, we can "walk faster and better" towards our goal. We think that we need at least around 10.000$. That's the money to get the game done in around 1 year, like we got it in mind (e.g. pay additional pro-staff for graphic-arts and voice overs).

Less money means less capabilities. We need more time, it's much harder to get the huge artwork done, we can't get our engine licensed and so on.

But it's great to get more funding than needed,  because this only means more improvement in many ways.

A much higher funding could mean...:

--->  Maybe we could rent an office building

--->  Some of us (or maybe all) could quit their normal daily job to work fulltime

--->  We could hire more extra staff. This means a lot more animations, artwork and a lot of cutscenes as well as even more game content

--->  We could port it to Mac Platforms, iOS and Android Platforms and Linux as well

--->  A Translation into more languages is passible: French, Spanish, Italian, Russian

--->  We can get the best possible voice-over artists for all languages

--->  We could deliver the game also as a boxed version, with a Printed Game Manual and a nice poster.

--->  We could advertise for the game on a big scale, like ads in game magazines

--->  We could think about doing another game....

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

         Wow, is this woman hot! ;) Beware, it's an alien! 

 

There is this list on the right side, please have a look.

Something that is very important for us is to ensure that every one who donate a small contribution get the game. So anyone who donate at least 5$ get the digital copy (download possibility) of the finished game.

You would get some rewards as fast as possible (like a T-Shirt, Mousepad, Poster etc.) Some other rewards need some time, like the soundtrack and something like this.

Something that we want to do is build up a private online community.

This means that we let all backers discuss the project with us.
There will be a point, when we need to hear your thoughts and feelings about the game's content and direction that we want to show you in this community.
So we plan on votings on decisions when we think it could help.
Some Backers will also have access to a tech-demo, alpha and beta version, once they are available.

We can't specify at this point that we sell a real boxed version of the game later (or send this to people who donate a special amount).

It could be, but that is something that we want to decide later,
because this depends on the project funding.
One thing is for sure, we want to focus on doing a game and we are not intrested in making big money.

 

 

No. Our game is not a remake and of course there is already a good one avaible.

It's also nothing that you can call a sequel to "Maniac Mansion" or "Day of the tentacle".

We wrote a new crazy and unique story. It's very different.We certainly play a bit with things from Maniac Mansion and many other games.
That's the way we pay tribute to this masterpieces.
We use some things fom Maniac Mansion that are necessary in our view.

We don't have any copyrights to Maniac Mansion (it's copyrighted by Lucas Art.). Because we don't want to break any copyright law we never use e.g. names or something that could lead us in trouble.

 

 

 

Simon Henkes ("Antimort")
– Writer, director and producer

Robert Knoof ("Black Knight")
– Co-producer

Dimitri Kurt ("Kenzor")
- Voice actor, lead tester

Timo Maler ("Neo 187")
– Website administrator, promotional work

Michael Sahle ("Micksoul")
– Lead programmer and scripter

Marcus Kästner ("Vailor")
– Art director, character and background artist

Dirk Henkes ("Avendion")
– Lead Music Composer, sound designer and editor

 

Our Story so far:

Since 20 years we (the team known as "Desperate Studios") are all friends with a passion. This passion is based up on our shared memories of the old days of computer gaming. As we grown up as kids we loved to play together, this started with the first Atari consoles that we owned.

As much as we loved playing, we always loved it to create games.
It's not a lie if I tell you that after a half year in shool we started pogramming our first C-64 basic-games (with 6 years).

Every one of us got his special talent. One of us liked to program, while the others deliver a story idea, made the graphics and the music.

We did so many games and programs on the early home computer systems, the C-64 and Amiga. Also some of us made music for the huge demo-scene at this time. Some of the programs, games and demos we made were released as public domain on Germany's Diskmagazine "Game On" and "Magic Disk 64".
There are projects in our memories for ever, like our first graphic-text-adventure "The Castles of Manderscheid"... based up on a fairy tale that was told kids around the "Eifel" in Germany about two castles.
I could go on for hours now...

We must admit, we were part of a cracking group for some time.
But this wasn't something "illegal" in our mind and we don't regret it.
We shared the whole cracking group "philosophy", you know "Try it... you like it then buy it". So we cracked many classic games... the last one I remember was "Ufo-Terror from the Deep". A Great game!

We always did it "for the fun".

In this former time people were able to create games on the current
technological state.... without investing a penny :) Nowerdays you would'nt even think to make a modern 3D game without millions of dollar in the back.

For a period of time we fall in love with the first MMORPG "Ultima Online"
(a milestone of in gaming history). We ran a "free to play" shard for a long time called "Lemuria". This was a funny time.

We are all grown up now, we got our "normal" every day jobs.
But we never lost our hobby and passion.

The times have changed.
One game is still present: Maniac Mansion.
This classic masterpiece was something that we all loved so much.
One time we discovered how to edit all the text in the game, that was so funny to redo all the script.

We played it together and it's for ever in our mind. The reason is
simple, because it started the new era of Point&Click Adventure games.
Many of the games that followed were amazing.
We want to worship this game(s)...

 

(C) of all the content of this campaign by Desperate Studios 2012

 

 

Updates:

25.06.2012 - Neo has nearly finished the Homepage. Also we discussed today what to do next and we made some cuts to stuff (some of the game characters, screens, puzzles, side quests). We think this a little bit in size reduced concept is much better to realise.... We can swap anytime if necessary.
story_txt:
Visit the website at http://crazy-mansion.heim.at
 

These facts are based on our currently game concept that can change a bit during development.

--->  Classic oldshool adventure game for the PC-System (Windows PC System, at least 1 Ghz, 128 MB graphic-card DirectX 9, Screenresolution 1280x720 / 1024x768, 512 MB System Ram, Soundcard or onboard soundchip, at least 2 GB Diskspace)
--->  DRM Free
--->  Language: English and German (maybe more)
--->  All ingame dialogs dubbed, also a dubbed storyteller during  the game
--->  Painted 2D graphics
--->  A game interface like "S.C.U.M.M. (TM)"
--->  45 screens right now...
--->  ...and it's not only playing in the mansion
--->  Around 300 objects
--->  20 characters
--->  One playable main character, but at some points in the game the possibility to play other side characters
--->  For now one intro and 3 different endings of the game
--->  2 hours of composed music
 
--->  Dozens of puzzles and...
--->  ... do you remember some stuff like "microwaving the hamster", just to see what will happen? There are many of those things to do in the game. Also there are plenty of what we call "Subquests" (do something, solve puzzles) to see the outcome of your doings. This is beside the main storyline.
--->  The game will be full of dialogs witg black humor, satire, sarcasm, mocking, paradox, blasphemy....
--->  There should be around 20 hours of playing time invested to solve the game
 
 

 
 

Anybody knows the story about the mysterious incident that should have happened at the old Mansion in the forest some years ago...
A Meteorite hit near the old Mansion. The genius professor who lived there with his family went instantly insane. He was driven by this extraterrestrial, who used him for his evil plan to destroy the world.The professor even hijacked a young girl, called Sandy.This was his big mistake. A group of some courageous children who only wanted to save their friends life then saved our world.

 
 
This is the story that is still told to all children who aren't well-behaved.But... "Thats all fucking shit!!", thought the ten years old little kid Timmy.Today was the first working day in his young life. He really wanted to earn some money to get this new cool Playstation 3 "Modern Warfuck" Edition. It was hard for him to persuade his mother, that he can deliver the newspapers.
After some hard working hours and ten miles on foot there was only one New York Dimes left to deliver. But this last Magazine was addressed for the Old Mansion! Timmy still remembered the words of his mother: 'Take you job seriously, boy! If you throw only one newspaper away you'll get fired! I will ask everywhere if they got a newspaper!'.

Fearfully he went down the road to the old mansion. Just before the entrance of the building he stopped. What the hell! He was totally shocked. The door opened very slowly. He didn't know what he was seeing.
There was an evil looking green monster, looking like the tentacle that he saw in a friends computer game out of the stoneage some weeks ago. This thing began to talk! 'Hey kid, do you got something to eat for me??' 'WAHHH!' Timmy cried and ran away.
He lost his last newspaper on the way, lost his job then. His mother was frustrated cause she thought the child was using drugs, like all other boys in the neighborhood.
Only Timmy's Uncle, the self claimed "Ghost Hunter" Detlef Digger, believed the words of the boy. Sure he did! Detlef is a former police officer, and worked in the drug department.Unfortunately he got fired because he consumed all confiscated drugs over years.
In his life he always believed anything from aliens to the illuminati. Maybe the drugs were far too much.He was ten years without a job. Then the mid-30 though it could be a good ideato make himself independent. So nowerdays he walks from one retirement home to another to find more mad old people who believe that they need a ghost hunter. Fore sure after a lot of persuading and maybe with the help of a friend who like fasching costumes.
One night Detlef sat in his cellar office. He though how he could expand his "customer range". Then an old woman called Detlef and cried for help.
 
 
 
 
This Old woman told him something about kidnapping, strange acting persons, a slimy creature who has bulimia, a telefonbook where she got his number in the section and she mentioned the old Mansion.
 
Of course she also talked about ... Adolf Hitler... the rubble women after the end of world war two... her own war imprisonment and how russian soldiers died while raping her ... her twenty cat's in the last 60 years ... and more bullshit. To be gentle Detlef listened to her monolog until he heared a load scream and someone hang up the phone.
Detlef realized that there must be a connection in what Timmy told him and this... There must be something going on in the Old Mansion.!
So Detlef decided to visit the old Mansion. In the same Night he started his journey into the biggest Adventure of his Live.
 
 

There were two different opinions in our team.
One part of us think that this crowd-funding idea is great and offers the possibility for people like us to launch a huge project. Thats just the opinion of some of us.
The other opinion was, that it seems to some of us, that only some already known people (who got huge success in the entertainment business already) have a chance to realise a well funded project here.
One of us said : "It's entirely utopistic to even think of it. All the funded projects and people behind use all possibilities, like existing contacts in the business, an already huge set-up community or a lot of money to promote a project. The people that should profit from the crowdfunding project can't profit from it."
But we don't share the same opinion in this matter, and thats okay. We discussed this topic for a long time. In the end we decided to give it a try.
We don't want to entertain the masses with an old school adventure game. How could we ? This kind of game-genre is not suitable for the mass today.So we can't rely on external sources, like publishers that want to make money like hell and have creative control everywhere. They urge every developer to produce another ultra-realistic 3D Shooter that the mass of people want to play...

In this times, it would be financial suicide for us to borrow any (more) money from banks. Most of us also got a family to feed, a "normal" everday job and we were and are not able to do something of this scale alone.
So if at least one of us can quit the normal job and make this project like it should be (a year of fulltime work on it...) we need an alternative.
And there it came one day that one of us told the rest that there is this new crowdfunding website, where new projects get funded. Indiegogo with it's independent development community could be what we needed... maybe.
 

We are huge fans of creative independent games, and this is a chance to prove that there are still other people around that demand for an unique story and puzzle driven, crazy, old shool adventure game.
Our all time favourite is the game that started it all: Maniac Mansion (C) by Lucas Arts.

We want to do something "new" and create our very own Adventure Game
We got our ready game concept with all our special ideas, dialogs and scripts in place. It's ready since we wrote on it together mid-2004. This 300 pages concept is huge and contains much of allusions to the adventure games of the past.
We want to take the best from this classic (like the interface idea... ) and bring it up into our time, to worship the cult-game we love so much. Also we would use some things from this classic game that started an era. (those parts can easily be used without copyright violations)
We want to relaunch our crazy-mansion project (from 2005) on a big scale with the help of this crowdfunding idea.... maybe ?!
To finance a real big old school adventure project, that should reach up to our surely high expectations, we need you !Are there enough crazy people out there who want this"Crazy Mansion" old school adventure ?
 
 
 
 
 

The team under Simon's supervision want to develop a classic point-and-click adventure game.
The development would take place in a period of one year.Our success isn't making lot's of money, but to "sprout" during the process of creating the game we always wanted to make. At least one of us also have really would like to quit the present job to work on the project fulltime.
Thanks to the possibilities of the internet today (with high speed data transfer), we don't have to work in one place all the time. So a rented office is not urgently required. But we need at least the money to meet up with all members at least once in a week.
Also we need to hire more full time or part time graphic artist. We want to get them paid for the work, so we could expect the results that we want to get. They are needed to get the huge amount of artwork done. Also one of us is looking forward to train a bit with them :) He can and already had scetched lot's of stuff that we got in mind. He is a bit capable of colorization. But he did his work in the past when the highest resolution was 320x240 pixel. So he can "pixelate", but we want a game in a modern high resulution.
Our main goal is to attract the gamer with highly professional voice acting.That's something that will be expensive. We really want to hire some of the known talent to do the synchronization of the ingame speech.... So there are costs to hire this talent and the soundstudio. Also we need english voice actors.
The game should be released in german and english language.So some assistance with translating all texts into the english language is required... If you read our text until now you know why ;)We also want to pay a fee for this work, because at some point we need to get the german source script translated with all dialogs and that's huge.Furthermore we need money for a new domain and the webtraffic for a release, an appealing new website, of course the franchise articles for our supporters, licensed sounds, maybe some advertising, the license of a special game engine that we prefer to use and many other little things.
 
 

Every amount of money for this project is great!
With more funding, we can "walk faster and better" towards our goal. We think that we need at least around 10.000$. That's the money to get the game done in around 1 year, like we got it in mind (e.g. pay additional pro-staff for graphic-arts and voice overs).
Less money means less capabilities. We need more time, it's much harder to get the huge artwork done, we can't get our engine licensed and so on.
But it's great to get more funding than needed,  because this only means more improvement in many ways.
A much higher funding could mean...:
--->  Maybe we could rent an office building
--->  Some of us (or maybe all) could quit their normal daily job to work fulltime
--->  We could hire more extra staff. This means a lot more animations, artwork and a lot of cutscenes as well as even more game content
--->  We could port it to Mac Platforms, iOS and Android Platforms and Linux as well
--->  A Translation into more languages is passible: French, Spanish, Italian, Russian
--->  We can get the best possible voice-over artists for all languages
--->  We could deliver the game also as a boxed version, with a Printed Game Manual and a nice poster.
--->  We could advertise for the game on a big scale, like ads in game magazines
--->  We could think about doing another game....
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
         Wow, is this woman hot! ;) Beware, it's an alien! 
 

There is this list on the right side, please have a look.
Something that is very important for us is to ensure that every one who donate a small contribution get the game. So anyone who donate at least 5$ get the digital copy (download possibility) of the finished game.
You would get some rewards as fast as possible (like a T-Shirt, Mousepad, Poster etc.) Some other rewards need some time, like the soundtrack and something like this.
Something that we want to do is build up a private online community.
This means that we let all backers discuss the project with us.There will be a point, when we need to hear your thoughts and feelings about the game's content and direction that we want to show you in this community.So we plan on votings on decisions when we think it could help. Some Backers will also have access to a tech-demo, alpha and beta version, once they are available.
We can't specify at this point that we sell a real boxed version of the game later (or send this to people who donate a special amount).
It could be, but that is something that we want to decide later,because this depends on the project funding.One thing is for sure, we want to focus on doing a game and we are not intrested in making big money.

It's also nothing that you can call a sequel to "Maniac Mansion" or "Day of the tentacle".

story:
We guide ultra luxury ski and ride trips in the Colorado Rockies. Our adventures are unique, live-in, 24/7, indulgent, ultra luxury experiences. We include it all, exclusive transportation, 3 meal per day and over the top accommodations all while saving you the stress & hassle of having to figure it all out on your own. And to do so efficiently we need a cool comfortable vehicle to get all you all safely to the mountain in style.

Which gets us to this campaign. We are reaching out to like-minded people to help with funding the growth of our operation. Specifically we are looking to purchase a Zero G branded vehicle to help with the ride-sharing service our sustainability plan calls for. So we created the "Vehicle Graffiti Project."

Our goal is to cover the vehicle with 2500 names of willing supporters in a "Graffiti Style" montage. Individuals willing to offer up $10 to get their name or text featured on our vehicle will be doing more than just helping us grow. They will be building a brand and becoming an immortalized part of the Zero Gravity family, having their names and contributions immortalized in a actual moving work of art. Each $10 contribution gets the contributors' name or approved text on our vehicle. We're really excited to see how your name and/or text will shape the brand of Zero Gravity!


 

The Three Peaks 2014 Ski Chateau! Part of the travel perks.


The funding of our first van will contribute ride-sharing for our guests throughout the year and help us share the Colorado back-country ski/ride terrain with you. That's why I dreamed up Zero Gravity Snoventures.

By cutting down on rental cars and focusing on ride sharing, we are able to reduce smog, prevent major highway building and preserve the unique and natural character of Dillon, Breckenridge and the other towns in the High Rockies. 

The whole idea for the business really started watching the rich and famous walk into their huge ski chateaus and thinking it would be sick to stay there... Yeah... if it was in my budget and my time window for vacation. Zero G gives you access to the ultra luxury life-style that you'd always envied in a sustainable way. Without increasing mansion imprint!

The Van Is the Plan

Let me break it down for you, we need a cool efficient vehicle, either a Sprinter or a Tahoe or 2 to help transport you around the Summit County area. We are looking at used, hybrid options and how to share our resources with others. Finding reliable hybrid vans that function at 8500 feet isn't easy.

But other benefits to public ride-sharing are,

  • save gas
  • allow us to become a ride-share option in Summit County
  • jobs
Ways to Make Skiing Sustainable 

Our model is all about using current resources such as under-utilized real estate to avoid building new structures and increasing our footprint. Fund us at one of the travel levels and find out how we do that!  

Fun times on the mountain

Zero stress, zero hassle, zero gravity adventure experiences.


Private room with bath. Part of the travel perks. Sometimes the receiving is as good as the giving.

Zero Gravity Snoventures guides ultra-luxury ski/ride adventures.  The 2014 Zero G Chateau boasts 8620 square feet, spacious rooms with private bathrooms, a hot tub, incredible views and more. Our tour experiences allow you to ski/ride multiple mountain resorts in short 4 night stays. 

Plus we have 24 hour concierge service to make your snoventure an unmatched experience you'll never forget. And we cook for you too! Three squares a day are included in our ski tour packages. The only main thing not covered is airfare and incidentals. 

The travel perks in our campaign are scheduled for travel between January and April of 2014.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute, a good word about this project works wonders.

  • Sharing this campaign on Facebook
  • Inviting friends who might be interested
Or even just checking out our site and dreaming about that ski and ride day. 

Thank you so much for your support at any level. Can't wait to meet all of you up the hill!

story:
Update:

The Fundraiser has finished!

And while I didn’t quite reach my target, it was great to see the support I received for this project, and it has really motivated me to give everything I can to this project. I’d like to say a very heartfelt thanks to everyone who has supported me so far.

But though the fundraising has ended, that doesn’t mean I’ll be going radio silent!

You can head over to the official blog for the game at:

http://knightsRPG.blogspot.com

This will be where all the latest information about the game will be found, including an opportunity for anyone who wanted to donate, but ran out of time, to still contribute to the game, and for the time being to still have access to the same perks. These will of course be closed off as development progresses on the game.

Thanks to everyone that has helped the project so far, and I look forward to sharing the finished game with you all!

James.

 

Demo Time!

Yes, I have finished a demo of the game! Just download the file here:

http://bit.ly/knightsDemo

Then install & start playing the demo!

Let me know what you think of it! Either here or via twitter at twitter.com/jfdoyle or on facebook.com/knightsRPG

And when you’re finished all that, come back here and donate!


 

 

Original:

Hello there!

I’m James and I am both an avid gamer and a long-time reader of superhero comics. I’ve spent years thinking to myself that a story driven RPG set in a world of superheroes would be really fun. So far, I still haven’t found what I’m looking for (I guess Bono was on to something...). Sure there have been a few online RPG’s (City of Heroes, Champions Online, DC Universe Online), and these games were a lot of fun, but what I want is a single-player game that tells me a story, not just supplying a story as a background to blowing things/people up.

And, so, I thought, if the game isn’t going to be made for me, then why don’t I make that game myself? I’ve been writing fiction for years and writing for games has always been something that’s attracted me. I’ve played around with pixel-art for a long time and I studied Computer Science in college. It’s time to put it all together and so here we are!

So what is Knights, exactly?

Well, if you can contain all that excitement for just one more second, then I’ll tell you! Knights is a PC game about superheroes (hopefully you’ve worked that much out by now) centring around a young hero, MidKnight, discovering his true potential and the journey that will (with your help) take him there. In this world academies exist to train heroes to be the best they can, and as our story begins our hero is just setting out to undertake his final exams. But as his exams come to a close, tragedy strikes the school and he must set out on an adventure to unite a group of heroes, former students of the academy, in order to fight an enemy whose power the world has never seen before.

There will of course be parodies of the heroes we all know and love along with some more original heroes thrown in too. (Check the ‘You’re a Hero’ perk for more details about how you can slide your way in here.) Most importantly, this game will have a sense of fun. No eighties-comic style dark brooding here!

Hey, look it's the main hero, MidKnight!

Why am I here on Indiegogo?

Well, I’ve spent most of my time so far working on the story for this game and now I really want to get going on the main part of the game itself. I want to be able to dedicate as much time as I can to making this game, and I want it to come out at a reasonable point in the future. I’ll be making all the graphics, writing story, writing and recording music, and everything else that goes into making a computer game these days. All this obviously takes time, and ideally I’d also like to eat food and have some kind of shelter while I’m doing this and so here I am! This is to raise in order to let me complete the game, but should the project reach past its intended goal, I will ideally be able to bring in some other people to work on some aspects of the game such as music and graphics in order to get even more quickly towards reaching a finished project.

What do you get for sharing your hard-earned coin with me?

Well, that’s up to you really! Check out all the perks on the right to find which one suits you the most and then have at it, sir! (or madam!) Just click on the contribute button (also on the right. Look there, it’s bright, pink, and oh so tempting!) to start the path to helping make this game become a reality.

Even if you can’t contribute at the moment, don’t just surf away, (do people still say “surf the web”?) tell someone about it! We all know someone who loves superheroes, or games, or both. Let them know about this little project and I will be eternally grateful.

And if you do contribute, do the same! By contributing to this project you obviously want a better product and as the saying goes, the more the merrier! Tell someone else about it!

Until next time,

Excelsior!

James
story_txt:
Update:
The Fundraiser has finished!
And while I didn’t quite reach my target, it was great to see the support I received for this project, and it has really motivated me to give everything I can to this project. I’d like to say a very heartfelt thanks to everyone who has supported me so far.
But though the fundraising has ended, that doesn’t mean I’ll be going radio silent!
You can head over to the official blog for the game at:
http://knightsRPG.blogspot.com
This will be where all the latest information about the game will be found, including an opportunity for anyone who wanted to donate, but ran out of time, to still contribute to the game, and for the time being to still have access to the same perks. These will of course be closed off as development progresses on the game.
Thanks to everyone that has helped the project so far, and I look forward to sharing the finished game with you all!
James.
 

Demo Time!
Yes, I have finished a demo of the game! Just download the file here:
http://bit.ly/knightsDemo
Then install & start playing the demo!
Let me know what you think of it! Either here or via twitter at twitter.com/jfdoyle or on facebook.com/knightsRPG
And when you’re finished all that, come back here and donate!

story:
About the game

Feed the Twins is a challenging and entertaining casual mobile game where the Twins, a smart hedgehog and his funny brother, need your help to collect candies in their basket in order to keep them happy and satiated.

You can help them with candy combos or drawing candy lines on the screen with your fingers to "guide" the falling candies into their basket.

The first version will support both iOS and Android but in future the game could support other platforms as well.

 

 

The adventures of the Twins will be placed in different Worlds and Themes, with specific enemies, features and objectives to accomplish.

If you are able to complete a level and collect coins during a game session, you will be rewarded with special points to be used in the game Store to unlock new Worlds and Themes.

 

Game features

 

Worlds

The adventures of the hedgehogs will be set in different worlds. The first version of the game will feature Earth and Space worlds, with Ocean already in the pipeline for the first update.

 

Themes

Each world will be divided into different themes: so far we planned 3 themes for the Earth world, country, picnic, snow, and two in Space, Moon and Mars. 

 

Levels

For each theme, you will have to unlock a specific number of levels: help the Twins in their path to get all the candies!

 

Combos

You can match two candies of the same type to get more points. Be careful: in each set there is the preferred candy of Twins but also the most hated!

 

Enemies

Of course, life will not be so simple for the hedgehogs because in every world there will be an enemy ready to steal the falling candies.

So far, we have designed the enemy for the Earth world... a smart magpie!

 

Superpowers

You will have the possibility to use special features during a game session in order to get more points or more candies or simply to have more chances to complete a level.

Sugar Shot - you are running out of sugar? Twins look tired and sweaty? Get an instant boost of +25% of sugar!

 

Super Force - the Twins can stop the cart for 10 seconds, so it will be easier for you to feed them!

Candy Magnets - The Twins can attract all the falling candies into their basket for 10 seconds using their Candy Magnet.

 

Coins

Get the coins with the candies and you will have more points to be spent in the Game Store.

 

 

About the project

We currently have a demo for both iOS and Android for the first world and it is a good benchmark to understand what we still need to do to complete the game.

The first round of graphic has been completed, and three themes for the first world are ready! However, we need to complete another world, create character animations and all the set of candies you will play with.

Polishing is never enough nowadays, so extra work is required to fully complete the game and to make it ready for the market (and do not forget test activities of course).

We also need to produce new sound effects and background music for each world: we think what we have now is of great quality, so it's necessary to maintain this standard.

Anything beyond the technical aspects of the game will boost our marketing campaign to help us reach the widest audience possible.

 

Where the money will be used

We would like to be very open about where the money will be invested, taking into account to reach our goal of $15000. In case we will be so lucky thank to you to reach even a better result, we will be more than happy to update this section.

Development - $5500

This the core essence of the game and it will be done using a cross-platform engine.

Graphics and Animations - $3500

We really think the look & feel of the UI is really great, so we need to keep this high standard. Each world will have a specific style and various different themes. Also, we have to work on hedgehogs and their enemies animations.

Musics and Sounds - $1500

We already have produced the main theme and the background music for the Earth world. We need to complete the set of sound effects and produce a music for all the other worlds of the game.

Testing - $1000

As you may know, tests are never enough, specially for cross-platform games, considering also all the different devices supported by Android.

PR & Marketing activities - $3500

We need to produce banners, press releases, submit game for reviews, ... all the basic supporting activities required today for mobile games.

 

Who we are

We're two professional application and game developers for mobile devices in the gambling and casino industry.

We have so much passion for casual and social gaming that we spend most of our spare time working on side projects: Feed the Twins is our last creation and it will keep us busy for next weeks!

Before this project, we released another game, a simple but addictive puzzle game called Logix, available for iOS and Android. A video review can be found here.

 

We are always more than happy to get feedback from people, so if you would like you can reach us whenever you want.

Daniele - email or LinkedIn

Sergio - email or LinkedIn

 

Perks

Any help is really appreciated, from the smallest to the top. We will never be tired to thank all our contributors.

Please also be aware that some of the perks are available for Android users only or for iPhone/iOS ones: please read carefully the description of the items in the list.

Here below, we would like to insert some details about some of the perks.

iPhone 5/4S/4 skin made from a durable vinyl - details, the skin will feature the game logo and the hedgehogs.

Special artwork - we will commission it to a great game artist who already collaborated with us in the last period. It will be never used for any marketing or PR purpose but it will be unique.

11 inch IconSign of the game icon - details

 

Do not hesitate to contact us if you need any clarification or more details.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Any kind of support is welcome, also if not in form of funds, so please consider doing one of the following:

Share this campaign on Facebook, or tweet about it using the IndieGoGo share tools.

Like us on Facebook.

Follow @feedthetwins and @fasteque on Twitter.

Download and review the game, once it's released.


Thank you!

story:
Welcome!

Releasing a true indie game is hard, expensive, and risky. However, our game will be finished soon, regardless of the success of this campaign. But we still need to raise money to support a proper release of the game. 

Even if you can't help with funding, you can try the FREE demo right now and give us feedback!




The Game

Santa Claus is real! Become the elf who seeks revenge against Santa for enslaving his people. Shoot past the brainwashed elves, snowmen, and Yeti for your chance to emancipate yourself and your people from the symbol of consumerism, and free humanity from their materialistic shackles.... or just kill Santa for not bringing you what you wanted this Christmas.

  • First person shooter for the casual to mid-core gamer
  • Hilarious Action!
  • Outrageous Deaths and head-shots!
  • Fight Christmas characters in war and gore: Elves, Snowmen, Toys, Nutcracker, Santa Claus, and more!
  • Four Crazy guns with Power Ups! Laser Blaster! Ornament Gun! Grenade Gun! Torch Gun!
  • Shoot through levels of wintery fun: Arctic Mountain, Toy Factory, Christmas town, and Santa's Palace.
  • Create your own levels with the free 'Scene Designer' by Give Up Games.


Level 1: Across the Mountain

Gameplay Screenshots

   

  


Level 2: Toy Factory

Preliminary Designs

                        


Level 3: Christmas Town

Preliminary Design


Level 4: Santa's Lair




Funding Goals

We are raising money to support the launch of this game. We've already poured all of our own money into making the actual game. The goals that we hope to achieve through this campaign total of $11,124  are based on the following breakdowns. 

1. Marketing: $6100

  • YouTube Advertising Campaign Budget: $1200
  • Google AdWords Advertising Campaign Budget: $1200
  • Facebook Advertising  Campaign Budget: $1200
  • Release Marketing Consultant / PR Budget: $2500

2. Porting to mobile formats: $4500

  • Unity 3D Pro: $1500
  • Unity 3D iOS Pro: $1500
  • Unity 3D Android Pro: $1500

3. Marketplace Memberships: $524

  • iOS Marketplace License: $99
  • Android Marketplace License: $25
  • Steam Greenlight Submission Fee: $100
  • Budget for other marketplace membership fees: $300

Stretch Goals

After we reach our funding goals of this campaign, our aim is to upgrade our art  development tools and put more time into upgrades and DLC's for this game.




About Us

The lead programmer for 'The Elf Who Killed Christmas' is Mike Tsouris. He programmed the 3d game engine and level designer tools from the ground up. He works as a freelance software developer. 

George Tsouris is the 3d modeler and animator. He also designed most of the textures. He works as a professor of philosophy and Japanese literature. 

Illustrator Krystal Downs created many of the characters, illustrations, and designs. She works as a freelance artist. 




Other games we've been involved with...

Alpha Chimp

Give Up Games released Alpha Chimp on XBOX Live Indie Games in 2010

Play the free demo on XBOX Live

More Info

Homeless Guy

This is a Give Up Games project. We're still working on this one. Much larger scope and more people involved.

More Info

Happy

This game was designed and produced by SOLLOMAN. Mike Tsouris was the lead programmer.

Play the free demo on XBOX Live

More Info

story:
What’s it all about

Running a campaign as Game Master can be very time consuming, more so than we (GMs/DMS) often care to admit. For the campaign to be run successfully, the Narrator will have to create an engaging world with interesting non-player characters that speaks to the player’s imagination. Such a world takes a lot of time to create and it often happens that the players take decisions that have them bypass a lot of carefully planned out content. After having spent all the time making it, this can be quite frustrating for the narrator.

In such a situation Game Masters will often try to improvise new content just to make sure the campaign keeps going, to do this properly however requires a great amount of creativity and experience. This improvised new story often isn’t up to par with the rest of the campaign and can sometimes even mean the end of one. After a while every player will get bored of the haughty elf mage, the orphan boy that becomes king or evil dystopian megacorporation stereotypes.

A couple years ago a bunch of experienced narrators sat down together at a roleplaying convention in the uk and openly discussed situations that had caused issues in their own games. That discussion was the beginning of this book Project.

Everything contained within this publication has been written to be as system neutral as possible, to ensure it can be used easily in your adventures, wherever they may take you.


In this book you will find full descriptions of interesting, ready to use characters. All of them are unique with their own quirks and traits. They can be used as quest-giving non-player characters, villains to be hunted down or even as a starting point for players that get stuck while making their own character.

This book also contains a fully working fantasy town setting, ready to use in any fantasy campaign that needs it. We have included a map of the town and it offers multiple non-player characters, quest hooks and adventure ideas for you to use

The Publication will be approximately 100 pages with full colour front and back cover, probably 8.5" x 11" (US Letter) like most RPG books around.

Artwork

We are very lucky to have three great illustrators working with us on his project they are

Jonny Gray ( http://jonnygray.mcalister.org.uk/ )

Mark Ford (http://www.imagekind.com/MemberProfile.aspx?MID=d4b82bfd-39be-497a-9d88-1dd53b442878)

Ryan Gutierrez (http://www.freelanced.com/ryangutierrez)

Please click the links above to see samples of their work.


Where are we now?
Up to this point, the project has been entirely self-funded, but unfortunately, we have run out of money. So what we are hoping for is to raise $2700 to be able to finish the book.

We will be using the funds to get some artwork for the cover and additional pieces inside the publication. In addition to this the extra funds will allow to us to get the first full print run complete including all the other costs that go into producing a publication like this.


What's in it for you?
Every donation will earn you a mention in the book as a funding contributor, but there is more.

 

  • A $8 donation will get you a PDF version of the finished book, delivered to your inbox before the official launch in Jan 2013.

 

  • A $20 donation will get you a Hardcopy version of the finished book, delivered to your home address before the official launch in Jan 2013

 

  • A $25 donation will get you a Hardcopy version of the finished book, Plus a full PDF delivered to you before the official launch in 2013

 

  • If you donate $100 to this project then you "the donator" get to have your own character published in this book – either something you personally have designed or written or something that is born out of a collaboration with one of the book authors. As a bonus one of our artists will create an illustration based upon your character for inclusion in the final book.


So in short: what we are looking for is to produce a fun and helpful book for all role playing gamers, we just need a little help from you to be able to finish it completely. If you help us, you will get our eternal gratitude as well as the rewards mentioned above.

Finally 50% of the net profit generated from the sale of this publication is going to be donated to the following UK based charities: - Marfan Association UK, The National Autistic Society and the RSPCA.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute, you can help by spreading the word around to others and trying to get them to contribute.

Don't forget to use the share tools available to you here!
story_txt:
What’s it all about
Running a campaign as Game Master can be very time consuming, more so than we (GMs/DMS) often care to admit. For the campaign to be run successfully, the Narrator will have to create an engaging world with interesting non-player characters that speaks to the player’s imagination. Such a world takes a lot of time to create and it often happens that the players take decisions that have them bypass a lot of carefully planned out content. After having spent all the time making it, this can be quite frustrating for the narrator.
In such a situation Game Masters will often try to improvise new content just to make sure the campaign keeps going, to do this properly however requires a great amount of creativity and experience. This improvised new story often isn’t up to par with the rest of the campaign and can sometimes even mean the end of one. After a while every player will get bored of the haughty elf mage, the orphan boy that becomes king or evil dystopian megacorporation stereotypes. 
A couple years ago a bunch of experienced narrators sat down together at a roleplaying convention in the uk and openly discussed situations that had caused issues in their own games. That discussion was the beginning of this book Project.
Everything contained within this publication has been written to be as system neutral as possible, to ensure it can be used easily in your adventures, wherever they may take you.
In this book you will find full descriptions of interesting, ready to use characters. All of them are unique with their own quirks and traits. They can be used as quest-giving non-player characters, villains to be hunted down or even as a starting point for players that get stuck while making their own character.
This book also contains a fully working fantasy town setting, ready to use in any fantasy campaign that needs it. We have included a map of the town and it offers multiple non-player characters, quest hooks and adventure ideas for you to use
The Publication will be approximately 100 pages with full colour front and back cover, probably 8.5" x 11" (US Letter) like most RPG books around.
Artwork
We are very lucky to have three great illustrators working with us on his project they are
Jonny Gray ( http://jonnygray.mcalister.org.uk/ )
Mark Ford (http://www.imagekind.com/MemberProfile.aspx?MID=d4b82bfd-39be-497a-9d88-1dd53b442878)
Ryan Gutierrez (http://www.freelanced.com/ryangutierrez)
Please click the links above to see samples of their work.
Where are we now? Up to this point, the project has been entirely self-funded, but unfortunately, we have run out of money. So what we are hoping for is to raise $2700 to be able to finish the book.
We will be using the funds to get some artwork for the cover and additional pieces inside the publication. In addition to this the extra funds will allow to us to get the first full print run complete including all the other costs that go into producing a publication like this.
What's in it for you? Every donation will earn you a mention in the book as a funding contributor, but there is more.
 


A $8 donation will get you a PDF version of the finished book, delivered to your inbox before the official launch in Jan 2013.

 

A $20 donation will get you a Hardcopy version of the finished book, delivered to your home address before the official launch in Jan 2013
 


A $25 donation will get you a Hardcopy version of the finished book, Plus a full PDF delivered to you before the official launch in 2013

 


If you donate $100 to this project then you "the donator" get to have your own character published in this book – either something you personally have designed or written or something that is born out of a collaboration with one of the book authors. As a bonus one of our artists will create an illustration based upon your character for inclusion in the final book.

 So in short: what we are looking for is to produce a fun and helpful book for all role playing gamers, we just need a little help from you to be able to finish it completely. If you help us, you will get our eternal gratitude as well as the rewards mentioned above.
Finally 50% of the net profit generated from the sale of this publication is going to be donated to the following UK based charities: - Marfan Association UK, The National Autistic Society and the RSPCA.
Other Ways You Can Help
Even if you can't contribute, you can help by spreading the word around to others and trying to get them to contribute.
Don't forget to use the share tools available to you here!

story:
About A Life Worth Following and the OKC Ambassadors

The OKC Ambassadors is a summer baseball team characterized by: college ability high school junior and senior players who want to learn how to share their faith, give back to the game by conducting free baseball clinics for kids, grow spiritually by studying the Bible, become accountable to other Christian believers, and experience the joy of service by going on an international baseball mission trip.  The Ambassadors are 100% about baseball, and 100% about ministry. The Ambassadors will travel all summer playing baseball, conducting free baseball clinics, and working with churches all around Oklahoma, Nebraska, Texas, Kansas, and Nicaragua.


A Life Worth Following (ALWF) is an organization formed in memory of an extraordinary young Christian baseball player named Justin Sullivan who died tragically in a car accident. Justin had an incredibly close walk with God and his story has inspired thousands for follow Christ. A Life Worth Following exists to reach the unreached in the baseball community with the life-giving message of Jesus Christ, and to build and equip baseball players through discipleship. Showing God's love, we strive to reach a hungry world with Jesus through obedience to the Great Commission.


We are a responsible and respected 501(c)(3) organization with a history of impacting the communities we travel to. Check us out at: www.alifeworthfollowing.org.

We are also completely committed to transparency for our donors. Please feel free to check out our GiveSmartOKC profile at:

Donations are tax deductible!

The Need

Our budget is around $160,000 a year and we are trying to raise at least $10,000 through crowd funding.  To date we have raised about $40,000 for the year.

Six years ago individuals involved with ALWF identified a need for outreach in the baseball community.  The culture of baseball that exists today is to be on elite travel teams that play year round and to put baseball above all else.  The result of this culture is that many players and their families have replaced God with baseball.  They will spend every Sunday on a baseball diamond instead of being in church.  In some cases this starts as young as 5 or 6 years old and persists throughout high school.  We noticed that baseball could be used as an effective “hook” that could help young men to value the gifts that God has given them, and could be used to lead them to a faith in Christ, and inspire them to live out their faith.

ALWF also could not identify any organizations that were currently reaching out to the baseball community.  We reached out to Lee Tunnell, who is a former Major League pitcher, and current Bullpen Coach for the Milwaukee Brewers and whose son had played on travel teams growing up and in high school.  We decided the best way to tackle this issue was to form our own travel baseball team whose purpose was to train and equip baseball players for outreach in the baseball community.

With the increase in importance that baseball players are placing on playing on these elite travel teams, we see the need for outreach growing.  Players feel that they cannot attain a college baseball scholarship unless they are willing to sacrifice the majority of their time to play year round and be seen by as many college and professional scouts as possible.  Currently we are only able to reach out to areas of Oklahoma, Kansas, Nebraska, and Texas.  This means that the majority of the baseball community across the United States is going unreached.

The Solution

The goals of this project are to sustain and expand our reach among those in the baseball community sharing the message of Christ, building and equipping baseball players through discipleship, and living out the Great Commission.

We are targeting two separate audiences.  The first is the building up and equipping of the Ambassador baseball players. Currently we have 18-26 baseball players per summer.  Our prayer is that all of our players will be equipped to live a missional life for Christ based on their experience with the Ambassadors.  The majority of our players will go on to play college baseball (some professionally) where we hope that they can be ambassadors for Christ on their college or professional teams.  Some of our players will go on to do other things, but regardless will be equipped to be an ambassador for Christ in whatever they do.  Our second target audience is the lost of the baseball community. Conservatively between our clinics, games, baseball mission trip, and journals we reach at least 5,000 people over the course of a summer.  Those we encounter will directly benefit from the programs that ALWF offers, first and foremost because they will hear the good news of Christ on a baseball field.  Whether they are a child who attends one of our clinics, or a baseball player on another team who has just played the Ambassadors, or a parent in the stands, all will hear the gospel of Christ.  In six years that our organization has done this, we have only had two teams decline to listen to our message.  That’s two out of over 300 teams that we have played. It is incredible how playing baseball has opened a door to share the gospel.  You would be hard pressed to find those kind of results on the international mission field, or at a local church from the most well trained preachers.  For whatever reason, the baseball community is ready, eager, and yearning for the gospel.

PLEASE CONSIDER SUPPORTING THIS IMPORTANT PROJECT

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot donate right now, please help by posting links to this campaign and  A Life Worth Following in as many places as possible!  This would be a great help to our organization.

http://igg.me/at/OKCAmbassadors/x/6138721

www.alifeworthfollowing.org

https://www.facebook.com/groups/33821736376/

https://twitter.com/ALWFAmbassadors

story:
Short Summary

Chatlo2 has been trying to get a system for sometime now. Lag issues make it difficult (however not also impossible) for him to show up everyone else. We are looking for funds to help push him in the right direction to get a new gaming rig.

What We Need & What You Get

We need to money to put towards a new Asus Gaming system.

The Impact

Helping a student with school work. Also will help him with a thriving gaming career.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share this with friends and family to help him meet his goals.

story:
What We Need & What You Get

  • We will be using the funds to pay designers and composers to make an awesome soundtrack!
  • Backing this project could get you your own level designed in your vision!!
  • If we don't meet our goal, the raised funds will still go to what we can get to make the game the very best!

The Impact

Any kind of support would help a ton. No matter what kind of support we get, it always makes a lasting impact for the better

Risks & Challenges

Composing is a hard job, and is something that I do not have the ability to do. With the raised funds, we plan to get level designers, and composers to come together and make this an awesome game!

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute? That's perfectly fine! It would help if you could get the word out though. Help us be known to the world so we can make Blanco a new face in gaming.

story:
ReignMaker (formerly known as: Tower of Elements 2) is brought to you by Frogdice: an indie game studio based in Lexington, Kentucky. Founded in 1996, Frogdice makes online RPGs and downloadable games that take place in the high fantasy world of Primordiax.

This is our second crowdfunded game. 

Our first delivered on time and players loved it!


ReignMaker (formerly known as: Tower of Elements 2) is a real time strategy and puzzle game with deep city building and match-3/tower defense combat. From your capital city you lead your Kingdom against the invading Void Army that threatens all life.

Your strategy, tower defense, and match-3 skills will determine the fate of your armies, but the many political decisions you make as a leader affect the story and the culture of your kingdom.

As your capital city improves, you will have access to more powerful spells, mightier elite troops, and better battlefield gear and armaments.

Along the way you will also earn achievements, complete quests, and fill your Bestiary with enemies.


The capital city of your Kingdom is vitally important. This is where resources are gathered, spells are researched, troops are recruited, battlefield gear is constructed, and much more.

You will build your capital city on one of three continents: Mitralon, Ta'Raekhet, or Katayvan. Each continent has its own strengths and advantages.

There are 8 major building types that you will construct and upgrade. You will also want to grow your population, recruit and train workers, manage resources, and make Kingdom policy decisions that affect both the story and the culture of your Kingdom. All of these decisions will have profound effects on the battlefield.


Combat is handled through a combination of match 3 and tower defense.

Each tower has a grid of elemental runes. When you match at least 3 of these runes in a horizontal or vertical line, they detonate and send elemental bolts onto the battlefield. Any enemy struck by an elemental bolt will take damage.

The battlefield itself is managed in a tower defense manner. Troops, barriers, walls, explosives, and all manner of other options are at your disposal.

During battle, random quests will occasionally be given to you. You can complete these quests for bonus rewards 

You will face 10 bosses with unique and challenging mechanics. Combine your skill at match-3 and tower defense to succeed against the Void Army.


There are 10 regions on the world map with 50 towers at strategic battle locations. Each region has a different type of terrain, and each tower has a different configuration. The rune boards vary significantly in shape, number, and presence of special rune types (locked, frozen, blocked, corrupted, etc.). There is an enormous amount of variety in the match-3 part of the game.


Throughout the game you will make tough decisions as leader. Events will occur where you have to choose the policy your kingdom will follow. These decisions are critical to the story and will also determine the culture of your kingdom. 


There are four culture traits: Martial,Druidic, Republic, and Elemental. Your decisions will determine the degree to which your Kingdom's culture exhibits some or all of those traits. The result will have both cosmetic and real gameplay effects.


There are 10 bosses throughout the game that present distinct challenges and gameplay mechanics. These tend to be some of the most intense and challenging battles in the game. A few of these bosses (or their relatives) are making a return from Tower of Elements 1 or Dungeon of Elements. They have likely picked up some new tricks so be prepared!


Defeated enemies will occasionally drop scrolls. When you collect a scroll you can then summon and experiment upon that enemy type in your bestiary. This is great fun. Enjoy yourself guilt free!


We have created a set of rewards that hopefully you will find exciting. We put a lot of focus on giving you ways to immortalize yourself in the game and be a permanent part of the game you have so wonderfully supported.

NOTE: All rewards where the backer designs or names something are subject to approval. Obviously we need to make sure it is appropriate for the game and our customers. Your designs appear in everyone's copy of the game so keep that in mind!

A few of the rewards warrant additional explanation.

NAME A VILLAGER: $50 and up. As your kingdom grows, villagers start walking around the city. When you mouse over them you can see their name. At the $50 tier and above you can name a villager that will appear in everyone's copy of the game.


NAME A TOWER: $100, $200, and $300 tiers. There are only 50 towers so we had to limit this to those tiers. You can choose the name of a tower in the game. We will try to accommodate everyone's choice of continent but it will be first come first serve based on when people email us after the campaign ends.


NAME AN ACHIEVEMENT: This is unique to the $200 tier. If you back at a higher tier and really, really want to name an achievement, we can probably work something out. Message us to be sure. We love putting tons of fun achievements in the game. We try to be funny or at least moderately clever in how we name our achievements. At this tier you can name one of them for us! We will note your contribution in the credits.


DESIGN/WRITE A KINGDOM POLICY EVENT: $300 and up. This is really cool. We will give you some examples of existing policy events so you understand how they work. Basically you write a situation that a fantasy medieval leader might face. You then get to create four possible policy decisions and assign them cultural value effects (Martial, Republic, Druidic, and Elemental). This is a very cool way to have a lasting impact on the game's story. We will note your contribution in the credits.


NAME A BAD GUY: $500 and up. Take one of our enemy types and change its name. Would you like to change the "Gobbo Warrior" to something you like better? Use your imagination to name something cool. We will note your contribution in the credits.


BE WRITTEN INTO THE LORE: $1,000 and up. Do you have a favorite RPG character you'd like to have immortalized into the Primordiax game world lore? You can do that here! We will work with you to write you or your character into the lore of this game and the lore of the Primordiax world that spans all of our games. This will be specifically noted in the credits.


NAME THE PENULTIMATE BOSS: $2,500. Our 2nd to last boss was designed specifically so it can be named after someone's favorite RPG character or personality. How cool is it that you can BE A BOSS in a video game? Very cool, methinks. This will be specifically noted in the credits.



DID WE FORGET SOMETHING? Was there something you would like to have seen as a reward that we didn't include? Do you have a question about our rewards? Go ahead and back at any reward tier and then post your suggestion in the comment thread. We aren't kidding when we say player feedback is hugely valuable to us.



ReignMaker had a successful Kickstarter campaign that raised $17,327. It was Frogdice's second successful campaign. Our first, for Dungeon of Elements, delivered on time and our backers loved the game.

During both Kickstarter campaigns we received numerous emails from members of the Indiegogo community asking us if we'd consider doing a campaign here. We decided to give that a shot and keep the stretch goals running so we can make Tower of Elements 2 even better for all of our backers in both communities.


  • Michael Hartman - President, CEO, and founder of Frogdice 
  • Pang Hartman - VP & Creative Director, and Lead Designer 
  • Adam Sullivan - Lead Artist 
  • Sean Lucas - Lead Developer 
  • Collin Brooks - Programmer 
  • Melinda Picard - Artist 
  • Anthony Davis - Artist 
  • Montica Sansook - Artist 
  • Daniel Hanks - Artist
  • Deborah MacArthur - Writer 
  • Teppenheimer Wigglebottoms, Office Mascot, Corgi Derpmaster


Every backer who receives a copy of ReignMaker will receive a FREE STEAM KEY when the game is Greenlit. You can help make that happen by clicking the graphic below and UPVOTING us on Steam Greenlight.

Even if you choose not to back our project, we would hugely appreciate your upvote on Steam. Please help spread the word!




Thank you for reading about our campaign and hopefully you will choose to back us. We quite literally could not do this without you. Thanks to you we are able to share our passion for making video games with the world, and we are able to have a job we love and find incredibly fulfilling. It is our hope that the joy we bring you with our games is a fair trade!

Please visit our community forums here:

http://forums.frogdice.com

You can also find us on Twitter and Facebook.
