This is a very cool way to have a lasting impact on the game's story. We will note your contribution in the credits.NAME A BAD GUY: $500 and up. Take one of our enemy types and change its name. Would you like to change the "Gobbo Warrior" to something you like better? Use your imagination to name something cool. We will note your contribution in the credits.BE WRITTEN INTO THE LORE: $1,000 and up. Do you have a favorite RPG character you'd like to have immortalized into the Primordiax game world lore? You can do that here! We will work with you to write you or your character into the lore of this game and the lore of the Primordiax world that spans all of our games. This will be specifically noted in the credits.NAME THE PENULTIMATE BOSS: $2,500. Our 2nd to last boss was designed specifically so it can be named after someone's favorite RPG character or personality. How cool is it that you can BE A BOSS in a video game? Very cool, methinks. This will be specifically noted in the credits.DID WE FORGET SOMETHING? Was there something you would like to have seen as a reward that we didn't include? Do you have a question about our rewards? Go ahead and back at any reward tier and then post your suggestion in the comment thread. We aren't kidding when we say player feedback is hugely valuable to us.ReignMaker had a successful Kickstarter campaign that raised $17,327. It was Frogdice's second successful campaign. Our first, for Dungeon of Elements, delivered on time and our backers loved the game.During both Kickstarter campaigns we received numerous emails from members of the Indiegogo community asking us if we'd consider doing a campaign here. We decided to give that a shot and keep the stretch goals running so we can make Tower of Elements 2 even better for all of our backers in both communities.
Michael Hartman - President, CEO, and founder of Frogdice 
Pang Hartman - VP & Creative Director, and Lead Designer 
Adam Sullivan - Lead Artist 
Sean Lucas - Lead Developer 
Collin Brooks - Programmer 
Melinda Picard - Artist 
Anthony Davis - Artist 
Montica Sansook - Artist 
Daniel Hanks - Artist
Deborah MacArthur - Writer 
Teppenheimer Wigglebottoms, Office Mascot, Corgi Derpmaster
Every backer who receives a copy of ReignMaker will receive a FREE STEAM KEY when the game is Greenlit. You can help make that happen by clicking the graphic below and UPVOTING us on Steam Greenlight.Even if you choose not to back our project, we would hugely appreciate your upvote on Steam. Please help spread the word!Thank you for reading about our campaign and hopefully you will choose to back us. We quite literally could not do this without you. Thanks to you we are able to share our passion for making video games with the world, and we are able to have a job we love and find incredibly fulfilling. It is our hope that the joy we bring you with our games is a fair trade!Please visit our community forums here:http://forums.frogdice.comYou can also find us on Twitter and Facebook.

story:
Gameplay


You will be the pilot of the MQ-71 UAV plane, a fictional futuristic Unmanned Air Vehicle.

Your role is to defend democracy and freedom, killing your enemies in a world-war scenario.

This plane is equipped with the most advanced lethal weapons, to ensure the total destruction of the enemy, and the full enjoyment of the player.

  • Machinegun
  • AGM144
  • 105mm


Weapons will be unlocked during the game, and they can be powered up using collected coins.


The game is composed of about 30/40 levels, the player will be immersed in lot of different environments, from the desert to the jungle, from the mountains to the sea.

Some missions will be played in full color mode, while others will use the infrared camera, depending on visibility conditions.

 

Developement needs

You coul be wondering why do we need so much money to develop a game like this.


There are lot of elements that makes it so expensive, take a look:

  • The game is entirely developed using 3D graphics
  • We want a state-of-the-art game, so we will be using the latest technologies available on the market to provide the best gaming experience possible
  • The game will be cross-platform.


Ok that seem so simple but take in mind that:

  • An advanced game engine license costs about 1500 USD per device, plus another 1500 USD for the game engine itself
  • The team will be composed of experienced 3D artists, programmers, UI and UX experts, project managers and other professional figures. They will not work for free... unfortunately!
  • Our targets are mobile platforms so the game must be optimized to run smoothly on low end devices
  • We need the logo and promotional images
  • Publishing the game on several platforms is a complicated task, and without going in too deep it is a very costly operation
  • We obviously need to let people know this game exists, and this is called marketing. Just think that a TV commercial can cost thousands dollars per second! You will not see SkyWars ad on your television but it's just an example to let you better understand how expensive this can be

 


Multiplatform

Yes! This will be a multiplatform game!

At the moment we are targeting the most used mobile platform:

  • iOS
  • Android
  • Blackberry
  • Windows Mobile

 

 

Funding goals

Reaching the founding goal is very importat to us to deliver a quality game.

If we will not reach the goal the game will be downsized, proportionally to the found we raised. It will also be relased just for Android and iOS with less missions and details.

In the case the founding will exceed our goal, we should be able to distribute the game in a PC version for Windows, Linux and Mac, and also as a Facebook application, in an higher quality than the mobile one.

 


That's all folks! Back us and enjoy the game!

story:
Take all the emotions you can squezze out of the motorcycle, put them in a Trackmania inspired epic track locations, add some fluency and gameplay dynamics of Wipeout, set it all in a  the world of future inspired by cyperpunk and make it a professional sport with violent rules that can only be matched by the ones of Rollerball.

Welcome to the world of the Rascal Rider game and graphic novel.


As a professional rider you will take part in a motorcycle racing series specially designed to entertain millions with its unforgiving and violent rules. Being on track you and all of your opponents will be allowed to use different kind of weaponry to claim your place at the finish line. From melee attacks to shooting rival riders in the back - everything is allowed. The high-tech protective suit and medical bots standing by the track will keep you in one piece during the race, as long as you can stand the pain of getting trashed over and over...


The basic gameplay mechanics will invole high speed motorcycle arcade racing combined with both ranged and melee combat. You primary weapon will be a front mounted, ranged weapon used to hunt your opponents and shoot them in the back during the race. This will mean that your riding skills will not only be used to go around the track as fast as possible, but also to both avoid and perform successful attacks. 

The second weapon type allowed during the Rascal Rider races are melee weapons. They will require even better riding skills and timing to perform a successful attack, which will make them even more spectacular and rewarding. 

The game will feature both single player and a cross-platform multiplayer modes. In both modes you will have a choice of allowing the use of the weapons with or without restrictions to create your preffered mix of racing and combat. You will be able to set up races based on the number of laps or on a specified amount of time, and all of this combined together will allow for a great variety of racing. With the handling model balancing between spectacularity and physics Rascal Rider gameplay provides fun and rewarding racing experience.


The initial release of the game will provide:

  • 20 different motorcycles in many racing liveries
  • both male and female characters
  • large number of helmets and racing suits for customization
  • a set of melee weapons ranging from morning star to front wheel lock
  • a varied set of motorcycle front mounted weapons with different visual and audio effects
  • 2 track configurations in the giant indoor arena
  • 3 track configurations in high altitude mountain area
  • 3 track configurations in the post industrial area



What we want to achieve with Rascal Rider is a fully cross-platform multiplayer experience. All the way up from 3D capable Android devices all of the Rascal Rider versions will be compatible in terms of gameplay. It is not easy, but we did our homework and we are very happy with the results so far.

Rascal Rider is an arcade racing game. Fast, simple and fun. And it's as good as simple it sounds. The simplicty of the basic gameplay mechanics allows us to fine tune the controls for many devices without loosing on gameplay quality. There is a reason why there aren't many cross-platform games on the market, but what we want to prove with Rascal Rider is that by choosing the right genre and the right mechanics, cross-platform multiplayer is a great opportunity. Just think of multiplayer PC gaming, the variety of input devices it mixes together, the variety of screen sizes and graphical capabilities of the used hardware. And now think of the cross-platform multiplayer again, and it doesn't sound so strange any more...

It does require extra effort to do it right. If you don't plan and design for a cross-platform gameplay from the very beginning, you may not be able to do it at all in the end. But we were aware of that, and we did plan and design Rascal Rider just for that. We have made that extra effort to make Rascal Rider a proper cross-platform game, because:

  • we want to give everyone a chance to try and fall in love with Rascal rider no matter what their favourite platform is
  • we want the players to be able to play their game on any platform they have the access to at the given moment
  • we belive that building a large player base is just as much important as building a good game
  • we like challanges :)


The game will be set in the world of the Rascal Rider graphic novel, which will be released in episodes, revealing piece by piece, a story of a lone man struggling to fit in the disturbing world of the future. The first episode, released as a poster and a motion comics trailer, reveals the events leading to the point where the main character "restarts" his racing carrer thus creating the game setting.


The reality the Rascal Rider takes place in is a strange place. We have set our racing series in a world that is undergoing a change. A change that is going to take it from what we could name a successfull futuristic society, with it's great achievements in medicine and technology, towards a dark cyberpunk era. An era of people overusing the powers they they have learned, but they do not know how they should use them. People who don't need to worry about things like safety, health or energy so they stopped thinking about it where does it all come from and why...

We are going to release the rest of the story in chapters available for download. As the chapters will not be released in the chronological order they will constantly switch focus between telling the story of the main character and explaining the world around him. Just as the story will be just a background for the races, the racing itself will not play the major part in the comics story. From peoples personal dilemmas to social problems of the futuristic society, that's what you can expect to be covered by the graphic novel.




We have spent the past year working on the Rascal Rider to make it ready to show you the idea behind the game. Rascal Rider is currently in the Pre-Alpha stage, which means that we have already tested most of the ideas and features for the game. We have the basics of the physics model, foundations of the combat mechanics and we have already tested the cross-platform multiplayer features.

Everything we did for the past year, from the first concept arts to AI prototyping, was done to make sure that Rascal Rider can look and play exactly like we want it to. There is still a lot of work ahead of us, but at this stage we are ready to share all of the ideas with you and to make some serious commitments.



What we are also ready for is to get you invloved in the development process. We have a strong vision of the Rascal Rider game, but that does not mean that we are the only guys in the world with good ideas.

Games are made for players, and their voice should be heard as soon as the development process allows it. And in our case, this moment is now.

Everyone who decides to pre-order the full game during this campaing will get access to the closed developmnet forums where we will all share the ideas and argue over them :)

Sharing ideas is one thing, but we also need your help in the testing process. We want to test Rascal Rider on as many devices as posssible, which is really important to us regarding the cross-platform multiplayer features. And running this tests will be a privilege of you, our supporting community.

But that is not all that we got prepared for you...

For those of you who are willing to show some more faith in us we have prepared some exclusive Rascal Rider collectibles. From hand signed postcards to huge limited edition posters, you can equip yourself with some unique stuff, that will not be available for purchase otherwise. Alongside these rare items you can also get the original soundtrack from the game, teased here with the Rascal Rider Main Theme:



Please have a good look at the perks on the right. There is a pretty good chance that you will find something just perfect for yourself. From securing your place in the game credits to becoming the legend. The choice is yours.


We are going to release the Rascal Rider in a sales model that is going to be something we could call "an indie free-to-play model". We are gamers as well, and we do also play some free-to-play games. As the multiplayer part of Rascal Rider is very important to us, we belive that the free-to-play model will work well for the game nad it's players. Sure there's a lot of things you can do wrong with a free-to-play game, but titles like League of Legends or Team Fortress 2 have shown that if done right, free-to-play is nothing to be afraid of.

To make things as clear as possible we are going to break it into 4 basic points:

  1. you can basically play Rascal Rider for free, all the tracks and options will be always available for you to explore,
  2. the items that will be available for purchase with real life money, including the exclusive ones, will never give you an advantage,
  3. if you like the game you can always get the full content for the reasonable flat price, that will be $20 for all of the initial content, which basically equals buying the full game, 
  4. any purchase you make will be valid for every platform you will log in from.

Some of you may ask about the DRM-free model. As the cross-platform multiplayer will be a very important part of the Rascal Rider experience it's hard for us to release it as DRM-free. We need to provide you with the account service to let you log in into the game, and we want to give you access to the same account from many platforms. But opposite to many free-to-play titles we are not going to restrict sharing or selling your account. The licence you get with your purchases will entitle you to fully manage this license just like you could do it with a physical disc.



cameleon-labs is an independent game developer, based in Poznan, Poland. We are a small studio that is free to follow its own ideas, and untied with any publisher we are ready to hear from the community in order to make our games richer and more fun to play. Rascal Rider is out first serious game project as a team in the current shape. 

Working on different stuff ranging from web aplications and database solutions for corporate clients to graphic tools and big scale game modding is how our team members got their experience (Object Painter video1, video2; S.T.A.L.K.E.R. Lost Alpha). And now we are going to put all of it together, combined with our creativty and passion, into making some kick-ass games for you, starting with the Rascal Rider.

Just like we said before, we belive that crowdfunding was invented for people who are ready to follow their passions and are working to put their ideas into live. If we were working for the big studios we wouldn't really need to be here. But we are a new indie studio, formed by people crazy enough to belive that you may actually like what we are doing, and you may want to get involved as well.

You can easily find us and the Rascal Rider project on the internet by simply following one of the links below:

cameleon-labs website - http://cameleon-labs.com

our Facebook Fan Page - https://www.facebook.com/cameleonlabs

Rascal Rider game website - http://rascalrider.com/

cameleon-labs Twitter profile - https://twitter.com/CameleonLabs

our YouTube channel - http://www.youtube.com/user/CameleonLabs

Rascal Rider profile on IndieDB - http://www.indiedb.com/games/rascal-rider


The guys directly responsible for the Rascal Rider pre-alpha and this campaing are:

Adam Dera - game designer and project leader, and a 3D artist, and...

Dawid Niemiec - programmer, from AI to making sure that all of the pieces in the game world are in the right places, with all the right properties and scripts attached

Jakub Jatczak - programmer, the one you will love or hate, depending on the way your bike will handle that last turn

Pawel Pohland - programmer, one of the "S.T.A.L.K.E.R. The Lost Alpha" team members, the one making sure that Rascal Rider will work as a piece of software in the end

Piotr Majkutewicz - 2D&3D artist, the man mainly responsible for the art style of the Rascal Rider

and

SoberDrunk - the musician, the composer and the sound engineer, our all-in-one audio solution.

There are also some other young and talented people that have been doing some artwork or coding during the pre-production stage, sharing their ideas and testing different solutions. And we would really like to work with some of them again.


So far we have been working on the Rascal Rider as a passion project. As fun at it can be, it becomes a bit hard to run such a serious game project without being able to focus on it completly. The funds we are rising right here will allow us to cover the expenses like:

  • Unity Pro game engine licenses for the team
  • a reasonable salary for the core team members 
  • office bills
  • assets costs, like audio recording sessions and high quality texturing assets
  • a little bit of extra hardware that will make our work even more effective

What we are not going to spend money on are software licenses, as we are deep into using open source software, like Blender and GIMP, during the Rascal Rider development. 

Once we get a little bit closer to our initial goal, we will share our strech goals with you. These will require some further investments or simply more development time, but first we need to get this campaign up running...

our YouTube channel - http://www.youtube.com/user/CameleonLabs
Rascal Rider profile on IndieDB - http://www.indiedb.com/games/rascal-rider 
The guys directly responsible for the Rascal Rider pre-alpha and this campaing are:Adam Dera - game designer and project leader, and a 3D artist, and...Dawid Niemiec - programmer, from AI to making sure that all of the pieces in the game world are in the right places, with all the right properties and scripts attachedJakub Jatczak - programmer, the one you will love or hate, depending on the way your bike will handle that last turnPawel Pohland - programmer, one of the "S.T.A.L.K.E.R. The Lost Alpha" team members, the one making sure that Rascal Rider will work as a piece of software in the endPiotr Majkutewicz - 2D&3D artist, the man mainly responsible for the art style of the Rascal RiderandSoberDrunk - the musician, the composer and the sound engineer, our all-in-one audio solution.
There are also some other young and talented people that have been doing some artwork or coding during the pre-production stage, sharing their ideas and testing different solutions. And we would really like to work with some of them again.

So far we have been working on the Rascal Rider as a passion project. As fun at it can be, it becomes a bit hard to run such a serious game project without being able to focus on it completly. The funds we are rising right here will allow us to cover the expenses like:

Unity Pro game engine licenses for the team


a reasonable salary for the core team members 


office bills


assets costs, like audio recording sessions and high quality texturing assets

a little bit of extra hardware that will make our work even more effective
What we are not going to spend money on are software licenses, as we are deep into using open source software, like Blender and GIMP, during the Rascal Rider development. Once we get a little bit closer to our initial goal, we will share our strech goals with you. These will require some further investments or simply more development time, but first we need to get this campaign up running...

story:
from Micah..

Dear Friends and Family, I have an exciting opportunity to serve the Lord on a Mission trip from October 8th to October 19th in Vietnam. I will be traveling with a group of eight others under the headship of Australia Christian Churches (ACC) International, where we will be working with the missionaries stationed there. Some of the projects that we hope to be working on are upgrading the kitchen, planting a garden, helping the school teach the kids English, and the ‘Shine’ program which helps girls with self esteem.

For more information on the organization please check out there website: www.acc.org.au.

Vietnam is located in Asia, south of China and east of Thailand. Currently there are 54 ethnic groups that populate Vietnam. Over 70% of the population are Buddhist or strongly influenced by its practices. Vietnam has a population of 85.5 million people.

Why do I want to go to Vietnam? What better way to show God’s love than to volunteer to work in His name. I believe this will be a great life changing experience for me.  I want to help these people some how, and the only way I know is to show them the love of Christ Jesus by working along side them.  

Would you please consider two things? First, and most important, will you pray for me and the team? Pray for safety, protection, for good health, for Gods will to be fulfilled and for funding for this trip. Second, will you consider a donation to assist with the expense of my trip? The total cost is approximately $2,500. This covers the cost of airfare, shots, meals, land transportation, and a place to sleep for two weeks. If you choose to help financially.

Thank you so very much for your prayers and/or donations. I an excited about this opportunity to show God’s love in a practical way to the people of Vietnam.

Sincerely, Micah Debolt

story:
Top Story

Miley Clarke, high school junior and student journalist, has been put on assignment to profile seven of the most popular senior girls in school. Known collectively as the Seven Senior Suitors, they form a very elite group of girls. Each of them have been deemed worthy by their classmates of potentially dating Sara Sites, the universally loved student council president of Springsake High.

But just who are these girls, really? What makes them so worthy? Why would Sara choose any of them? Miley needs to get to the bottom of these questions but dealing with a seven girl harem is one tall order. Between conducting interviews, maintaining relationships, keeping her grades steady and maintaining her wits, Miley is going to need your help. Will she be able to get all her stories written by the deadline? Can she keep the attention of seven unique personalities at the same time? Where will there be room in any of this for Miley's own story of girl-to-girl loving? The answers and more in Seriously Senpai I GOTTA get that Seven Senior Suitors Story! STAT!!

Story Continued . . .

Seriously Senpai is a series of story and event driven games that draws influences from Visual Novels and Dating Sims, along with story inspirations from the Yuri, All-Girl, Harem and High School Romance genres of Anime and Manga. It also pulls from personal experiences and perspectives of being part of the fandom of these genres and mediums to create games with unique style and purpose.

This game will be the first of two planned games and introduce you to the main stars and romantic interest of the series, the Seven Senior Suitors. Through conducting interviews and building relationships, as Miley, you will have a chance to get to know each girl before you fall in love with them in the concluding second part. However, this isn't just a prelude and Miley is not just a messenger. This game is also her own side of the story, from start to finish and will tell her tale of journalistic accomplishment or descent into the world of seedy gossip trading. You can help her write that story by playing and supporting our campaign for Seriously Senpai I GOTTA get that Seven Senior Suitors Story! STAT!!

Coming to PC for Windows and Linux.

Personals

We are a small team, coming from both sides of the hemisphere, that formed together for Yuri Game Jam 2016. The goal was to create a small-scale promotional game, serving as a prelude to a main Seriously Senpai game. In just two months time, fully expressive sprites for many characters, several story event scenes and multiple location backgrounds were voluntarily created.

It was decided that the quality and quantity of these assets were too much for their original purpose and the game was delayed, missing the jam deadline. Over the course of three years, in free time, the original idea of that game has been expanded on to take better advantage of the assets. Now our team is ready to create a fully realized game, featuring more assets, a bigger story and deeper game mechanics. With the success of this campaign, we will have the funding necessary to achieve our goals.

Economics

Our team has three individual visual artists working on sprites, CGs and location backgrounds. There are nine primary characters in our game, with at least two sprite poses and over a dozen expressions, each. Eight of these characters will have their own unique story event scenes, in addition to scenes focused exclusively on the main character. The game mostly takes place within school interiors, which will include backgrounds for the halls, cafeteria, library and class. There will be brand new work created from scratch as well as touch up and recreation of the original 2016 jam assets*, in order to maintain a high level of consistency.

Most of the funding raised from this campaign will be used for those creations. The remaining funding will be used to help cover remaining programming, writing, licensing and other odds and ends that the game needs, much of which has already been accounted for prior to the campaign launch.

*Voluntary work from the original Yuri Game Jam 2016 has retroactively been paid for and is not part of the budget from our funding goal.

Reward Offered

By helping us reach our funding goal, we will be able to offer you a game that is complete as an experience and a product. We have many perks that will include a digital copy of the game, DRM free, with a license key redeemable at Itch.io. We have a limited offer Senpai Saver perk if you want to get your copy at a discount. Because we hope not just to sell a certain amount of copies, we also want more people to play our game, we are also offering perks such as Sharing Senpai. With these perks, you can get a copy of the game for yourself and extra copies to share with your favorite senpais, all at a reduced price!

In order to ensure that the funding and our efforts are focused on the game's development and to take the current pandemic in account, we will not be offering physical reward perks. This includes both physical copies of the game and extra merchandise. We also want everyone to have a full experience with what they receive and for none of our supporters to feel left out. That means there are no special editions with different content and that any digital extras that become feasible, such as work-in-progress art, written commentary or post-launch content, will be included as part of one base digital package. These condensed options will also help keep our needed budget down.

But if you are feeling on the especially generous side, we are also offering perks that will get you some extra gratitude. The Senior Senpai perk, for example, will get your name up and big in the in-game credits, as supporting producer. If you really want to go out, the Stylish Senpai perk will get you a drawing of you or an original character in one of our two Springsake High uniforms, done in the style of our in game sprites!* We'll even include it in the in-game gallery (optional). Have a harem of your own to satisfy? Consider impressing them all with the Spendy Senpai perk.

*Some restrictions apply but our skirt uniform fits girls and boys! See the Stylish Senpai Perk Details in our FAQ section for more details.

Column: Our Risks & Challenges

It is true that this will be our team's first game and that our first attempt at it was a failure to launch. That version of the game was being created on a voluntary basis and under a time limit that was very short and even then, half of what we were originally expecting. We overworked and the ideas were too ambitious for what we could do back then.

That failure was a learning experience prepared us for what to expect. Our programmer has put a lot of work into readying a custom engine for the game. All of our artists have honed their craft over the years and will be working under more manageable conditions. We are giving ourselves much more time to finish the game than we had originally given ourselves to start and complete it.

Being that we are a team spread across substantially different time zones, it can sometimes be difficult to coordinate contact and discussion between all of us. Still, this is something that we have managed to do plenty of times before and most of the remaining work will not require constant communication between all of us at once.

There are, of course, many unexpected things that can happen in middle of a pandemic. For our part, we have not been hindered in our ability to work on the game. The project started with everyone working from home and there is no reason we would have needed to change that in any circumstance. No matter any coming hardships, we are all eager to deliver a game that you will enjoy and we will be proud to have worked on.

Because we would rather not compromise on our vision, please note that this is a Fixed Funding Campaign, meaning it will be all-or-nothing. If we do not meet our monetary goal, we will not collect any money and your pledge will be refunded by Indiegogo.

Help Wanted

Thank you for your interest and reading up to this point. If you are still wanting to help us but can not do so financially, please consider helping by letting others know about this campaign and by being part of our online community.

You can follow this campaign here on, Indiegogo, for updates and there are easy to use share tools at the top of the page for Twitter and Facebook. Our short url is also easy to remember: igg.me/at/seriouslysenpai

You can also follow us on Twitter.

Our project page is currently up on Itch.io.

Finally, you can also join our Discord Server.

Seriously, Senpai, from our team to you, thank you. ♥

story:
About PawnGame

PawnGame is a multiplayer flash FPS game, that so many of us have grown up to. The game offers several maps to choose from, where players compete to rank the highest. The game isn't just about who's better with the mouse and keyboard, but about teamwork and strategy. 

What We Need & What You Get

In order to bring PawnGame back we need enough money to support it's 1 year cloud charge. Once the goal is raised we will bring PawnGame to work on our cloud gaming community portal - SandBoxd.com. SandBoxd will continue to be developed and enhanced with great features in order to supply our players with a fun and enjoyable environment. 

*Future updates for PawnGame will be held by an external volunteering development team that will be opened for application.

story:
Money for the pool players.

We want to raise money for the first game of a pool reality show season.  The players will play for this pot of money which will be an addition to the money that they have put up themselves.

We need you to donate to help us make this a fantastic undertaking.

When you donate, here is what happens:

  • We are looking for $25,000 in donations.  We will take 20% off the top of whatever we get and use it for enhancing the  production for the show.
  • 80% of the  money we get will be added to the pot in the first tournament match.
  • We will be offering perks simply to send the first game to you.  Each perk has a video stream but some perks add more money as a donation to add to the pot to be played for in the first match. We will be happy if you just get the video stream.
  • If we don't meet the goal, we will split the money into those same percentages and do what we can with it.

Pool player's profit sharing system.

This is a system of selling video streams where most of the profit will go to the players and not to the producers and production company.

  • Your participation in this will raise the amount of money the players can win in the first match.  It will make the match more exciting and more interesting to the potential buyer of the video stream.
  • If you have donated as a Promoter, you will be helping to spread the word about pool and make money for yourself as well as adding to the money going to the players.  You will receive detailed instructions on how to use your playlist.
  • We intend to spread this idea to include many teams.
  • Change the momentum towards the players instead of away from them.
  • For many years, pool players who have been trying to make a living doing what they love have been finding themselves in a situation that makes it harder and harder to make money at it.  Tournament owners take video of them playing and put it on the internet for free to advance their products but rarely give the players any compensation.  We are trying to reverse that trend by making interesting videos that can be under the control of the players who will have a chance to promote themselves.
  • One reason that there is never a sustained run of pool shows is because to produce something that is interesting to watch, usually more money is needed than the show can produce in viewers.  There are reasons why we think we can turn that around and make the show more less top heavy so that it can be self sustained.  But it will take your help as well as us doing our best.
  • We have figured out how to produce these shows at a minimal cost and speed so the money isn't taken up with the production.Our small crew is able to handle a production that would take much more money and participants by doing multiple tasks.

Other ways you can help.

If you can't contribute, you can pass this on to someone who may be interested in helping or participating.

  • If you are in the area where the match is held, please come out and show your support by watching the match.  You are very welcome.  It will be free.
  • Please spread the word by using the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
View the Development Blog!

Our Story

Mylor is a new RPG game being developed by a group of 3 people, they include:
  • Flabaliki - Project leader and developer (http://youtube.com/Flabaliki)
  • Edfake - Original music composer and developer (http://youtube.com/Edfake)
  • TheGeeNee - Graphic designer, 3D modeller / animator (http://youtube.com/Geenee9)


This project is actually a school project I'm creating for my final year of school. I have the next 6 months to finish off what I can for submission and marking. I've asked Edfake and TheGeeNee to aid in the project in a non-coding way to improve the look and playability of the game.


This doesn't mean the game will be finished in 6 months time, I plan to develop this afterwards as well to make it a much more enjoyable and very cheap to play game for those who can not afford more expensive titles such as the Elder Scrolls series.

The Impact

As previously mentioned, the whole goal is basically to create an action RPG game that is cheap, fun and exciting to play.

As time moves in, we'll keep adding features in so the game doesn't get old.

If we can't get your help, this project will not live up to our expectations and will most likely fall flat on it's face.


What We Need

Long story short, we would like to purchase Unity Pro, a $1500 investment. Read on if you want more info.

Mylor is being developed within the Unity game engine, where the money will be going is to purchase a professional edition of the software. This will give us way more control over the game, and allow use to increase the realism and immersion to much greater heights. You can find out more info on Unity here, including pricing and what is in the pro version: http://unity3d.com

Essentially what we will get from the professional version of the software that will really benefit this project is as follows:
  • Realistic audio filters
  • Video playback in game (including cut scenes)
  • Custom splash screen
  • The ability to use light mapping for more realistic surfaces. 
  • Real-time water reflections and refractions (currently the water is basically a solid blue colour).
  • Post processing effects including motion blur, colour correction, etc
  • Occlusion culling, this will increase performance on less powerful machines and make the game more user friendly.
  • Real-time dynamic shadows cast from all objects within the game world. (Currently there are no shadows, or the shadows are in a permanent state)

 What You Get

So what do you get out of contributing?
Those who donate over $10 will receive the game free for life at no extra charge. *This doesn't include special DLC that MAY or may NOT be created (haven't considered this far into the future just yet)

Check out the rest of the perks on the right, the include credits in the game, custom dialogue you can submit for the game. Custom quest lines and more!


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't or simply don't want to donate, please share this project with others via Facebook, Twitter, Google+, YouTube, anywhere else you can think, all of this is extremely helpful to us!

As previously mentioned, the whole goal is basically to create an action RPG game that is cheap, fun and exciting to play.

As time moves in, we'll keep adding features in so the game doesn't get old.

If we can't get your help, this project will not live up to our expectations and will most likely fall flat on it's face.


What We Need
Long story short, we would like to purchase Unity Pro, a $1500 investment. Read on if you want more info.

Mylor is being developed within the Unity game engine, where the money will be going is to purchase a professional edition of the software. This will give us way more control over the game, and allow use to increase the realism and immersion to much greater heights. You can find out more info on Unity here, including pricing and what is in the pro version: http://unity3d.com


Essentially what we will get from the professional version of the software that will really benefit this project is as follows:


Realistic audio filters
Video playback in game (including cut scenes)
Custom splash screen
The ability to use light mapping for more realistic surfaces. 
Real-time water reflections and refractions (currently the water is basically a solid blue colour).
Post processing effects including motion blur, colour correction, etc
Occlusion culling, this will increase performance on less powerful machines and make the game more user friendly.
Real-time dynamic shadows cast from all objects within the game world. (Currently there are no shadows, or the shadows are in a permanent state)



 What You Get
So what do you get out of contributing?
Those who donate over $10 will receive the game free for life at no extra charge. *This doesn't include special DLC that MAY or may NOT be created (haven't considered this far into the future just yet)


Check out the rest of the perks on the right, the include credits in the game, custom dialogue you can submit for the game. Custom quest lines and more!


Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't or simply don't want to donate, please share this project with others via Facebook, Twitter, Google+, YouTube, anywhere else you can think, all of this is extremely helpful to us!

story:
Introduction

Sensei Says is the Radeth Productions' Baby. From a fresh start, I really do not have a game or name for the company other than, "He always releases game demos." That has all changed with the birth of Sensei, the new avatar for Radeth Productions. Sensei is the Sonic of Radeth Productions. He is cute, funny, easy to look at, player customizable, and the root to a new game franchise!

This first game, in which we I am trying to get funds for, is the starting game to the Sensei franchise (with Ninjascale as the second game in the franchise).

Game-play

You play a ninja who is trying to learn the ways of Sensei. You start out by learning a few moves, then slowly progress until you learn all of the moves in the game (15). As you reach new levels, you apply the skills you learn and try to avoid obstacles in your way. Also, as you make it through the 50 levels, the game slowly progresses and becomes more difficult. In the first levels (easy), you have Sensei talking at a slow pace where you can keep up and understand what he is saying. When you reach the mid levels (medium), Sensei starts to speed up between telling you what to do, and he starts to talk fast and becomes harder to understand. In the more advanced levels (hard and extreme), Sensei starts to realize his life is cutting short and becomes senile. He starts mumbling words, saying random things, and sometimes forgets that he is teaching you how to be a better ninja.

Controls

The controls are fairly easy, but they are still subject to change depending on feedback from consumers. The actions in the game are used by pressing the buttons: Directional arrows, 1-9, Q, W, space, and enter.

Where does it go?

Your money goes straight into the development for the iPhone and MacOSX, marketing, labor for the making of the new game engine, and the art. Right now we only need a minimum amount of money since the majority of the game is already complete. Any extra dollar could help us get the game into production and released to the public (and you if you get a free copy)!

Future Predictions

Although the game will be complete by its first release, there will be major updates to the game to keep content fresh and exciting! In upcoming updates, there will be:

  • Sensei Customization
  • New Achievements
  • New Levels
  • 3 new game modes: Survival, Arcade, CustaLevel (Customize your own level to share and play)
  • Possible Multi-player
  • Possible global leader boards
  • More by request...

Pledge Reward Preview

Sensei Shirt

You can stay updated about the project by visiting my website!

http://www.radethproductions.com

story:
What is Vitare?

"Vitare" means "Way of Life" and is a virtual world in development. Unlike other online games, Vitare is going to be a game with no goals, allowing the players to do anything - the only limit being their imagination. Players can create their own avatar with powerful customisation features, chat and interact with others in real time, and explore a user created world: players can build the world - they could build their dream home, a business empire or anything else they can think of.

Vitare will be free to play, with limitations. We shall offer a subscription service once released, allowing more features in-game - this shall be our main method of funding once the game is released.

Vitare is a unique game in the gaming market - and no game has currently filled this spot.

Why We Require Funding

We require funding to purchase required software such as Unity Pro in the future, and to allow us to easily startup the game when the time comes, software and servers can be costy, hence why funding would greatly benefit the project. Donations shall also be used for other various things including other software and for the website.

What You Get For Donating

As a special thanks for donating, depending on how much you donate you shall get a perk. Be sure to check the perks to see what you get when you donate a certain amount.

Thank You

To anyone that donates, we greatly appreciate helping our indie development team get this game out into the gaming market. Vitare has already received high interest from users of all ages and genders from all over the world. It is an exciting opportunity for us all.

story:
"If you’re a fan of the original Fallout games, then I only need to tell you that this game was made specifically for you."

Shawn Schuster
game journalist


Download CRIMEA v.0.8 Demo
(added 14.10.14)



CRIMEA is a single player adventure that takes place on boundless steppes, radioactive swamps, distinctive settlements and grim mountain forests of the same-named island.

Inspired by Fallout1 and Fallout2, CRIMEA also borrows some features from Diablo and Commandos. Though we focus on the combat system you will also enjoy wandering around, exploring new locations, trading and performing quests in this particular post-apocalyptic world.

We believe you will live out your own story in this severe world, full of exciting encounters, hot battles, secret places and interesting quests.


3D engine. Imagine Fallout2 gameplay with an option to zoom in/out and rotate the camera, adjust resolution and quality, using hills and roofs in combat. Realistic day/night cycles, water reflections, particles, fog and rain – all these features are supported by the modern 3D engine.

Turn-based combat with some improvements. Now you don't need to wait for every combat member to take its turn. Instead of successive moves all members (except the player) take their turns simultaneously.

Traps and mines. Use them to undermine enemy forces. From hornet's nests and bear traps to plastic explosives – all's fair in love and war.

RagDoll physics. Killed enemies fall more realistic. Those who like walking on the roofs, sometimes perform complex acrobatic somersaults before they die.


Lock picking, Stealing, Gambling. In the development we set realistic goals, and some of these features can be implemented in the expanded version only. Though we've made tech demos for you to check them out online on the game's website. These features are not just skills depending on your stats. To pick a lock you'll have to choose the right shape of each section of a Decoder pick, with a limited amount of attempts. For successful stealing you should take into account sights of view those people who could see your action.

Improved AI. So called 'realistic perception' was borrowed from Commandos series. You can sneak behind enemies and use terrain objects to lurk. Don't get into the field of view of your opponents and don't use firearms until you are noticed or they will raise alarm and call for their companions. Note that some armor like helmets, gas masks, sunglasses affect perception.

NPC-satellites. People and other animals will join you, if you are able to interest them with something. 'Something' can vary from common ideas to few screw-nuts (main currency on the island).

Open World. Wander through vast Crimean wastelands and feel the spirit of freedom and post-apocalyptic reality. Travel using global map and explore random locations with diverse enemies that will not let you get bored.

"Considering this is a demo and the game has so much more to offer (according to the game’s feature listing), I was thoroughly impressed with what I played so far."

Shawn Schuster
game journalist


Download CRIMEA v.0.8 Demo
(added 14.10.14)


CRIMEA. 12 years after the collapse of the Second Soviet empire.

Troublous times of KGB Inquisition and bloody communists sank into oblivion. But the deep scar they left in people's mind continued to bleed. A new evil, even more cruel and insidious, made a nest somewhere deep in Crimean mountains.
Scorched by the sun and hopelessly irradiated, the island is soaked in toxic waste and blood. Those who remain are fighting to survive the endless struggle. They have nothing except numerous questions.
What is the source of the radiation?
Where do these scores of mutants come from?
Who cut the deep channel separating them from the mainland?
It was one of those grim days of desperation when the next gang of robbers appeared on dark horizons of the Salt Desert. And your tribe decided to fight.


As you can see from the demo and the videos, significant part of the work has been done. Battle mechanics, inventory system, weapons, AI, user interface, models and animations, etc. - this is a result of our 2-years work. The most exciting – new locations, settlements, quests, monsters – is coming. This is also is the most time-consumptive part of the development.

To complete the game according to our plan (by the end of 2015) we would need funding for cost of living and software licenses. To make the game really fascinating we are also looking to expand our team with new professionals and buy new content (3D models, monsters, inventory items) for our expanding game world.

Every amount we receive from you will help us release the game faster and will make it better. Ideally, we'd like to implement all the features listed in the Stretch Goals section.





Goal #1 (default version) - $ 37 500

A player will follow a predefined sequence of locations, with the ability to enter so called 'random areas' from the global map. The gameplay will be focused on fighting. You will also be able to gain experience, improve your basic skills, buy equipment and take quests that will follow you through the main storyline.

Goal #2 - $55 000

The game world will be more diverse, and you will feel greater freedom to choose your own way in CRIMEA. Wandering on the global map from one settlement to another, you will take the quest line you prefer. You will begin the game by creating your character with custom attributes using SHAPE system (Strength, Health, Agility, Perception, Expertise). Additional skills and perks will diversify your gameplay.

Goal #3 - $75 000

Comprehensive and versatile game world will be full of challenges. Islanders will react on your previous actions, and Karma will affect your life in CRIMEA. Some settlements will refuse to let you inside while others will treat you as a hero knowing that you helped their friends earlier. Any role you choose – a lonely hunter, a butcher or a member of thieves clan – will give you a chance to reach a final goal. Meet a stranger somewhere deep in the desert, trade, or play dice with him... you can even kill him if something goes wrong – that is what we call 'post-apocalyptic reality'. Caravans, head-hunting, gambling in bars are waiting for you!



Download CRIMEA v.0.8 Demo
(added 14.10.14)

story:
Kobolds are a dying race.  However, this was not always so.  A thousand years past, the Kobolds were a flourishing civilization, on the brink of conquering the realm... but even the wealth of a hundred nations could not prevent them from being consumed by darkness.  Rumors say thousands of lost souls sank with the once prosperous city into a pit of obscurity, never to be seen again.

Being of Kobold descent does not lend itself to an easy life.  Preferring to call herself a "treasure hunter" rather than a thief, Astrea has only ever known struggle since the day she was born.

Never knowing when her next meal would come, the promise of wealth brings forth comforts yet undiscovered.  This is what draws her towards the cursed lands—hearsay of vast riches that lay in the ruins of the Kobold kingdom of Aarnevalkea.  If she can obtain the treasure, she will never have to go hungry again.

Astrea

Astrea has a bright personality, and is typically very easygoing in stark contrast to the grim life she has been handed; she is the sole survivor of her family, all of whom had been slaughtered in a massacre when she was but a child.  Consequently, throughout her life she has had no one whom she could definitively call "friend".   Despite her origins, she is swift and nimble.  Her petite frame allows her to hide easily; however, she is not sturdy, meaning that any hit will render her unconscious.  She may be slightly naïve, but her acute wit allows her to escape some of the most difficult situations.  Problem-solving is second nature to her, and puzzles provide a special reprieve from the harsh reality of existence.

Before falling into the necropolis, Astrea had hoped to return to the safe lands to bask in her predetermined wealth and eat heartily.  However, the fall has all but extinguished thoughts of luxury and contentment.  No one would miss her or even know that she was missing—no one would come for her.  Armed with only the light, Aeohfin, and the will to survive, Astrea makes her way through the vast catacombs laden with enveloping darkness and unknown terrors which await unaware souls that just so happen to be unfortunate enough to cross them.

Aeohfin

The wisp, Aeohfin, is the only source of light existing in the ruins.  He speaks in an old language that Astrea can only understand in fragments, and seems to be slightly temperamental.  Trapped in the lantern, he agrees to lead Astrea out if she carries him with her, but he tells her little of the past.  Instead, his story is found written in the ruins of Aarnevalkea—a past so dark and convoluted that even he cannot remember it all.  In order to aid her escape, Aeohfin can use his power to momentarily paralyze the darkness, but requires the consumption of food to obtain energy. 

We are Rainbow Panda Studios—an indie game studio producing our first game—a 2D sidescroller Adventure/Horror game that is projected to be released on Steam for PC and XBox in June 2017.  

The initial inspiration for our game was simple: to create a terrifying, yet fun game that uses the light source as a weapon.  We debated on mechanics and the underlying story for weeks, resulting in the birth of "Aeohfin".  Our game uses unique gray scale illustrations, replicative of film noir, to evoke an eerie feeling, disturb your senses, and create an ominous, foreboding atmosphere.

Contributing to our campaign will not only help us jump-start our careers, primarily, you will be an important part of our production team by helping us to push this game to commercial success. 

Meet the talented, steadfast people who are working tenaciously on this game:

Jon Piper - Producer

Chris Humphries - Art Director

Eric Ritchason - Level Design

Xavier Cuevas - Programming

Austin Stevens - Environmental Design

Jason Lam - Art, Animation

David Landrum - Sound

Michael Cruzan - Rigger, Level Design

Roger Minnema - Public Relations, Social Media

Kara Greenfield - Public Relations, UI Design

There are a plethora of customized items you can collect from the perks listed including, apparel, artwork from the creators, and more!  Check out the donation perks to see the types of items you can receive just for backing us!

We are seeking $15,000 for our campaign to be mostly spent on marketing our game; bringing awareness to our product is the key to success, and by marketing our game heavily, we will be able to reach as many people as possible.  We have provided a breakdown of our budget below:

As a contributor, you can keep tabs on your donations by following our progress on social media.  By following us, you will be able to see this game grow from its grassroots and be the first to know when we have made major breakthroughs such as a playable demo, and changes to any gameplay.  Although our team was formed only 3 months ago, we are all passionate and working tirelessly to get this game launched by the Summer of 2017. 

Aeohfin is more than just a game for us; it is a reflection of our personal thoughts and struggles, and an intimate experience of the depths of human behavior.   

Join us in bringing light to the world.

Even if you can't make a donation today, you can help back us by telling your friends about us, sharing our Indiegogo page to your social media, and by following us on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram!  Thank you so much for your support!

Kara Greenfield - Public Relations, UI Design



There are a plethora of customized items you can collect from the perks listed including, apparel, artwork from the creators, and more!  Check out the donation perks to see the types of items you can receive just for backing us!

We are seeking $15,000 for our campaign to be mostly spent on marketing our game; bringing awareness to our product is the key to success, and by marketing our game heavily, we will be able to reach as many people as possible.  We have provided a breakdown of our budget below:




As a contributor, you can keep tabs on your donations by following our progress on social media.  By following us, you will be able to see this game grow from its grassroots and be the first to know when we have made major breakthroughs such as a playable demo, and changes to any gameplay.  Although our team was formed only 3 months ago, we are all passionate and working tirelessly to get this game launched by the Summer of 2017. 

Aeohfin is more than just a game for us; it is a reflection of our personal thoughts and struggles, and an intimate experience of the depths of human behavior.   



Join us in bringing light to the world.



Even if you can't make a donation today, you can help back us by telling your friends about us, sharing our Indiegogo page to your social media, and by following us on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram!  Thank you so much for your support!

story:
UPDATE: 

If we meet our goal, the graphics of the games will get a major UPGRADE! 

So spread the word and help us reach our goal!


            Twisted Path, Expressivity and Chess

Three games that will bring you a new way of playing board games with all your friends or family.
These games will test your strategy, logical, pattern recognition, team work and some time dancing skills (hint: The dancing mime).

All you need to play is:


Is is as simple as that. We give you the Board games pack, you just print, cut and you are ready to go. 

Just a couple of minutes and you are ready to play with your friends or family.


                           The Board Games


Twisted Path 


                         
Become an Explorer and try to find the treasure in the woods. But be careful, cause the path to the treasure is really twisted and full of surprises.
 Find other explorers and team up to reach the treasure.

                                     

OR become a Forest Gnome and keep those explorers out of your forest.

If you can't do it by your own, find other forest gnomes that can help you.

The forest and it's treasures are yours, or not?

                                     


Gameplay:

Each player picks a explorer/forest gnome card, without showing the other players what they got. After which players start picking action card which gives them the next possibilities : Twist a path card in one direction or switch a path card with another path card or block a player which you think is not on your team or unblock a player that is on your team.

Scope of the game is to unlock the door (if you are a explorer) or keep the explorers away from the door until the action cards are all gone (if you are a forest gnome).

                                         This is your path, let the game begin. 
                       



     

Expressivity


                           


Split into two team and race to the finish.

                              


The journey is paved with "Ups and downs", but working as a team you will win.


You will test your acting, drawing, story telling skills and sometimes your dancing skills (hint:The Dancing Mime)

Gameplay : 

Expressivity is a game in which both teams try to get to the finish.
They get their points by picking a word card and a action card. The player who's turn it is has to make his team mates guess the word on the card through the action selected with the action card (charade, draw and so on).
If they do not guess the word, the other team wins and advances.
You have special squares on the board which can give you advantages or disadvantages.
Scope of the game is to make your team mates guess as many words as possible so you can get to the finish.

Chess

                                                                "The Game of Kings"

                                    


Get a friend, set up the game and test your strategy skills. One vs one, see who's better.
If you have more friends over, who want to play, don't let them wait until you finish the game.
Print and make as many games as you need. You don't have to be restrained to one board.
Make a championship between your friends, play all at the same time and see who's the King of Chess.


             
                              


                                           Rewards


                                       

 
You will get a pdf file containing all three games for only 1 dollar.
Please add your Email address instead of your Shipping address, so we can send you the games at the end of the campaign 

Risks & Challenges

Considering that the games won't need any physical production, the shipping will be done as soon as the campaign ends, via e-mail.

The only challenge will be to avoid send you the games in your email spam.

But everyone will get the games in short time after the campaign ends.


Other Ways You Can Help

Please help us by spreading the word and our link on all your social media.

Thank you for your contribution.

story:
SHOOT…BOUNCE…CATCH

A UNIQUE 2D GAMING EXPERIENCE

Who are we ?

We are a team of 4 who would like to bring a unique gaming experience to players of   Shoot Bounce and Catch game. Our dream is to create a game that will be enjoyed by thousands of people. A game that will be engaging and entertaining for all ages, for both young and young at heart. 

The STORY behind the game  ?

In the not so distant future, the universe revealed that human beings are not alone and species other than man exist in different galaxies and planets. Among these species, there is  an evil alien named Zowarg leader of an army of alien villains. Zowarg and his armies started to invade planets creating massive destruction  and enslaving its inhabitants.  In response to the violence and destruction expanding from planet to planet , leaders of the galaxies assembled volunteers to be protectors of their planets and created teams to search and stop Zowarg. Planet inhabitants survival now lie on the hands of good alien soldiers dedicated to this cause.  One ordinary good soldier named Furru,  who volunteered to this task has been battling very hard the army of Zowarg. Unfortunately, he realised that Zowarg armies has  already enslaved some of his closest friends. In the midst of the dilemma, Furru’s mission is now torn between finding and stopping Zowarg and his armies or saving his friends.  Join Furru’s exciting journey to search and fight Zowarg and his armies or save his friends.

What’s new ?

Our artists have designed very unique looks of aliens.  The story is original and conceptualized by our game developer and artists to be very engaging for the player. There will be surprises along the way as powerful weapons will be discovered by the players to battle the aliens as you move to the different levels. 

What do we need ?

Our project will need some help on funding so that we can spend for software licenses, game peripherals and allowances for our workforce (audio/video director, game artists, game developer and programmer). We have developed around 30% of the game and now working on the design of Zowarg, additional aliens and the alien planet backgrounds. We expect to complete the game by May 2015. We will be releasing the game in executable format version that can be played on a PC or laptop.


NOVEMBER 26 UPDATE:

In our introductory video, we showed the design of 7 alien invaders.  We have completed the design of the 8th Alien Invader. Please see the GALLERY for the images.

As you know, we still do not have names for the aliens.  We are now open for suggestions to name the aliens. We will use your suggestions in case the major sponsor 2 contributors are not filled up.  Just place your suggestions in the comments section and will consider it when the campaign closes.


DECEMBER 3 UPDATE :

The design of the 9th Alien has been completed. Please check out the UPDATE tab.  Thanks.


DECEMBER 11 UPDATE :

The design of our 10th Alien  has been completed. Check our UPDATE tab for the images. By the way, we are still waiting for name suggestions for our Aliens to be included in the game.
