story:
Here are some great ways to use Lumo Play:

  • In the livingroom, for active indoor play.
  • In a child's bedroom - they can make their own games and effects.
  • In the classroom to keep kids active while they learn.
  • To help kids with sensory sensitivities and Autism.
  • In a small business. Make your brand more fun.
  • At your event.
Here is what our early adopters get:
  • 100+ games included.
  • A year's free Content Creation account, so you and your family can make your as many games as you want using tools designed for kids.
  • The coolest toy invented in a really long time! Join our community and help make Lumo happen!
Lumo Play is plug and play. Hang it up, turn it on, play games. It's that simple.

You can even use Lumo Play as a regular projector! Just point it at the wall and plug into the HDMI port. It's super portable, bright enough for any room with the lights off, (even during the day) and the bulb lasts 40,000 hours. Lumo supports your computer, laptop, Apple TV, Chromecast and other playback devices.

 

Lumo gets kids moving. Mobile games are here to stay, and they can be super educational and fun, but they’re passive. Kids play on Lumo’s 6’ x 4’  interactive surface by , jumping, kicking, stomping, moving, and waving their arms. They play the games they love without sacrificing physical activity.

Also… when you want to clean up the game, you just turn it off. What could be easier?

Lumo lets you design your own games. We’ve included easy content creation tools for kids and artists; no coding required. Choose the type of game or effect you want to make, and customize it with your own art. Want to make a soccer game? No problem! Draw your own field, net, and ball and save it to your Lumo. Want to create an interactive play space around a toy castle? Draw a moat, fill it with water and sharks, and project it around the castle. You can even make the sharks interactive, so they attack when something approaches your castle. Seriously cool, right?

Kids look at each other instead of at a screen. Unlike existing game consoles, Lumo doesn't hook up to a TV. This is because, with Lumo, kids actually play on and in the game, using their bodies as controllers in a way that they could never do while staring at a screen. Kicking a ball on the floor is a lot more fun than kicking a ball on a screen, trust us. :)

Lumo can also be used as a regular projector, to play movies and games. Lumo is built on the Android platform, so existing Android games can be played using a Bluetooth controller (they won't be motion reactive though—developers need to convert their games for motion, using our SDK.). For the price of a regular projector, you’re also getting an interactive play-space, games, and content creation tools—which is pretty cool, if you ask us. :)

Lumo will launch with over 100 games available - Below are examples of some of our most popular games. Making games for Lumo is easy - we use the Unity development platform.

A roadmap to hundreds more games -  Games designed for tablets using Unity can easily be ported to the motion reactive system. We’ll be working with developers to expand the variety of games available for Lumo. Even if a game isn’t motion-reactive, you can use a bluetooth controller like this one to play any existing Android game.

Our personal favorite game so far is Turtle Hockey, as seen in this demo at Folsom Street Foundry in San Francisco. The turtle gets bored and walks around if you don't kick it, adding a whole new dimension to the game.

Children can design and customize their own games for Lumo online by choosing a game template and uploading or drawing their own artwork.They can even adjust game physics using simple sliders, adjusting speed, size, gravity, and other parameters.Once they make a game, they can save it and send it to their Lumo.

We plan to launch Lumo with 10 content creation templates:Dance Game, Hockey, Soccer, Pong, Herd Things, Race, Multiple-Choice Tile Game, Scatter (effect), Squash Things (effect), and Pond (effect).

We’ll continue to release templates based on what kids and parents request.

The Lumo team has been designing tools to allow artists to make their own interactive projections for over three years. These simple templates do not require any coding, and use sliders to control behaviors like speed and size. To make game creation simpler for children, we’ve added drawing tools, and we’re currently developing an asset library. Kids create games step-by-step, in a drag & drop format, consistent with other content creation tools for young children.

Mashable
Lumo projector turns kids' bedrooms into interactive game rooms.Kids love using their imaginations to envision lava on the bedroom floor and the park as a jungle. And now, a new device called the Lumo takes these visions and projects them onto the floor, turning just about anywhere into an interactive play space.

Computer World

After all these years of "computerization," something wonderful is about to happen: Our interface to the world of computers will leap off of the screen and onto the walls, floors, ceilings, tabletops, windows and other surfaces in our homes and offices, and in public spaces.

Augmented World Expo
This week’s find is an interactive projector called Lumo. Remember when your floor was made of lava? Or when you spent hours exploring magical forests filled with imaginary creatures in your room? Well Lumo takes this imaginary game play to a whole new level by turning the real world into a magical playground for children. 

rAVe Publications
Get Ready to be Completely Blown Away by the Best Pico Projector Ever.
The vision of CEO Meg Athavale, LUMO integrates a pico-projector, Android software, a motion IR sensor and Wi-Fi into a wall-mounted sphere that makes any surface interactive for kid’s gaming. 

Sorry, all our perks are sold out! If you'd like to be notified when Lumo Play is released to the publish, sign up here!

We need to manufacture Lumo! We started developing Lumo in 2013. We are now on the 6th Lumo prototype. It’s significantly smaller than the original. Check out some of our past prototypes, and you’ll see how far we’ve come:

We’ve been funding this project with revenues from commercial work, and we’re almost there. But our team is also bigger, and we need a bunch of stuff done in factories. That’s why we’re asking for help. Here's what we need to move Lumo from prototype to manufacturing:

Lens tooling - Lumo has a bigger than average throw ratio (in order to create the biggest possible game area at the shortest possible distance). We need to have a special tool made just for Lumo so our projector gives kids a bright, wide play space.

Final DFM (design for manufacturing) - including smaller case design and integrated projector module. It’s easy to make one prototype, but now we need a design that can be replicated—and tested!—thousands of times in a factory.

SDK and app market development - we’ve expanded our team to work on the Lumo SDK development and provide direct support to a development community. We want to make sure we build developer support and resources that make sense, and that encourage game creators to participate in the Lumo project and port their hundreds of existing games to it. We also need to refine the mobile app which is used as a controller.

Factory setup - we will be choosing a factory in the next few months. We have relationships with a few. Our final choice will depend on the success of the campaign and how many Lumos we have to make. We will need things like test jigs, tools and molds.

Package design - Lumo will be sold online initially, so we won’t be spending a ton of money on a fancy package. But we do need something that passes a drop test and can withstand travel. We also need a setup document (which will be easy) and a warranty program (which will be harder).

Certification and Testing - We need to get Lumo certified before we can retail it. Since the components are all relatively common, this shouldn't be a problem, but it is an expense.

Lumo uses a simple sensor and clever programming to detect motion.This is different from solutions like Kinect and Leap Motion, which collect point cloud info using lasers. Lumo uses ambient IR light and a built-in, low resolution sensor to see whether something is moving or present on the projection area. Our patent-pending tracking algorithms do all the hard work, allowing interaction with the projected image.

Lumo hangs on the wall using a small, safe, wall mounting bracket with a child lock out of reach of tiny hands. A standard power adapter (just like a laptop adapter) plugs into the wall. The projector ball swivels, so you can also mount Lumo from the ceiling.

When you want to play movies, just release the top latch and put Lumo on the table. You can even put Lumo on a bedside table and project on the ceiling. Another stretch goal is content designed for the ceiling, to ease your child into peaceful dreams. They can count real sheep!

It’s plug and play - Lumo creates games right away. You don’t need to hook anything up. There are no controllers. Just hang it up, turn it on, and start playing.

It also plays movies - connect Lumo to your computer, Chromecast, or Apple TV via an HDMI input to watch movies and TV.

You can take it anywhere - Lumo fits in a bag. You can’t fit your TV and Xbox in a bag. Just saying.

You don’t just play Lumo; you create and customize its games - To make their own games, kids register their Lumo on Lumoplay.com and use the template tools in their account. When they’re done, they can send their games straight to Lumo.

For example, making a soccer game is three steps. 1) draw a field, 2) draw the nets and 3) draw the ball. When you're done, press a button and the game is sent to your Lumo. It's that easy.

We’ve figured out how to make toys become controllers. Lumo recognizes them, and paints them with light, changing how they look. A toy car becomes a spaceship—and catches on fire as it takes damage! We’re working on adding this tech to Lumo down the road, and if we hit some of our stretch goals, we’ll make it happen in the first release.

Children spend 40 hours per week in front of a screen, which may stunt their social and cognitive development. Lumo addresses this problem by creating compelling interactive digital experiences in the real world to help develop large motor-skills and social skills. Children look at each other while jumping, running, and moving around, instead of staring at a screen. Like zombies. Because that's disturbing, right?

Lumo's patent-pending technology makes these experiences affordable for families for the first time. You've probably seen our software in malls and museums - we've been doing this for a while. But now, we're able to do it without using an expensive computer and projector. That means your kids can play with interactive projections at home. They can even make their own games!

This needs to happen - We’ve spent three years and invested our own money to build an entirely new kind of entertainment experience for kids, because we’ve seen first-hand how much kids and adults love playing with it. And we want to get the world playing and moving again.

The Lumo team includes 7 designers, developers, and engineers with over 20 years of combined experience developing computer vision and games, and building world-class interactive installations. Together, we’ve launched a successful interactive projection software platform for artists and advertisers that’s working in thousands of locations around the world right now; and we’ve created dozens of custom installations for museums, educational institutions, and sensory labs.

We have a  deep understanding of the unique challenges of designing motion reactive projection experiences for kids. Challenges you may not have thought of, like detecting motion without lasers; making installation easy; automating complex lighting and calibration; building affordable hardware platforms; and managing remote upgrades. And of course, making games fun.

Founder and CEO Meghan Athavale has been an artist, musician, VJ, animator, and interactive designer. She’s founded two other companies in addition to Lumo. A sought-after speaker on play, immersive environments, and technology, she’s  spoken at events such as SXSW, TEDx, and Ignite, and has published a report on Data and Play for O'Reilly Media. She participated in Highway1's hardware incubator last spring to finalize Lumo’s production readiness, and has visited China to work directly with component manufacturers and factories. Meghan was recently featured on the front page of Slashdot, speaking about Lumo at SXSW Interactive.

Lumo's platform, content creation tools, and app market are being developed by the team behind the best-selling Po-motion.com interactive projection platform, launched in 2011. Meghan Athavale, Keith Otto, Curtis Wachs and Jocelyne Le Leannec invented and developed the software, website and content over a period of 3 years. While building Po-motion, Jocelyne spent her days speaking to artists, advertisers, and audio-visual installers, and relaying their suggestions to Keith and Curt, who spent years constantly improving the software interface, website, and features.

Keith Otto interviewed by Daily Planet at SXSW 2014

We've added two new software engineers to the team since we started creating Lumo. Steve Chubaty and Chris Iverach-Brereton are creating the game SDK and improving the motion detection algorithms.

Lumo's hardware was developed in the Highway 1 incubator by Pedro Pereira, who worked with Meghan to source components and integrate them into a smaller, easier form factor, and collaborated with industrial designers and concept artists to develop the case for Lumo.


Making hardware is hard, and lots of things can go wrong. Here are the three biggest risks and how we've mitigated them:

We don't raise enough to manufacture in a factory. This is a possibility; Indiegogo is a flexible funding platform and we may not reach our goal. We have set the perk price for Lumo a bit higher than we'd like because NO MATTER WHAT, we will be able to make Lumo for this price. Even if we can't make them in a factory and we're forced to make each one by hand.

We don't raise enough for lens tooling. If this happens, we will use an off-the-shelf lens. This means the throw ratio (the size of the projection) will be a bit smaller than we'd like. But Lumo will still work, and it will still be awesome.

We don't finish all the features of the software. Lumo, as it exists right now, has ten games and works on the Android platform using a mouse as a controller. We travel the world showing it to people; you can see the actual Lumo prototype in all the videos. We will launch with a mobile app so you can control, load, and create games using your phone. However, this is a pretty big project. If the hardware is done first, we may ship with a limited number of features and push updates to the software afterwards.

We know you want to help make Lumo a reality. If you can't back our project, we understand. After all, we've all been bootstrapping a hardware product for over two years (so we're not exactly rich, and we’ve eaten a lot of Instant Ramen Noodles.) Here are some other things you can do that will help us a lot:

  • Share this campaign with everyone you know, especially parents and people who work with children.
  • Back us at a lower level. Every dollar helps!
  • Follow us on Facebook! Or Twitter! Or Youtube!

Can you explain Lumo in a sentence? 
Lumo is an entirely new kind of toy that turns a floor into an interactive play space.

Can you explain Lumo in a paragraph?
Lumo is an entirely new kind of toy. It projects a large playfield onto a floor, creating colourful interactive games that get kids moving. Created over three years by a team of designers, artists, and engineers, it offers the fun and engagement of virtual worlds with the physical movement of traditional playtime.

Where did the idea come from?
For years, Lumo Play’s founders built installations and created software tools for interactive, projected environments in museums, tradeshows, schools and businesses. Parents asked for a home version, but existing solutions were expensive, complicated, and hard to maintain. Co-founder and CEO Meghan Athavale saw how much children loved playing games on tablets and computers, but wanted a way to make playtime physical again—and Lumo was born. “I remember what it was like to run, jump, and dream as a kid,” said Lumo CEO Meghan Athavale. “I wanted to make that possible again, without losing all the awesome things that video games and modern apps have to offer.”

What’s changed that makes this possible today?
Three things.
  1. The cost of computing has dropped. Mobile operating systems such as Android and Linux, and solid-state computing tools that require no cooling are much more affordable.
  2. Imaging technology is more affordable. Lumo uses an ingenious combination of infrared projection, filters, and overmapping to create a motion-reactive interface that’s self-calibrating and doesn’t consume significant computing power or introduce latency.
  3. Bright, long-life projectors. Miniature, LED-powered pico-projectors use energy efficiently, occupy less space, weigh less, and have significantly longer lifespans than traditional projectors.

How much of Lumo’s technology did you invent?
Lumo is a full-stack toy platform. The entire motion capture chain was developed by the company, and games are built atop the industry-standard Unity development tool set. Lumo uses modified off-the-shelf components to save costs where possible, but includes elements like a custom lens to create a bright, wide play field for games. The company has five patents filed (one granted) relating to motion capture, mobile projection, and augmented reality tagging. “It’s amazing how much you wind up inventing when you’re trying to create something entirely new,” said co-founder Curtis Wachs.

How long did it take you to develop Lumo?
Development of Lumo began in 2013, but much of the underlying know-how came from the founders’ experiences designing interactive installations as Lumo Interactive and creating software tools for others to build installations as Po-motion.com. Po-motion has been used by global brands, agencies, museums, and event space in over 4,000 deployments worldwide.

How do you make this kind of technology affordable?
Partly, improvements in performance and reductions in cost have come from Moore’s Law and the declining cost of components. But even with these savings, getting the cost of the platform down has taken clever engineering, repurposing common parts and writing software that makes the most of those components.

Have you taken investment to create the product?
Lumo Play has been entirely self-funded by the founding team, as well as by revenues from the operation of Po-motion and Lumo Interactive. The company received a small investment as part of their participation in the Highway 1 accelerator program in 2014, where they identified ideal components and started developing manufacturing partnerships.

Where can I use Lumo Play?
Lumo Play mounts on any ceiling or wall with a simple fixture, and requires only a wall socket for power. It’s designed for indoor play, and works best on light-coloured floors; some beta testers put down white foam tiles as a play surface to reduce slipperiness and increase reflectivity.

Where do the games come from?
Lumo Play will ship with roughly 100 games, created in the Unity development environment. Many of these are ported from Po-motion’s library of popular games and interactive scenes; others are entirely new for Lumo Play.

Can third-party developers build games?
Yes. Developers can easily port their games to Lumo Play’s motion-reactive interface. Lumo Play offers a Software Development Kit (SDK), as well as guidelines around colour and layout, to make it easy to move tap-and-swipe gestures to full-body movements, opening up a vast range of third-party applications for the toy. Even without porting games to motion reaction, those games can be played with an external controller for the device.

Can I use Lumo Play for anything else?
Lumo Play includes a full-featured pico projector, and has an HDMI interface, so it can function as an external projector for watching videos.

What ages is Lumo Play aimed at?
It’s aimed at children from 2-12 years old. Young toddlers love Lumo Play’s simple, reactive scenes and bright visuals; older children play more sophisticated games, use educational applications, and create their own custom games. The toy is designed to grow with a child, offering a range of age-appropriate games as children get older. “Making a toy that changed as a child did was a core design principle of Lumo Play,” said Meghan.

How do children create their own games?
Lumo Play includes simple web-based customization tools that let children change the artwork and design of the game. The tools are based on Po-motion’s patented Motion Maker, but completely re-engineered to be easy for children to learn.

When will Lumo Play be available to the public?
The current target for delivery is 2017, but exact times will depend on the amount of funding raised on Indiegogo, who we partner with, and how many people want one. So if you want this to happen, make sure you connect with us!
story_txt:
Here are some great ways to use Lumo Play:
In the livingroom, for active indoor play.
In a child's bedroom - they can make their own games and effects.
In the classroom to keep kids active while they learn.
To help kids with sensory sensitivities and Autism.
In a small business. Make your brand more fun.
At your event.
Here is what our early adopters get:


100+ games included.


A year's free Content Creation account, so you and your family can make your as many games as you want using tools designed for kids.


The coolest toy invented in a really long time! Join our community and help make Lumo happen!


Lumo Play is plug and play. Hang it up, turn it on, play games. It's that simple.


You can even use Lumo Play as a regular projector! Just point it at the wall and plug into the HDMI port. It's super portable, bright enough for any room with the lights off, (even during the day) and the bulb lasts 40,000 hours. Lumo supports your computer, laptop, Apple TV, Chromecast and other playback devices.



 


Lumo gets kids moving. Mobile games are here to stay, and they can be super educational and fun, but they’re passive. Kids play on Lumo’s 6’ x 4’  interactive surface by , jumping, kicking, stomping, moving, and waving their arms. They play the games they love without sacrificing physical activity.
Also… when you want to clean up the game, you just turn it off. What could be easier?





Lumo lets you design your own games. We’ve included easy content creation tools for kids and artists; no coding required. Choose the type of game or effect you want to make, and customize it with your own art. Want to make a soccer game? No problem! Draw your own field, net, and ball and save it to your Lumo. Want to create an interactive play space around a toy castle? Draw a moat, fill it with water and sharks, and project it around the castle. You can even make the sharks interactive, so they attack when something approaches your castle. Seriously cool, right?
Kids look at each other instead of at a screen. Unlike existing game consoles, Lumo doesn't hook up to a TV. This is because, with Lumo, kids actually play on and in the game, using their bodies as controllers in a way that they could never do while staring at a screen. Kicking a ball on the floor is a lot more fun than kicking a ball on a screen, trust us. :)
Lumo can also be used as a regular projector, to play movies and games. Lumo is built on the Android platform, so existing Android games can be played using a Bluetooth controller (they won't be motion reactive though—developers need to convert their games for motion, using our SDK.). For the price of a regular projector, you’re also getting an interactive play-space, games, and content creation tools—which is pretty cool, if you ask us. :)


Lumo will launch with over 100 games available - Below are examples of some of our most popular games. Making games for Lumo is easy - we use the Unity development platform.





A roadmap to hundreds more games -  Games designed for tablets using Unity can easily be ported to the motion reactive system. We’ll be working with developers to expand the variety of games available for Lumo. Even if a game isn’t motion-reactive, you can use a bluetooth controller like this one to play any existing Android game.
Our personal favorite game so far is Turtle Hockey, as seen in this demo at Folsom Street Foundry in San Francisco. The turtle gets bored and walks around if you don't kick it, adding a whole new dimension to the game.




Children can design and customize their own games for Lumo online by choosing a game template and uploading or drawing their own artwork.They can even adjust game physics using simple sliders, adjusting speed, size, gravity, and other parameters.Once they make a game, they can save it and send it to their Lumo.
We plan to launch Lumo with 10 content creation templates:Dance Game, Hockey, Soccer, Pong, Herd Things, Race, Multiple-Choice Tile Game, Scatter (effect), Squash Things (effect), and Pond (effect).
We’ll continue to release templates based on what kids and parents request.




The Lumo team has been designing tools to allow artists to make their own interactive projections for over three years. These simple templates do not require any coding, and use sliders to control behaviors like speed and size. To make game creation simpler for children, we’ve added drawing tools, and we’re currently developing an asset library. Kids create games step-by-step, in a drag & drop format, consistent with other content creation tools for young children.



MashableLumo projector turns kids' bedrooms into interactive game rooms.Kids love using their imaginations to envision lava on the bedroom floor and the park as a jungle. And now, a new device called the Lumo takes these visions and projects them onto the floor, turning just about anywhere into an interactive play space.
Computer WorldAfter all these years of "computerization," something wonderful is about to happen: Our interface to the world of computers will leap off of the screen and onto the walls, floors, ceilings, tabletops, windows and other surfaces in our homes and offices, and in public spaces.

Augmented World ExpoThis week’s find is an interactive projector called Lumo. Remember when your floor was made of lava? Or when you spent hours exploring magical forests filled with imaginary creatures in your room? Well Lumo takes this imaginary game play to a whole new level by turning the real world into a magical playground for children. 
rAVe PublicationsGet Ready to be Completely Blown Away by the Best Pico Projector Ever.The vision of CEO Meg Athavale, LUMO integrates a pico-projector, Android software, a motion IR sensor and Wi-Fi into a wall-mounted sphere that makes any surface interactive for kid’s gaming. 




Sorry, all our perks are sold out! If you'd like to be notified when Lumo Play is released to the publish, sign up here!

We need to manufacture Lumo! We started developing Lumo in 2013. We are now on the 6th Lumo prototype. It’s significantly smaller than the original. Check out some of our past prototypes, and you’ll see how far we’ve come:


We’ve been funding this project with revenues from commercial work, and we’re almost there. But our team is also bigger, and we need a bunch of stuff done in factories. That’s why we’re asking for help. Here's what we need to move Lumo from prototype to manufacturing:

Lens tooling - Lumo has a bigger than average throw ratio (in order to create the biggest possible game area at the shortest possible distance). We need to have a special tool made just for Lumo so our projector gives kids a bright, wide play space.
Final DFM (design for manufacturing) - including smaller case design and integrated projector module. It’s easy to make one prototype, but now we need a design that can be replicated—and tested!—thousands of times in a factory.

SDK and app market development - we’ve expanded our team to work on the Lumo SDK development and provide direct support to a development community. We want to make sure we build developer support and resources that make sense, and that encourage game creators to participate in the Lumo project and port their hundreds of existing games to it. We also need to refine the mobile app which is used as a controller.

Factory setup - we will be choosing a factory in the next few months. We have relationships with a few. Our final choice will depend on the success of the campaign and how many Lumos we have to make. We will need things like test jigs, tools and molds.

Package design - Lumo will be sold online initially, so we won’t be spending a ton of money on a fancy package. But we do need something that passes a drop test and can withstand travel. We also need a setup document (which will be easy) and a warranty program (which will be harder).
Certification and Testing - We need to get Lumo certified before we can retail it. Since the components are all relatively common, this shouldn't be a problem, but it is an expense.



Lumo uses a simple sensor and clever programming to detect motion.This is different from solutions like Kinect and Leap Motion, which collect point cloud info using lasers. Lumo uses ambient IR light and a built-in, low resolution sensor to see whether something is moving or present on the projection area. Our patent-pending tracking algorithms do all the hard work, allowing interaction with the projected image.





Lumo hangs on the wall using a small, safe, wall mounting bracket with a child lock out of reach of tiny hands. A standard power adapter (just like a laptop adapter) plugs into the wall. The projector ball swivels, so you can also mount Lumo from the ceiling.



When you want to play movies, just release the top latch and put Lumo on the table. You can even put Lumo on a bedside table and project on the ceiling. Another stretch goal is content designed for the ceiling, to ease your child into peaceful dreams. They can count real sheep!
It’s plug and play - Lumo creates games right away. You don’t need to hook anything up. There are no controllers. Just hang it up, turn it on, and start playing.
It also plays movies - connect Lumo to your computer, Chromecast, or Apple TV via an HDMI input to watch movies and TV.
You can take it anywhere - Lumo fits in a bag. You can’t fit your TV and Xbox in a bag. Just saying.
You don’t just play Lumo; you create and customize its games - To make their own games, kids register their Lumo on Lumoplay.com and use the template tools in their account. When they’re done, they can send their games straight to Lumo.
For example, making a soccer game is three steps. 1) draw a field, 2) draw the nets and 3) draw the ball. When you're done, press a button and the game is sent to your Lumo. It's that easy.






We’ve figured out how to make toys become controllers. Lumo recognizes them, and paints them with light, changing how they look. A toy car becomes a spaceship—and catches on fire as it takes damage! We’re working on adding this tech to Lumo down the road, and if we hit some of our stretch goals, we’ll make it happen in the first release.





Children spend 40 hours per week in front of a screen, which may stunt their social and cognitive development. Lumo addresses this problem by creating compelling interactive digital experiences in the real world to help develop large motor-skills and social skills. Children look at each other while jumping, running, and moving around, instead of staring at a screen. Like zombies. Because that's disturbing, right?
Lumo's patent-pending technology makes these experiences affordable for families for the first time. You've probably seen our software in malls and museums - we've been doing this for a while. But now, we're able to do it without using an expensive computer and projector. That means your kids can play with interactive projections at home. They can even make their own games!
This needs to happen - We’ve spent three years and invested our own money to build an entirely new kind of entertainment experience for kids, because we’ve seen first-hand how much kids and adults love playing with it. And we want to get the world playing and moving again.

The Lumo team includes 7 designers, developers, and engineers with over 20 years of combined experience developing computer vision and games, and building world-class interactive installations. Together, we’ve launched a successful interactive projection software platform for artists and advertisers that’s working in thousands of locations around the world right now; and we’ve created dozens of custom installations for museums, educational institutions, and sensory labs.
We have a  deep understanding of the unique challenges of designing motion reactive projection experiences for kids. Challenges you may not have thought of, like detecting motion without lasers; making installation easy; automating complex lighting and calibration; building affordable hardware platforms; and managing remote upgrades. And of course, making games fun.



Founder and CEO Meghan Athavale has been an artist, musician, VJ, animator, and interactive designer. She’s founded two other companies in addition to Lumo. A sought-after speaker on play, immersive environments, and technology, she’s  spoken at events such as SXSW, TEDx, and Ignite, and has published a report on Data and Play for O'Reilly Media. She participated in Highway1's hardware incubator last spring to finalize Lumo’s production readiness, and has visited China to work directly with component manufacturers and factories. Meghan was recently featured on the front page of Slashdot, speaking about Lumo at SXSW Interactive.
Lumo's platform, content creation tools, and app market are being developed by the team behind the best-selling Po-motion.com interactive projection platform, launched in 2011. Meghan Athavale, Keith Otto, Curtis Wachs and Jocelyne Le Leannec invented and developed the software, website and content over a period of 3 years. While building Po-motion, Jocelyne spent her days speaking to artists, advertisers, and audio-visual installers, and relaying their suggestions to Keith and Curt, who spent years constantly improving the software interface, website, and features.
Keith Otto interviewed by Daily Planet at SXSW 2014

We've added two new software engineers to the team since we started creating Lumo. Steve Chubaty and Chris Iverach-Brereton are creating the game SDK and improving the motion detection algorithms.
Lumo's hardware was developed in the Highway 1 incubator by Pedro Pereira, who worked with Meghan to source components and integrate them into a smaller, easier form factor, and collaborated with industrial designers and concept artists to develop the case for Lumo.





Making hardware is hard, and lots of things can go wrong. Here are the three biggest risks and how we've mitigated them:
We don't raise enough to manufacture in a factory. This is a possibility; Indiegogo is a flexible funding platform and we may not reach our goal. We have set the perk price for Lumo a bit higher than we'd like because NO MATTER WHAT, we will be able to make Lumo for this price. Even if we can't make them in a factory and we're forced to make each one by hand.
We don't raise enough for lens tooling. If this happens, we will use an off-the-shelf lens. This means the throw ratio (the size of the projection) will be a bit smaller than we'd like. But Lumo will still work, and it will still be awesome.
We don't finish all the features of the software. Lumo, as it exists right now, has ten games and works on the Android platform using a mouse as a controller. We travel the world showing it to people; you can see the actual Lumo prototype in all the videos. We will launch with a mobile app so you can control, load, and create games using your phone. However, this is a pretty big project. If the hardware is done first, we may ship with a limited number of features and push updates to the software afterwards.




We know you want to help make Lumo a reality. If you can't back our project, we understand. After all, we've all been bootstrapping a hardware product for over two years (so we're not exactly rich, and we’ve eaten a lot of Instant Ramen Noodles.) Here are some other things you can do that will help us a lot:

Share this campaign with everyone you know, especially parents and people who work with children.
Back us at a lower level. Every dollar helps!
Follow us on Facebook! Or Twitter! Or Youtube!





Can you explain Lumo in a sentence? Lumo is an entirely new kind of toy that turns a floor into an interactive play space.Can you explain Lumo in a paragraph?Lumo is an entirely new kind of toy. It projects a large playfield onto a floor, creating colourful interactive games that get kids moving. Created over three years by a team of designers, artists, and engineers, it offers the fun and engagement of virtual worlds with the physical movement of traditional playtime.Where did the idea come from?For years, Lumo Play’s founders built installations and created software tools for interactive, projected environments in museums, tradeshows, schools and businesses. Many of these are ported from Po-motion’s library of popular games and interactive scenes; others are entirely new for Lumo Play.Can third-party developers build games?Yes. Lumo Play offers a Software Development Kit (SDK), as well as guidelines around colour and layout, to make it easy to move tap-and-swipe gestures to full-body movements, opening up a vast range of third-party applications for the toy. The tools are based on Po-motion’s patented Motion Maker, but completely re-engineered to be easy for children to learn.When will Lumo Play be available to the public?The current target for delivery is 2017, but exact times will depend on the amount of funding raised on Indiegogo, who we partner with, and how many people want one. So if you want this to happen, make sure you connect with us!

story:
Meet DESi.....

DESi is an intuitive mobile application born from 2 years of research and design, brought to you from a small team of designers with big imaginations who've built an innovative platform connecting people, community, merchants, and media.

The DESi team has built a game-changing application that will collect, filter and auto-deliver the latest deals and details on fashion, cars, restaurants, electronics, program entertainment, concerts, music,  videos, news, information, broadcast and internet programming - or anything you choose - including all of the updated retail discounts and coupons promoted on broadcast, internet or mobile devices, because DESi mines all of those sources using your preferences as filters. 

You get deals, details and discounts from local, regional and national retailers in all categories, delivered efficiently and priority sensitive.


How Does DESi Work?

Once the DESi app is downloaded (iOS, Android) you simply set up your preferences profile that builds DESi’s intelligence.

Your profile information will tell DESi what to look for - it’s that simple. DESi's intuitive functionality works on your behalf 24-7, searching for Art retailers to Zumba studios and everything in between. But it's not just goods and services, it's also content, activities and people. DESi brings it all to your smartphone, tablet or PC, organized for your review at your convenience.

App Features

DESi knows you may not think of everything, so there are a lot of very cool features available to you.

Let's say you're driving in your car or watching TV and you hear a commercial. Maybe it's about a new restaurant that sounds like a perfect place to get together with your friends on Saturday night. 

'EVA'

Simply press the DESi icon on your phone or tablet and DESi's Embedded Voice Awareness ('EVA') will recognize your voice and pin the commercial/special that you just heard. The restaurant particulars, along with any discounts or coupons, are instantly delivered to you, and can immediately be shared with your friends too.

'FETCH' - Find & Retrieve

If its news or information you want, just select your location preferences and DESi will seek and find what you want through its innovative Premium Feature we call FETCH. Whether you want NYC, Austin, Texas or Billings, Montana or all three - you simply set the parameters and DESi does the rest. 

Each and every day you'll receive the news specific to NYC, Austin and Billings. FETCH will bring you the news, sports, weather, activities, travel, entertainment, movie stuff, original TV, radio and web programming neatly tucked away ready to review when you are.

'NANS' - New Artists New Songs

Another very cool Premium Feature we call NANS is a feature that brings new artists and new songs into your world. This feature seeks out the latest music based upon your preferences and categorized by genre and recording artists. NANS will bring that music to you for your enjoyment.

All new songs by current or new artists, just officially released or commercially played within the last 60 days, are batched into a music data field that DESi members can browse and load into their master music list for their enjoyment at any time.

So, whether it's fashion, sporting goods, music, restaurants or a new car, simply establish your preferences and DESi goes on the hunt for the best deals available and brings them to you. It's just that simple for you to use!

Why DESi?

Opportunity Alerts

DESi will positively enhance the lives of its members by delivering the results of the time-consuming mission to search for benefits, discounts and deals imbedded in broadcast and digital advertising 24/7 and ALERT DESi members to those opportunities that are available every day!

Incomparable Savings

DESi members never pay full price because they can take full advantage of the savings they have at their fingertips from the best deals available for the things they want and need.

Extreme Convenience

DESi filters the advertising based on member preferences and deposits the resulting benefits in an organized, time-sensitive system - alerting the member it's time to review, stress-free with total convenience!

The Gift of Time

DESi eliminates hours of aggravation and confusion from DESi members' lives, because it's all being done efficiently, quietly and digitally while members work, play or relax with family and friends.

A Digital Button-Up

DESi delivers customized news, information and entertainment programming ready for review at members convenience and readiness...no pressure...at your service!

Our Progress

DESi has built the most intelligent content-aggregating and comprehensive deal and discount filtering system that helps keep you focused on the important things in life

Your contributions and involvement in bringing DESi to the market place will play a defining role in our achieving that goal. Although important, we don't just need contributions - we need responsible, conscientious citizens who want to have a voice in the quality of products introduced into the marketplace.

DESi has been under design and development for the past 2 years, and we are reaching out to our community to help us finish the process and roll out DESi to the world - and we need your help.

We need $150,000 to finish the project and prepare the global launch. We invite you to join our family in whatever capacity you can and help us make this a reality!

Use of Proceeds

We're raising these funds to fast-track DESi into the final stages for systems integration. Wouldn't it be nice to have access to DESi tools and services for the upcoming holidays?  These funds will be allocated to start that process. 

Your support will help us cover the cost of software developer’s time, server contract commitments and systems integration and testing prior to the World market launch.Any additional funds will be allocated to the final stages of mobile app development.

We have invested well over $150,000 of our own funds for design, patent filing, software validation and programming. We're almost at the finish line, and you can help us get there.

Your Contributions - Your Rewards

DESi Founders Club ............$10.00    (See Full Perk Description)

DESi Ultimate Supporter.... $25.00     (See Full Perk Description)

DESi Life Member.................$50.00     (See Full Perk Description)

DESi Life Member Plus.......$75.00     (See Full Perk Description)

DESi Life Member ++..........$100.00    (See Full Perk Description)

                               

Life Members Get DESi Icon T-Shirts!

All DESi Life, Life + and Life ++ Members will receive, along with other great perks, the limited edition DESi Icon T-Shirt. Contribute to our campaign as a Life, Life+ or Life++ Member and receive your DESi Icon T-Shirt! This DESi Iconic T-Shirt will let the world know that you were one of the first who recognized DESi's potential!


About Us & Our Experience

DESi was created by many talented designers under the guidance of the DESi founders, collectively known as "Team DESi". Team DESi has many decades of successful experience in Advertising, Broadcast Media, IP Technology, Retail, and Customer - Oriented Business Development.

This hybridized collection of experience and intellectual property contributed to the original idea, “How can we assemble the right moving parts for consumers to get what they really want, when they want/need it, save them money, control the process and let them have fun doing it?” 

Team DESi identified those moving parts to be building a unique technology platform, incorporating merchants/advertisers/providers, integrating broadcast/internet/print/mobile media and local communities.

For two years we’ve been designing, building, and gathering all the moving parts. We welcome your help to participate in the completion of this innovative platform we call DESi.

Our Passion & Motivation

The DESi team has a passion to give back to its community and has supported many needy and worthy charities over the years and feel it mandatory to select a charity of choice for our company to support.

Once DESi has been funded and we are operating, we will annually poll our membership with a multiple - choice selection of several charities that meet our criteria. The charity selected by our members w

look for - it’s that simple. DESi's intuitive functionality works on your behalf
24-7, searching for Art retailers to Zumba studios and everything in between. But it's
not just goods and services, it's also content, activities and people. DESi
brings it all to your smartphone, tablet or PC, organized for your review at
your convenience.


App Features


DESi knows you may not think of everything, so there are a lot of very
cool features available to you.
Let's say you're driving in your car or watching TV
and you hear a commercial. Maybe it's about a new restaurant that sounds like a
perfect place to get together with your friends on Saturday night. 

'EVA' 
Simply press the DESi icon on your phone or
tablet and DESi's Embedded Voice Awareness ('EVA') will recognize your voice and pin the commercial/special that you just heard. The restaurant particulars,
along with any discounts or coupons, are instantly delivered to you, and can
immediately be shared with your friends too.

'FETCH' - Find & Retrieve

If its news or information you want, just select your location preferences
and DESi will seek and find what you want through its innovative Premium
Feature we call FETCH. Whether you want NYC, Austin, Texas or Billings,
 Montana or all three - you simply
set the parameters and DESi does the rest. 
Each and every day you'll receive the news specific to NYC, Austin and Billings.
FETCH will bring you the news, sports, weather, activities, travel,
entertainment, movie stuff, original TV, radio and web programming neatly
tucked away ready to review when you are.

'NANS' - New Artists New Songs
Another very cool Premium Feature we call NANS is
a feature that brings new artists and new songs into your world. This feature seeks
out the latest music based upon your preferences and categorized by
genre and recording artists. NANS will bring that music to you for your
enjoyment.
All new songs by current or new artists, just officially
released or commercially played within the last 60 days, are batched into a
music data field that DESi members can browse and load into their master music
list for their enjoyment at any time.
So, whether it's fashion, sporting goods, music,
restaurants or a new car, simply establish your preferences and DESi goes on
the hunt for the best deals available and brings them to you. It's just that
simple for you to use!

Why DESi?
Opportunity Alerts

DESi will positively enhance the lives of its members by delivering the results of the time-consuming mission to search for benefits, discounts and
deals imbedded in broadcast and digital advertising 24/7 and ALERT DESi members to those opportunities that are available every day!
Incomparable Savings

DESi members never pay full price because they can take full advantage of the savings they have at their
fingertips from the best deals available for the things they want and need.
Extreme Convenience
DESi filters the advertising based on member preferences and deposits the
resulting benefits in an organized, time-sensitive system - alerting the
member it's time to review, stress-free with total convenience! 
The Gift of Time

DESi eliminates hours of aggravation and confusion from DESi members' lives,
because it's all being done efficiently, quietly and digitally while members work, play or
relax with family and friends.
A Digital Button-Up

DESi delivers customized news, information and entertainment programming
ready for review at members convenience and readiness...no pressure...at your service!
Our Progress
DESi has built the most intelligent content-aggregating and comprehensive
deal and discount filtering system that helps keep you focused on the important
things in life
Your contributions and
involvement in bringing DESi to the market place will play a defining role in
our achieving that goal. Although important, we don't just need contributions -
we need responsible, conscientious citizens who want to have a voice in the
quality of products introduced into the marketplace.
DESi has been under design and development for the past 2 years, and we are
reaching out to our community to help us finish the process and roll out DESi
to the world - and we need your help.
We need $150,000 to finish the
project and prepare the global launch. We invite you to join our family in
whatever capacity you can and help us make this a reality!
Use of Proceeds
We're raising these funds to fast-track DESi into the final stages
for systems integration. Wouldn't it be nice to have access to DESi tools and
services for the upcoming holidays?  These funds will be allocated to start
that process.  
Your support will help us cover
the cost of software developer’s time, server contract commitments and systems
integration and testing prior to the World market launch.Any additional funds
will be allocated to the final stages of mobile app development. 
We have invested well over $150,000 of our own funds for design, patent filing,
software validation and programming. We're almost at the finish line, and you can help us get there.
Your Contributions - Your Rewards
DESi Founders Club ............$10.00    (See Full Perk Description)


DESi Ultimate Supporter.... $25.00     (See Full Perk Description)


DESi Life Member.................$50.00     (See Full Perk Description)


DESi Life Member Plus.......$75.00     (See Full Perk Description)


DESi Life Member ++..........$100.00    (See Full Perk Description)


                                

Life Members Get DESi Icon T-Shirts!
All DESi Life, Life + and Life ++ Members will receive, along with other great perks, the limited edition DESi Icon T-Shirt. Contribute to our campaign as a Life, Life+ or Life++ Member and receive your DESi Icon T-Shirt! This DESi Iconic T-Shirt will let the world know that you were one of the first who recognized DESi's potential!


About Us & Our Experience


DESi was created by many talented designers under the guidance of the DESi
founders, collectively known as "Team DESi". Team DESi has many
decades of successful experience in Advertising, Broadcast Media, IP
Technology, Retail, and Customer - Oriented Business Development. 
This hybridized collection of experience and intellectual property contributed to the original idea, “How can we assemble the right moving parts for consumers to get what they really want, when they want/need it, save them money, control the process and let them have fun doing it?” 
Team DESi identified those moving parts to be building a unique technology platform, incorporating merchants/advertisers/providers, integrating broadcast/internet/print/mobile media and local communities.
For two years we’ve been designing, building, and gathering all the moving parts. We welcome your help to participate in the completion of this innovative platform we call DESi.

Our Passion & Motivation


The DESi team has a passion to give back to its community and has supported
many needy and worthy charities over the years and feel it mandatory to select
a charity of choice for our company to support. 
Once DESi has been funded and we are operating, we will annually poll our
membership with a multiple - choice selection of several charities that meet our
criteria. The charity selected by our members w

story: • Morales Brazilian jiu jitsu is run by Robert Morales. Robert has a full time time job and his passion for jiu jitsu has led him to open up this academy to pass on his love for jiu jitsu. The Imperial Valley has the highest unemployment rate in all of California, as such many students find it tough to come up with the monthly fee ($40 for kids $80 for adults). Those of you in big cities know that for quality bjj instruction this is amazingly cheap. Robert constantly works with the students who are unable to afford their monthly dues. As a testament to Robert's caliber of teaching our class numbers have doubled and at some times tripled. Our current mat space cannot accomodate the children's classes and even our adults classes are impacted  by the lack of mat space and the poor condition of our mats. This creates a hazard for students young and old alike. We have tried several times unsuccesfully to raise money for mats. Please help us on our quest for new mats. Thank you.

story:
As a team, Site Expert is developing a brand new project called Plane Fight. Our goal is to reborn a classic game that gave a lot of rumors in our childhoods and launch it as a multiplayer mobile/web game. Being played then on a simple paper with just a pen in hand, now Plane Fight comes to embrace a whole new generation, a virtual war between best brains and a real challenge foll online people around the world. Once you are in, prepare yourself for a no limits career.

We already started to create this magnitude project back in August 2014, and to make it real on your devices, we need 120000 USD. This amount will help our team of web experts, android games creators, graphic arts designers and other volunteers to get the best tools and resources to make this project ready and working until May 2015. We will use all the funds in these targets, but most of it in the graphics arts, visual and sounds effects and the way that the game will responds to your best future devices. We won't let you get bored none for a second!

You put your money, you get in return the best lifetime perks.

We started this campaign after we realized what a great opportunity is to offer the world a quality game that is beyond educational or challenging. We need to offer something new, fresh, addictive, entertaining and with the power to involve your brain in it. Yes, the risks are there too and we know is not easy to raise funds, but each risk is worth it once we are 100 % sure about what we can do with these funds. Money can come and go but the impact you will get with this game will be there!

You can surely do something to help us fulfill our goal. Besides your money, you can now spread the word and make some noise about our campaign. All the help we can get is valuable. We put all our focus on quality, the high priority is to make this game face all the needs for a large numbers of players or devices.

story:
How long does it take to rebuild home?

For people of the Belarusian “Zone”, the question is still on hold.

Twenty-eight years after the Chernobyl disaster, most of the world's attention has still focused on Ukraine, where the nuclear plant lies on its border. But just few kilometers away, the vast population in Belarus that was tormented by the incident most has been left behind, with their stories waiting to be told.


Kseniya, born in 1986 near the Chernobyl plant, died
of unknown brain disease at the age of seven. "She was a very smart
kid," said her grandma Kate.


A bit about us... and how it begins


My name is Lungyin Lim, I’m a freelance filmmaker and photographer from Taiwan, now pursuing Master studies for cinema directing at the Czech film academy FAMU. I have a (Bachelor’s) degree on international politics and now I choose visual arts as a means to cover international topics. Some of my works have been published by magazines and online media in Taiwan, and I am hoping to bring my works to more audience abroad.

My collaborator Yunjie Liao is an awarded journalist, columnist and photographer based in Taiwan. Her endeavor in reporting had earned her 4 prestigious awards in journalism. After migrating from mainstream media to independent career and finishing a semi-autobiographic novel, she has traveled extensively throughout the globe, covering environmental, humanitarian, social and political issues.


Together we have worked on a 125-page reportage regarding the Ethiopian Gibe dam project <We Strive to Build Our Homes>, the contents (in Mandarin and two parts) can be seen here: Part A  /  Part B

With the help of the locals, this July we travelled into the Belarusian zone using cameras and Geiger counters in documenting the general public’s lives and thoughts. Ever since, we have been in contact with Belarusian institutions and international NGOs. We wish to return in November for a more detailed documentation, and to deliver the stories to broader awareness.

This current project is part of our continuing pursuit of this topic –how people live
with their homes, and how they deal with ongoing challenges that are about to change their lives.


Vera and her baby duck. Together with her husband
Augustus who used to serve in the Soviet navy, they are now one of the few senior couples still living in the village.

Why It Matters


The south wind that blew on April 26th 1986 brought 70% of the nuclear leakage into Belarus, polluting one fourth of the nation’s territory and more than 3,600 settlements. Ever since, newborns have suffered from gene mutation, mental deficiency, physical disability and cancer. In the vast contaminated land of over 47,000 square kilometers, radioactive level is at least seven times higher than maximum habitable standard set by the International Atomic Energy Agency.

Twenty-eight years later, two million people have still lived in these areas. The disaster has severely affected agricultural harvesting, gathering, and people’s daily lives. Children are taught not to touch the soil, pick up flowers, go into waters,
climb trees, and even to be close with the nature.  Young people from the regions are given one-to-three months overseas “healthy holidays”to get away from radiation, while many senior citizens retreat from the zone and perish with mutilation in urban shelters.

Radiation damage is a long-persisting course. Cesium-137, which contaminates the land most, has a half-life cycle of 30 years. The USSR initially claimed that the total death toll due to the Chernobyl accident was 31 people. Three decades later, estimate of associated deaths has reached over one million. The number is still rising, with many of the residents finding no way to improve their situations.

Due to financial difficulty, many relief programs have been halt since 10 years ago. The Belarusian government has altered radiation standards for agricultural products and living condition, claiming the situation is a lot more 'safe' from then. For intellectuals and artists, traumas linking to the relief process are often a forbidden topic, and related works and discussions are heavily censored by the government, making it considerably difficult for the sufferers to tell their stories from the inside. Most of them are still unknown to the outside world.

With many of the survivors fading away, we wish our involvements can help keep their words told and memories alive.

Kate returned to the zone with his son to take care of their potato field. Few people remain in the village. 

The Goal


Our aim is to conduct a web-based multi-media coverage. Utilizing our diverse backgrounds in journalism and visual arts, we attempt to deliver the reportage as a multi-media website, combining text, images, motion graphics, and audio from the location.  To demonstrate the desired effect, we provide two respected references from Magnum Photos and New York Times.

<The Places We Live> by Magnum Photos 
<A Game of Shark and Minnow> by New York Times

With this method, we invite viewers to immerse in the Belarusian scene with us, and experience the lives and thoughts of people there. The website will be delivered in both English and Mandarin versions, and we will update the contents for at least three consecutive years –across the 29th-31st anniversary of Chernobyl disaster and completion of the new Belarusian nuclear plant.

Through the Belarusian experience, we wish to document the common struggle that many of us face against vast menaces, and capture people’s persisting faith for home, albeit their littleness.

With down to earth documentation, we wish the stories of these people could provide positive references for a world with crucial choices, before they perish.


The website will contain the following elements –

  1. Text: 30000+ words coverage combining statistic information and first-hand observations. Individual stories of specific memories and lives, based on family or individual figure, will be delivered in essays of 500 words.
  2. Image: 40+ high-res images from 35mm/120 film transfer, focusing on documentation of daily lives. Plus Geiger counter images with various backgrounds across Belarus.
  3. Motion: Recorded footages that present as Video and Cinemagraph 
  4. Audio: Recorded on each location with interviews and environmental sounds, and delivered according to website design.


 
Behind the monument is the forbidden 'zone' across the river. Original residents are allowed one day per year to enter and mourn for their deceased ones. 

How We Can Make It Happen


In order to launch and complete the project, we need funds to cover the following aspects:
  • Air Transportation:$3000 USD
     - covering both visits for two people, from Taiwan and Prague. 
  • Geiger Counter: $250 USD
     - for safety and validating contamination
  • Daily Expenses: $3600 USD
     - $60 per day x 2 people x 30 Days
     - local transportation, accommodation, food, interpreter, communication etc.
  • Paperworks: $750 USD
     - visa fee, invitation letters etc.; for both visits
  • Website Design: $4000 USD
     - based on the quality demonstrated in reference websites
  • Website Maintenance: $648 USD
     - Hosting fee $18/month x 3 years
  • Translation of Bilingual web content: $2000 USD
  • Expendables: $700 USD
     - Films, accessories, payment for sensitive contents etc.
Gross amount: 14,948 USD. We wish the crowd-funding campaign can at least cover 40% of the total expense.

For your contribution, we will prepare unique local treats to share with you the warmth of the land and its people :) Lovely sweets and traditional craft items await friends that help telling the stories.

For people with outstanding contributions, individually hand-processed photo prints from the accomplished reportage will be given! With contributions at higher levels, one can have a chance to select his or her favorite images and turn them into unique postcards or gorgeous BIG color prints.

With a contribution of more than $50 USD before November 20th, one can also receive a postcard from Belarus with our greetings!

Youngsters on a two-day shift at the state-owned farm 18 kilometers from Chernobyl Plant. The farm has 367 cattle and supplies nearby towns with dairy products.

As for the risks


Some Belarusians often joke about their country being the "last dictatorship of Europe". Government control of free expression is significantly high, and freedom of speech in the nation is still among the lowest in Europe. (You can refer to World Press Freedom Index by Reporters Without Borders, Democracy Index by the

Economist Intelligence Unit, and other freedom indices) Discussion of topics regarding Chernobyl aftermath and future of nuclear energy has been under tight censorship. With the fear of being beaten and jailed by the government, people are often afraid of carrying out public demonstrations of expressing criticism.


As we attempt to maintain in low profiles while proceeding with the project inside Belarus, there are still potential difficulties gathering sources for information. In the worst case, actions by the local authorities might limit the extent to which the project can be accomplished. We have experience working in places with authoritarian regimes around the world, and will strive to ensure the best outcomes given such circumstance.

In the unfortunate case which stops us from accomplishing the entire goal, the remaining fund will be donated to organizations that have long devoted to Chernobyl relief. You can find some of these dedicated organizations here.  
 

Radiation reading at the dairy farm. Yearly dosage that the workers here receive will exceed the 1 mSv standard set by IAEA. As mentioned above, the farm also supplies milk for the nearby towns.

Help us do more 


We sincerely wish that with your contribution, these stories can bring positive changes, and furthermore foster new thoughts that relates to our homes.

Please help us reach more possibilities by sharing this campaign with your friends and people you think that can help make it happen :) You can use the share buttons found on the beginning of the page to mail it, post it, link to it, and follow our new updates. Please spread the word.


With your participation, we keep the stories alive.


Thank YOU.


Lungyin Lim
16 Oct. 2013 @Prague, Czech Republic

story:
(International supporter please scroll down!)

Meine Geschichte ist schnell erzählt:

Jedes Tokenset, das ich bisher gesehen habe, erschien mir unausgelichen und passte nicht zu meinem Spielstil. 

Einzeln kaufen ist nur selten möglich, selbst dann sind sie teuer und doch nicht so flexibel, wie man es gerne hätte.

Nun kommt diese Kampagne ins Spiel: Wählt einfach die Tokens aus, die ihr braucht!

Ihr braucht keine Tarntokens? → wählt "Keine Tarntokens" aus. 

Ihr braucht dafür 10 Evade-, 7 Fokus-, 3 Stress? → Wählt 10 Evade-, 7 Fokus- und 3 Stresstokens aus.

Baut euch euer TokenSet in den Größen 30/60 und 90 - so wie ihr es braucht!

Nun seid nur noch ihr gefragt um den besten Preis zu ermöglichen!

Nur euer Beitrag ermöglicht es, die Tokens herzustellen.

Nachdem alle Gebühren bezahlt sind, fließt der Restbetrag zu 100% in die Herstellung!

Alles wurde in Deutschland konzipiert und wird auch ausschließlich in Deutschland hergestellt!

Level 1:

Level 1 beinhaltet ein Set aus 1 Maßstab, sowie einem Maßstab der geteilt ist.
Ihr wählt die Farbe des Acryls, zusätzlich ist es möglich pro Segment bis zu 15 Zeichen zu gravieren.


Level 2:

Level 2 beinhaltet 30 Tokens aus den Verfügbaren. Ihr könnt frei wählen welche Tokens ihr haben möchtet und in welcher Farbe.
Achtung: Targetlock Tokens zählen als 2 Tokens.
Nach erfolgreicher Kampagne könnt ihr jedes Token einzeln wählen!
Es stehen euch 4 Stile zur Verfügung!

Level 3:

Level 3 beinhaltet einen kompletten Satz von Manöverschablonen, ihr könnt die Farben einzeln wählen:
Das sind 3 Wendemanöver, 3 Drehmanöver sowie 5 Geraden/Koiogran-Wenden. Zusätzlich beinhaltet Level 3 noch einen Maßstab.
Der Maßstab kann pro Segement mit bis zu 15 Zeichen graviert werden. 
Die Manöverschablonen können auf Kundenwunsch auch mit einem Logo graviert werden, zusätzlich können 10 Zeichen graviert werden. Auf der Geraden 1 sind nur 3 Zeichen möglich.

Level 4:

Level 4 ist identisch zu Level 3 jedoch könnt ihr hier aus dem Sortiment 60 Tokens wählen.

Level 5:

Level 5 ist identisch zu Level 4 jedoch mit weitern 30 Tokens, Somit könnt ihr unglaubliche 90 Tokens wählen und das in euren Wunschfarben.

Level 6:

Level 6 kombiniert Level 2 und Level 3 zu einem Paket mit Preisvorteil!

Level 7:

Level 7 kombiniert Level 3 und Level 4 zu einem Vorteils Paket.

Level 8:

Level 8 kombiniert Level 3 und Level 5 zu einem Vorteils Paket.

Level 9:

Level 9 kombiniert Level 1 & 3 sowie 5 zu einem Ultimativen Komplettset für euer X-Wing Spiel!

Movement Templates:

Logogravur Beispiele:


Tokens:

Wir verwenden für die Herstellung lediglich hochwertiges Acrylglas von Evonik!


Der Versand innerhalb Deutschlands beträgt pauschal 3 Euro.
Die Sets werden mit der Deutschen Post als Briefsendung versendet.
Weltweit beträgt der Versand 7 Euro.
Bitte fügt den entsprechenden Betrag hinzu!

Bei dieser Kampagne bestehen kaum Risiken.

Lediglich das Material muss angeschafft werden, alle Schnittmuster sind bereits fertig und getestet. 
Ebenso stehen alle Maschinen zur Verarbeitung zur Verfügung.

Somit bleiben als Risikofaktoren nur die Verzögerung im Versand!

For international supporter:

My story short:

Every tokenset out there seems to be unbalanced and didn't fit my needs.

Most sellers don't provide buying one by one, and if they provide it. it's expensive.

Now there's this campaign, you can choose what ever tokens you need.

You don't need cloak tokens? → Don't choose any!

You need 10 evade-, 7 focus-, 3 stress tokens? → Just choose 10 evade-, 7 focus-, and 3 stress tokens.

Just build it your way. There are sizes with 30/60 and 90 tokens.

Now it comes to you, with your help I am able to bring the best price to you!

Without your contribution unfortunately it's not possible to produce the tokens! 
So everything depends on you.


After all fees are paid, 100% of the money goes straight into the production!

Every token is designed in Germany and will be produced in Germany.

 → So 100% made in Germany!

Level 1:

Level 1 contains one set consisting of one rangeruler and one rangeruler cut into two parts one and 2 segments.

You choose the color of the acrylic, additonal it is possible to engrave up to 15 character on each segment.

Level 2:

Level 2 consists of 30 tokens. You can freely choose which tokens and which color for every single token!

Attention: Targetlock tokens count as 2 tokens.

Level 3:

Level 3 contains a complete set of movement-templates, you can choose the color for every single template.

The set consists of 3 banks, 3 hardbanks, and 5 straights.

The rangeruler can be engraved with up to 15 letters.

The templates if you wihs they can be engraved with rebel-, empire and scumicons. They can be engraved with up to 10 letters. The straight 1 has only space for 3 letters.

Level 4:

Level 4 is identical with level 3 but you can choose 60 instated of 30 tokens.

Level 5:

Level 5 is identical with level 4 but you get 30 extra tokens. So in total you can choose 90 unbelievable tokens in the color of your wish.

Level 6:

Level 6 is a combination of level 2 and level 3.

Level 7:

Level 7 is a combination of level 3 and level 4.

Level 8:

Level 8 is a combination of level 3 and level 5.

Level 9:

Level 9 combines level 1 & 3 and 5 to a ulitmate set for your X-Wing game!

Movement Templates:

Tokens:

For the production we only use high quality acrylic glas of "Evonik"!

Available Colors:


Shipping inside of Germany is only 3€ with "Deutsche Post" as "Briefsendung".
Worldwide shipping costs 7€.

This campain has very low risks as all the machines are already here.

Only the material has to be bought, every element is already finished and tested.

Only the shipping might be a problem. But if this is the case, I'm sure that we'll find a solution.
story_txt:
(International supporter please scroll down!)






Meine Geschichte ist schnell erzählt:
Jedes Tokenset, das ich bisher gesehen habe, erschien mir unausgelichen und passte nicht zu meinem Spielstil. 
Einzeln kaufen ist nur selten möglich, selbst dann sind sie teuer und doch nicht so flexibel, wie man es gerne hätte.
Nun kommt diese Kampagne ins Spiel: Wählt einfach die Tokens aus, die ihr braucht!
Ihr braucht keine Tarntokens? → wählt "Keine Tarntokens" aus. 
Ihr braucht dafür 10 Evade-, 7 Fokus-, 3 Stress? → Wählt 10 Evade-, 7 Fokus- und 3 Stresstokens aus.
Baut euch euer TokenSet in den Größen 30/60 und 90 - so wie ihr es braucht!

Stretch Goals

$4000 - Computer and Software Development Programs

$5500 - Register Business, Domain and Trademarks

$6000 - Add Facebook/Twitter interaction to Sweet Machine, allowing you to brag about high scores and accomplishments.

$10,000 - Adittional computer for graphics team

$20,000 - Gaphics enhancement software

$30,000 - Obtain rights to use music and develop sound effects

$45,000 - Increase number of levels for Sweet Machine from 50 to 80 for initial release

$60,000 - Add 1st DLC, 2nd set of levels

$70,000 - Marketing, Advertising and Promotions

$80,000 - App will be lauched at $0.99 pricepoint

$100,000 - Add 2nd DLC, 3rd Factory

$110,000 - App will be Launched as a free app

story:
SportsBeep is a daily fantasy sports application that brings funded play and cutting edge technology to the fantasy sports market. With SportsBeep’s easy-to-use platform and unique games, it can attract a spectrum of players from the aspiring beginner to the seasoned fantasy guru.

 SportsBeep has been advertised on various media networks. Watch our crowd-funding video below to see how Pete Rose has partnered to be our official spokesperson.






SportsBeep's platform is so straightforward that anyone can use it! But if you're still skeptical, take a look at our quick tutorial video and see for yourself.


We now have a beta test! Check it out here:  https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/play-test-th...

SportsBeep looks to change the dynamic of how fantasy sports are played. By creating a platform that is simple to use, SportsBeep allows for even the most inexperienced of gamers to interpret its operation. With no time-consuming drafts or season long commitments, it offers a payout structure where 7 out of 10 players win! To add to SportsBeep’s monetary user benefits, we’ve designed a built-in Referral Commissions Program.  The program encourages users to utilize their social network of friends and in turn, SportsBeep rewards them a dividend for up to 7 levels of referral generations.



Third place gets $1,000! Second place $2,500! First place gets $5,000 and be featured in our SportsBeep Commercial and on our website!

Get the Templates Here  https://www.dropbox.com/s/ul34dij442coycz/Video%20Contest.zip
