story:
Short Summary                                                            

On a recent vacation, my wife, Ann, and her friend, Judi, noticed numerous different specialty tags on cars roaming Florida’s roads and parking lots. They saw so many different license plate styles that they had a contest to see who could spot the largest number of them adorning automobiles. To make the contest more interesting, Ann and Judi wagered a dinner at a fine restaurant for the one who spotted a certain obscure plate (that shall remain nameless) first.

Being the geek that I am, I constructed an actual game book for them and others to use in playing the game and printed prototype copies on a color laser printer. I gave copies to families with children who were visiting Florida and to retirees who live or winter there. Their response was so positive that I’ve decided to make the game available to the public, but that requires making an expensive print run of at least 1,000 books.

This campaign is to raise money to pay part of the cost of the print run. All contributors will receive actual copies of the game; larger contributors get more copies. My hope is that contributors find it in their hearts to each give away one copy to someone they think will enjoy playing the game.

What We Need & What You Get

Indiegogo’s smallest campaign is for $500, an amount that would definitely get this project off the ground. The more that is contributed, the more copies can be printed. What you get out of this beside the satisfaction of helping launch this educational game is acquiring copies of the game at much less than retail price because there is no middle man. Also, shipping expenses cost proportionately less when more games are in the shipment. We will have games printed and sent to contributors regardless of how successful the campaign is. If unsuccessful, we will just have fewer printed. There is no risk on your part; you are guaranteed to receive games if you contribute.

The Impact

Children need interesting activities to occupy them on long drives. Adults and children alike enjoy spotting license plates on parked cars when they go walking. Once a particular tag is spotted, the spotter can look it up on the Internet to learn more about the organization or cause. I have learned about organizations I didn’t previously know existed.

Your contribution will help make this game available for others. We’ve set the perk levels low to be affordable for everyone.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you’re not interested in playing the game or giving copies to friends, children, or grandchildren, you can support the project by telling others who might be interested about it. Indiegogo provides share tools to help to help spread the word on campaigns you find interesting. Direct people to this campaign by sending them its shortlink: igg.me/at/FLPG.

story:
LESS is a simple strategy board game for two or four players. It's a simple game which can be set up in seconds and the rules can be learned in less than a minute. It's both fun and challenging to play, and can also be a beautiful addition to every game lover’s collection. Just set-up the nine board tiles, place the game pieces in their starting position and you’re ready to go! The goal is to move your four pieces to the opponents starting corner before they move into yours.  

The rules are ridiculously simple - you can easily learn them by watching this short video:


DOWNLOAD THE RULES HERE

The board is set up randomly at the beginning of every game giving you over 100,000 combinations to experience. Less can also be expanded into a four-player game by adding another set of tiles to the deck and another set of game pieces (of different height to easily tell them apart) for the other two players. Players split up into teams of two and work together to bring both sets to the opposite side before the other team can beat you to it.

Still not convinced? You can try out an online version of Less with your Facebook friends! Visit our Facebook page or click HERE.
The illustrations featured on the back of the playing board were made by one of the most successful and well-known Slovenian artists, NatanEsku. He is a multitalented craftsman with an interest in painting, design, illustration, sculpture and photography. NatanEsku is always trying to work with environmentally friendly and recycled materials. The work chosen by Less features a wide range of creative designs with distinct details and colorful elements. The figures found within these designs tell their own unique story.

Aside from the basic design used for the original LESS board, you can choose between a variety of illustrations, which all carry a designer’s signature within the details.

After the campaign ends we will send out a survey where you will be able to choose from the following three designs:

Additionally, you can also choose from these three designs that were chosen through a contest prior to the launch of our Kickstarter campaign on our Facebook page:

The materials used for the game pieces were carefully chosen - they’re made out of all natural walnut and beech wood and don’t contain any artificial parts. The simple look and natural feel makes Less a beautiful addition to any home.

The double-pack and the six-pack also come with a specially designed gift sleeves - this way you can give an extra set of Less as a gift to your loved ones. Just in time for the holiday season!

Less can be used in a variety of ways. While out on the town with friends, having dinner or a drink at your favorite bar, Less is the perfect game to bring along. The playing board cantransform in to drink coasters, which makes Less a great addition to enjoying a beer and connecting with friends. Whether you’re a board game enthusiast or a beer lover, everyone can enjoy Less.

Less was created by Aleksandr Starovojtov, a man who is a fan of board games and also fully aware of the importance of rest and relaxation. A few years ago, Aleksandr went on vacation with his family to the seaside, and unfortunately forgot all of their family games at home. Eager to find a solution, he grabbed some beer coasters from the local bar and created the very first version of Less. Aleksandr experimented with the coaster board and developed the rules as he went along. Upon arriving back home he started playing the game with his friends and got a wave of positive feedback. From there he developed the game and Less was born!

In September and October 2015 Less was successfully featured on Kickstarter, where we raised $48,411 in 40 days, more than 1200% of our initial goal of $4,000. You can check out our campaign and everything related to it HERE.
